Summary Heading: From "did this just really happen?" file...
Summary: This is truly a first for us. We're usually quick to praise & hesitant to criticize especially when it pertains to the costumer/ hospitality industry. We also believe that the pen can be mightier than the sword so here it goes: We were on a shoot in the Santa Ana, CA area - ironically about "The Best of the OC" -  and our client put us up at the La Quinta Inn & Suites, John Wayne Airport. From the very start we got the impression that the staff here is bothered by their guests. Figuring our interactions would be limited we set our initial impressions aside. Due to the major storms Southern California experienced the last two weeks we were forced to extend our stay beyond our original production timeline. During that time our prominent client who directly booked  our stay from

Room is just OK, front desk personnel are the worst. The few times I had to interact with them they made me feel as if I was bothering them. The breakfast was just okay, scrambled eggs and sausage, the next day scrambled eggs and sausage patties.

Summary Heading: Clean, close to airport, good breakfast.
Summary: Clean rooms, hotel is close to airport, good breakfast. The pool and courtyard area looked wonderful but it was pouring rain and we were on a tight schedule. The staff was friendly. A free shuttle and parking were available.

Our flight was canceled and we needed unexpected accommodations. This was rated as a 3 star hotel, but I would rate it as no more than 2 stars. If all you want is cheap, then this is your place. I’m not sure they know what customer service is as the front desk treated me as if I was bothering them. Once you get past the nicer lobby area, the rest of the hotel is worn out, dirty and in need of repair. Our room had an awful smell. The couch was worn, sagging and there was a huge stain on the floor. We were too tired to move, so we stayed one night. I do not recommend not would I ever stay there or at another LaQuinta. I am shocked Wyndham is associating their brand with this dump.

Patricia, the manager at that hotel, does not understand the policies she forces on guests.  Very inconsistent and mistreat her employees and guest like no body.  She ought to be replaced immediately. TY

Summary Heading: Not a great start to a family trip to CA
Summary: checking in at 1am with my family to rooms that were not cleaned or the right room type. My Fathers room literally had a used bathroom and desk area. My room smelled like smoke and was two doubles instead of a king. We were told they had no other rooms to switch us to while in the morning the next day we were told it was not sold out. WE HAD TO SAY IN USED DIRTY ROOMS. Horrible experience traveling with family on a fun trip that started out horrible because of this property.

To be fair, my family stayed one night.  The room was larger than a standard room, hence 3 stars. Secured a good rate (for a 3 star hotel) and brought copy of reservation, just in case.  Front desk was courteous and helpful ( believe her name was destiny).  When I asked for an extra pillow, she added a blanket-thoughtful, thank you.  Breakfast was satisfying and overall the place looked clean, at least during our stay. My only regret was that I didn't book this place last year and opted to stay at a 2 star or less hotel.

Washer broke the whole time there,5 days. Smelled like marijuana all in the room and bathroom when light and fan were turned on. We found dried skinless chicken in the closet were the Iron was hanging on it's holder. Carpet was coming unraveled, and we did not get the rolled-in shower as requested told it was at front desk.

Summary Heading: Poop found on sheets under the covers!
Summary: I stayed  at La Quinta Inn and Suites for two days for business with a group.  I found "Feces-poop" on the sheets in bottom of my bed under the bedspread.  This means that the staff did not change the bed sheets since a previous guest.  How disgusting I was to discover this after I had slept in the bed for two nights!  Also- another business associate was followed into the stairwell, another had to move his room 3 times.  The manager will not answer my calls.  You are taking your chances staying at this hotel!
Room tip: Choose another hotel.  Check the room and sheets before you stay.

Summary: Rooms smell, bathroom smell. Need to dump your own trash and ask for fresh towels. Room doors are hard to open. Between dumping used bath towels and trash outside your room, not very sanitary. Would not recommend

Honestly, the front desk staff were entirely rude and dismissive throughout the entirety of my stay. Upon arrival they could not locate my reservation (which was prepaid) and insisted on charging me AGAIN to a different card. This ultimately led me to be late to the conference I was in town to attend. Once they finally did sort out my reservation issues, my husband and I went to our room only to find our issued key cards didn't work. The front staff insisted that I was not using the card correctly, and were not at all happy with me when I firmly said that I knew how to use them and they didn't work. Finally, they issued me two new cards which thankfully did work. During our stay while I was attending my conference my husband attempted to purchase snacks from the front desk (with

Staff were nice upon check in room was modern and big had a great time will definitely be coming back. Breakfast was great with waffales eggs and suassage buffet style. I highly recommend this hotel for others .

Trying to book a room and call the front desk, the representative who picked up the phone was super rude. I asked if they have rooms for 5 people, and she was like no, we don't then hang up the phone. Glad I did not book before I call.

Summary Heading: Absolutely the most disgusting hotel stay I've ever experienced
Summary: I needed a hotel for one night before flying out from Santa Ana airport in the morning, and this was one of only 2 that had available rooms. The young lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful - which is fortunate as she must have lots of unhappy people. The first room I was sent to reeked horribly of cigarette smoke, such that I couldn't even walk into the room, she quickly and politely relocated me. The second room that I received still smelled quite stale, and was in disrepair and dirty - honestly, I tried my best to not touch anything. The elevator was filthy and had at least 3 dead cockroaches on the floor. The trash cans were overflowing. There was a large group (20+) of people using the pool, who seemed to all be related and who had brought coolers of food and

Summary Heading: Wouldn’t wish this place upon my worst enemy
Summary: No blanket No fresh towels Tv didn’t work   No AC  -Asked more than a handful of times only for them to tell us it was broken on the 5th night (mind you we stayed for 7)  -Double charged and have yet to feel any sense of relief. After the 3rd time of bringing it up the front desk replied with “oh f*^*)” as if they had no recollection of the situation.  Staff communication was terrible. On the site it says shuttle service to and from LAX. Spoke to front desk before our departure date, got both our check out time and shuttle time wrong- ended up paying for a $75 Uber to the airport.   Advice; this place is surrounded by other hotels, take a look around

Room flooded out while we were at dinner! Room was dirty! Parking lot was full of broken glass! Breakfast was crawling with homeless people stealing breakfast! Breakfast person was more interested in chatting with the front desk personnel!

Summary Heading: Not meet La Quinta Inn expectations
Summary: Have stayed at many La Quinta hotels.  While the price point is lower than others in the area, this hotel is lacking basic cleanliness.   Walkways littered with trash, landscaping around hotel severely lacking, and room was a 2 out of 5 with respect to being clean and comfortable.   Room was not vacuumed, had small trash on the ground? And AC barely cools the room. Room was large with ample space but bed and couch were worn and need to be replaced.   No pm food options.  Had to go next door to Embassy Suites to have dinner. Entry light switch in room did nothing and was dark.

Will definitely stay at a LA Quinta hotel anytime I travel. Nice workers, not too expensive. Rooms are nice and roomy. Pool was also a bonus cause the ocean in California was ice cold so we could not get in the ocean at all.

Great staff, clean property & room, convenient, 12 pm checkout, and good breakfast! They made it super easy to check in and check out! Great value for the price. Nice area with no traffic. Clean pool and jacuzzi with multiple outdoor seating areas. Will definitely be back

Summary Heading: Not too bad but staff seems like they hate their jobs.
Summary: Not too bad but staff seems like they hate their jobs.  We booked a 5 night stay for my husband and I and two small fur babies.  When I made reservation it was just explained to me that it would be $20 per dog per night to to exceed $40 per stay.  The front desk girl said that they charge 20 per dog per night which totaled out to be $200 (That was charged as a separate transaction not with the total of our stay)! My husband was already scared bc the day we left to go on vacation the reviews on multiple websites had bad reviews, but we decided to check it out.  Once we got to our room,it was clean and all appliances were working.  It was clean. So we were heading out to grab some dinner, and I returned to the front desk to show her step by step from Google to hotel policies.  She

This place was just ok, not really a place I'd recommend if I had been there before. The hotel itself needs a lot of work. It doesn't seem like they care about keeping it up at all. The room itself wasn't too bad except the couch was not comfortable at all.

Summary Heading: Good bang for buck on Hotel Circle
Summary: This recently remodeled chain lodging offers a very good  value for the Santa Ana/Hotel Circle area and Orange County in general. I often stay here for a brief overnight on business and have found it clean and mostly quiet. Rates are usually competitive with other hotels in the area. Not the nicest area but the parking lot is well lit and patrolled. Staff is very pleasant and  helpful. Rooms have modern furnishings, beds could be more comfy but climate control works efficiently and quietly.  Good bargain if you’re flying in/out of OC John Wayne Airport: there are closer hotels but they are generally more expensive and charge surprise parking fees not disclosed on their own or third-party booking websites.

It was a very bad experience.  We stayed there for one night and, although it did not fully meet our expectations, we had decided to return for a stay of another 5 days.  We booked a week in advance, asking for accommodation identical to the one we had used for a family of 4: 2 adults, a boy and a 9-year-old girl.  On our return they gave us a room with a single double bed instead, which was not good for us.  Faced with our complaints, they told us that there were no other rooms.  The reception staff did not show the slightest cooperation or form of help.  They abandoned us without worrying in the least.  Truly low-level behavior that cannot be received in a rich and evolved state like California.

Nice and convenient location, comfortable beds, great breakfast and helpful staff members, plenty parking, nice surroundings and a lot of fast food places, only if don't want to be bothered with loud noise get a room looking outward

For some reason front desk staff checked me out by accident. I ended up wasting my time to rebook new reservation. Most importantly security came to my room at 2:30am in the morning wanting to break-in my room saying that I didn't register to stay here even though I paid for the whole thing. I was like what the heck is going on😂 That's really annoying and unprofessional. This kind of ruined my vacation mood because I couldn't sleep well that night. I only found out the reason he/she checked me out by accident when I talked to the manager in the morning. She only apologized for what had happened.

Clean comfortable room, made even better by caring people doing a nice job on a busy July 4th weekend. Shuttle service to and from the airport was timely and friendly.  Thanks, LaQuinta, you delivered.

Summary Heading: Great La Quinta Inn to stay in while in Orange County - bring Fido along - I did and had a great time!
Summary: Had a planned trip that was both business and personal so packed up the dog and the spouse and off we went.  Did a little work time in the room on fast wifi and then off to beach time too in Huntington Beach which only 20 minutes away.  The rooms at this hotel are large and very clean.  Quiet too - couldn't here the neighbors so a nice amenity there.  Breakfast is well prepared and your pup stays free, which is just fantastic.  When in OC with Fido in tow, this is a great place to stay.  Staff is very helpful and accommodating - great front desk staff!

This is the friendliest staff and cleanest hotel I have stayed at in a long time. I do a lot of traveling and always stay at this hotel when staying in OC. This is a very clean hotel and sanitary hotel!!!

Summary Heading: Great potential that didn't quite reach it.
Summary: I would stay here again. Safe area. There were a few problems: they ran out of food (we waited and they brought more food out but they didn't plan well according to the reservations they had); trash on the side of the building. Not enough cushions to match chairs. The key pad didn't work and it was a bit of a hassle.  The good stuff: The staff as very nice, pool/hot tub was clean. Good temperatures. Safe area. Not in walking distance of anything however. 20 minutes to the beach. The are still protecting everyone and staff from COVID which at this point is not necessary. They don't clean the rooms in between nights because of "covid issues."

The first room was not cleaned, so I had to switch rooms.  Because I was switched, the service worker improperly switched me in the system and therefore someone else checked into the room while I was away for the day.  Security was called but we still couldn't get into the room.  Just a horrible experience and with the service worker gas lighting me the entire time.

Summary Heading: They gave our room to someone else during our stay
Summary: Upon arrival they gave us room when someone else was clearly using it. Bed was unmade and there was trash all over. It smelled disgusting. They gave us another room which also smelled bad and the next day when we came back, our room was locked with deadbolt inside. When we asked for help, we were gaslighted the whole time. Seriously f this place.

The room smells so bad and the sheets and towels was not clean  and they had a bad smell in them I really had a bad time staying there but the breakfast was okay if I had to  book again for sure  I won’t

I stayed in the hotel for the whole week without room cleaning service and I have to catch the lady who goes around to clean the room to exchange the towels.  The hotel said that because of COVID so they don't clean the room.

I changed course from staying at a Hilton chain property to save a little money. HUGE mistake. The room smells horrible, like cat pee and cigarette smoke combined. There is a questionable stain on the floor, holes in the linens. So not digging this place.

Although the room renovations look nice, overall this place still feels a bit low quality. The check-in staff couldn't be bothered to greet us and seemed irritated to be checking us in. Loud/partying guests next-door and on the balcony also made for an uncomfortable night with our 1-year old.

Dirty, Room smelled like urine with homeless and drug users hanging out on the property. Tv and fridge not working and the main door knob was very loose, had a hard time trying to open our room. Not happy at all!!

Poor overall.   The room's walls were thin.  The first night I could hear someone snoring all night long, and the 2nd night someone was throwing up all night.   The AC was loud, bed was laying on a slope and lumpy and pillows were hard.  And the mask issue was over kill and staff rude about everything

Do not! I repeat… DO NOT stay here if you don’t want a pathogenic infection. Just being in the room made my asthma kick in that I couldn’t stay in the room. The room smells of smoke. The mattress was stained with urine, feces and dried blood. The bed sheets were not changed and had pubic hairs all over. The floor was so dirty my socks turned black. I would just stay away from this place and stay at a Hampton inn or something of good value.

1) Terrible service at front desk during both check-in and check-out  2) I was mistakenly charged an extra $50 for no apparent reason   3) Air conditioning was not working and weather was super hot, hit the 100s  4) Noisy; can hear people talking and coming down/walking up the stairs.

Summary Heading: Crazy person breaking room windows and police adventure!
Summary: Besides the drug induced breaking glass, blood, screaming help me help me floorshow, the trash bins were overflowing everywhere and they need more staff and security.  Common sense says help someone screaming help me help me, but then ya got a dozen policemen running around looking for him, so felt sort of stupid standing with my hotel room card in my hand...haha, what a night.  Firetruck was nice too, and all the blinking lights.  I worried cause all the 3rd floor broken glass drama was above my parked car.  They need more staff.

So chose this place as overall we have stayed at La Quinta because they are dog friendly and overall decent for the price. This place looked ok when driving up in the morning, come night time there were a lot of shady people around. At 11:30pm we here screaming, loud screaming. Police, ambulance and fire all showed up. Not only did we feel extremely anxious from seeing the people earlier now we are straight up in danger. So can’t even complain about anything else as we have gotten no sleep. DO NOT STAY HERE especially if you are a single female or a family!!!!

Very dirty place, everything was broken from doors noobs to bathroom door. The manager was very rude. Breakfast was not appealing. Overall this place needs improvement!! Broken furniture, rooms smells very bad.

Summary Heading: This is by far one of the worst Quinta  we have stayed at. The place is outdated, dirty and unsafe.
Summary: This is the most dirty Quinta ever! This place feels very unsafe. Pretty much anyone can walk in and wonder off at the property. One of the Reims close to us got broken into and they lost all of their belongings. The hotel requires mask but aren’t able to provide one. The breakfast bar is a joke. During our stay they were out of most items. The sitting area is close so there’s no place to sit but outside. The staff always has an attitude toward everyone! The beds had stains and the shower barely had pressure. The room had a terrible smell like mold.

Summary Heading: Catalytic converter stolen from parking lot
Summary: Stayed there for business in early Jan 22 and woke up one morning to a very noisy rental car , then realized that the catalytic converter was stolen from my rental car. There is also a large amount of homeless wandering around the general area

Make sure you have a mask on your face, or you won't be able to check in. I had requested from the front desk to have two pillows brought to the room. The request was made about 6:00 pm. The pillows never arrived.  The key cards failed to work several times.  Had to be reprogramed. I had to get a mask from a stranger. We were on motorcycles and lost our masks. Maybe have extras for guests in the event they are not aware of mask requirements from out of state.

Our bed sheets were dirty with make up from the previous room renters.  The carpet was filthy and there were empty used toilet rolls under the bathroom vanity furniture.   They gave us 'clean' new sheets but our bed was king size and they gave us queen size claiming they didn't have anymore king size.  They didn't have extra pillows or pillow cases.   Just a bad unpleasant experience.

Rude staff. Did not get the room I booked because the hotel over booked, so instead of 2 beds for 4 people, we had 1 bed and a wonky, uncomfortable couch.  Hotel ran out of pillows and the 4 guests on my reservation had to share 3 pillows, but maintenance brought by empty pillow cases and sheets for us to make our own pillows so that was thrilling.  Garbage experience. 10/10 do not recommend. Pay the extra money somewhere else. Lesson learned.

Walls are paper thin. Listened to a couple's intimacy all night long. Also there is a stray cat they feed that meows in the middle of the night. Dogs are allowed and we know this because we heard that too. Breakfast is unorganized. I have been traveling all month and this is the first place that had all table seating closed. The room looked remodeled but still lots of spots on rugs and couch. Slight smell in room. Door lock key only worked intermittently. The shuttle to the motel was on time and good. They insist on masks which I am okay with but the guy behind the counter checking us in thought it was only for his mouth and chin. He was distracted by what was going on next to him and just gave us the key with no words. He did not say where the room was or the time for

The hotel room was clean, nice and a great location near amusement parks. However, our room’s heater was not working and it was a cold night.  The employee did give us a credit for the inconvenience and was happy that they did something.

I spent 2 nights, New years Eve and Day. The rooms are large and well appointed. The rooms face open walkways that look over either the parking areas or the interior courtyard with pool.  I was given a room on the 3rd floor directly above the hotel lobby.  A large wall extended upwards so my room just looked out to a dark wall.  There was no lighting in the walkway and garbage was piled up in the corner of this wall.  The room are all non-smoking, but my room reeked of cigarette smell.  It was late, I had my dog with me so decided I would be safe enough.  I am a single female age 64.  There are 2 elevators, but one had no lights working inside, just  a dark cavern.  the next morning I noticed that the window would not close all the way with a half inch gap at the bottom. I tried

We booked two rooms and just checked in. The first room had absolutely no towels. The phones have no number or button to call down to the front desk so we had to walk down to get towels. The second room was dirty! There was clothes left behind and trash around the room. 10/10 WOULD NOT recommend.

No complaint about the room very clean but the outside premises, cemented hallways and stairway can use power washing and by the way if you're expecting breakfast is not happening they only have a grab and go coffee and muffins

was greeted nicely but was not told where the elevators were so I fumbled through a corridor before I was given directions. First room I was given the light switch did not work and the television was not working. I went down and instead of just being offered a new room I was just asked if I wanted a new room. Of course! Why would I stay in a room that half of the amenities don’t work. The people upstairs kept walking all night long. And people in the corridors hanging out and laughing loudly, dogs barking nonstop. You can literally hear everything around you. It was impossible to sleep. I should’ve gone to the hotel across after the first incident. Worst experience! Do not come here! Due to covid they posted that janitorial was limited. And yes you can tell by how dirty the

Horrible motel. DO NOT STAY AT THIS MOTEL. Usually La Quinta is fairly nice, but this one is not. The pictures online make it look bright and inviting and it is anything but. The rooms are dark and it didn't feel safe for me being a single woman. Staff was rude and did nothing to resolve an issue I had with another guests blaring TV. They basically blew it off and told me there was nothing they could do so I checked out and went across the parking lot to the far superior Embassy Suites.

This is a VERY sub-par La Quinta.  Dirty outside and in.  Breakfast is NOT a meal at all!    The property is unkept and VERY unclean!   NO hot water at all!!!  Not a place to relax and enjoy!  The hotel was disgusting.

Got harassed my whole trip here they treat the people digging out of the trash better than they do the paying customers I left there in tears and anxiety definitely not happy the maids are nice so were the groundskeepers

Not good staff made the stay unpleasant.  I wish I had left and went to another property. I’ll notify the staff of the issues nothing was ever done. The review Hass to be 200 characters minimum I don’t like the facility.

Bag breakfast lacking.  Had to request room service but wasn’t informed of this at checkin. Does have roving security at night. Quiet location for area. Many local restaurants and fast food locations close by.

I didn't get my room cleaned, which is the first time in over 50 years of staying in and working for hotel chains that I had to sleep in a dirty room and use the prior day's towels, washrag, and sheets.  That also means that the floor was not vacuumed nor were any surfaces wiped down.  I am sharing these comments on Facebook and will move on to other social media platforms with my comments.

Summary Heading: Terrible choice, never make a mistake and choose this hotel
Summary: It was a terrible experience, The room was dirty, napkins were not changed. It was a hair on the bed, we asked the front desk to give us a clean set of napkins and the one they gave us also was not even in a plastic bag. When we asked them to change our napkins, they said leave it on the ground behind your door, You could imagine, how dirty was everything. The fan was extremely noisy, each time it starts working, we woke up, believe me each time. One of the elevators was working without light. It was horrible to use that at night.  The front desk was so rude and aggressive, I called and asked about shuttle airport, it was like they are yelling at me and say we don't have shuttle until 8AM. It was terrible, terrible, terrible experience.

The hotel is in a great location and the pool and hot tub are very nice. The room was clean if a bit spare. There was room enough to put a small table and chairs, but it was empty. The bathroom sink was small and the faucet was an automated one with just cool water available.

If you are particular about cleanliness and ambiance please choose other facilities. The grounds were unkept and dirty. The exterior needs a facelift. and the rooms need updating. The breakfast was an insult to anyone looking for nourishment.

Cigarette smell permeated the room. Not sure why housekeeping didn't resolve this before renting it out again. The tv remote was missing but a phone call to the front desk went unanswered and when I got to the lobby there were 3 other people there waiting for the clerk to return. Ultimately the staffs response from staff was grouchy. She seemed more focused on her self than me.

Summary Heading: Quick trip to the beach areas.
Summary: A quick trip to get out of the heat. Overall the Hotel was clean and the rooms were comfortable. Did not realize this was a pet friendly hotel. The reason for 3 and not a 4 was that guests appear to ignore the areas you can take the pets to pee and let them go on the walkways.  Need more signage. Needs some sprucing up. But otherwise the staff were extremely friendly. Close to the freeway on and off ramps.

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled!  If you want to feel comfortably clean, don't stay here!
Summary: We spent two nights here, having read reviews that seemed positive.  Yuck!  We were definitely misled!  The room was musty, stale, had something chunky and disgusting on the bathroom walls, blood on the mirror and shower handle!   The grab-n-go breakfast was not just healthy, but not tasty and very few choices.    I know money is hard to come by, but save a little more money and find a better hotel!  A vacation getaway is not pleasant when you feel like you're in a dirty, germy environment! We were glad to leave and go home, which is not the way a vacation should feel.

service was very good and the location was 20 minutes from New Port Beach. Breakfast needs a little improvement. carpet in room needed a little steam cleaning. door handle on our room was broken and had a hard time getting into the room.

This hotel /  Motel is only worth a 1/3 of what they charge. There are people hanging around the stairs , 2 tv's one didnt work and the one that worked was on the desk. Towels were to old. There were no regular sugar pockets for the coffee.

I had a very bad experience.  I am not willing to recommend the hotel to anyone.  It’s nasty having to stay in a hotel that looks dirty.  I paid a lot of money to go into a room that had blood stains in the sheets

Summary Heading: Unsafe - Defective doors with no access
Summary: This is an unsafe hotel.  My minor son and his team are staying here. They could not get into their room after game at night.  The master key would not even work. They were told that it could not be fixed until the next day and they could not access their belongings.  Medication, phone chargers, all of it.  The hotel knows about these problems with doors based on reviews.  This violates Calif Deceptive Trade Practices Act. It also constitutes conversion.  What if there is a fire and these defective doors do not open from the inside?   And no manager or franchise owner or anyone at La Quinta will call me back.

So close to everything! The beach, shopping centers, great food, Disneyland, LA. The front desk is always welcoming and very respectful. Best of all, they are pet friendly. Only bad thing is that they have the elevators on one side of the building. Keep that in mind when booking. Other than that we almost always have a great stay!

I stay at La Quinta property multiple times throughout the year. This location seemed to be clean and put together from a distance, but our room was dirty. There seemed to be blood stains all over the couch. The floors were sticky and stained. The fridge was dirty and had an horrible smell. The beds only had sheets, no blankets. We had to go purchase our own blankets along with cleaning supplies in order to clean our own room.  There were drug addicts all throughout the properties. They asked my husband multiple times if he was a guest, I guess he didn’t look the part... yet these tweekers roamed freely.

Do not stay here unless you like homeless roaming the hotel and parking lot.  The were sleeping in the courtyard and the elevator smells like urine.   Breakfast was a joke!    The entire area is a complete dump.

It’s cute and appears to have been newly renovated, but the walls are paper thin, the bed is AWFUL, and you can hear everything your neighbors are saying. The “free continental breakfast” is a flat out lie. There is a juice dispenser with water and apple juice, old prepackaged muffins, and bowls of fruit. That’s it.

Honestly, the only good parts is they accept pets and check in was smooth. Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Read my other reviews for a feel on who I am, I write fair reviews. This place was bad.   Negatives:  1) Every post I saw is covered in dog urine. Sidewalks are covered in stains and stray cigarette butts.   2) Do NOT even think about washing your clothes here. The washer and dryer on the second floor are beyond disgusting. Stained tops, and the inside looked very unclean.   3) People wearing backpacks were sitting at a dirty table smoking and drinking from a large vodka bottle.   4) For over two hours someone was blasting music down by the pool. Literally blasting.   5) Room is dirty. A long hair on the toilet lid. Several hairs in the tub. More hairs on

Room was clean, staff was helpful! All in all great experience ☺️ It’s a great location in Santa Ana, with great options to hang out around the area. Will definitely be staying here again in the future.

The inn was attractive and in a good location for us.  Unfortunately the other guests around us were very noisy all night long, for both nights stayed.  The sound insulation in the building is not good.  We got almost no sleep for both nights.

I thought the hotel staff there was extremely rude to all the guests I’d seen them interact with including myself. There were a couple who were not that bad, but for being in the HOSPITALITY industry not that bad would not be acceptable if i were to be managing this place. I’ve stayed here another time previously as well and I wasn’t very excited to be going back, but decided to give it another shot and immediately regretted my decision. I wished I wouldn’t have made the decision to do so on such a long stay of 2 weeks either get. I will never return here to this location! I have never been treated so badly by a hotel staff an not just one but all of them there. One young man in particularity  though who was especially rude! He should be fired. I’m sure if the management is

Was put on ground level and we were next to another room with a lot of noise makers, there were people knocking on our door unit 2am, contacted front lobby 4 times and no one fixed the problem. Will not stay there again. William Davis

We were very disappointed in this hotel. Our room was not cleaned properly and we forgot our wipes. If we don’t catch Covid from this hotel, we can survive anything. Very disappointed with La Quinta. La Quinta used to be great quality, but if this location in any indicator, it’s gone down hill since Wyndham bought it

The front desk clerk was off the chain rude.  I get he was having a bad day, but that should not transfer to guests.  The female employees are beyond amazing.  My room was dirty. Hair in the bed... the tv situation is pathetic- bad quality & remote didn’t work.  Got another but the tv and service are very low end.  For the money go elsewhere.

My dirty room, and dirty property no concern for guests In my room, wet carpet, and it stinks, on the floor of the room, cereal, a tampon in its bag, comb, if you move the sofas, they disgusting how dirty there is

Had a wonderful stay  Was very peaceful no one bothered us at all  Was like we had a vacation home to our selfs and no one was around very nice and up keep hotel will be going back if ever in the area thanks

I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room and the service that was rendered under  the Pandemic.  The folk at the front desk were pleasant warm hearted and very informative regarding the hotel

Summary Heading: Best hotel to stay with pets
Summary: Hotel is very close to the freeway and shopping mall in Tustin. It’s a nice and clean place to stay.   Price is good too. No extra charge for pets like other hotels do. I would definitely recommend to everyone. I always stay in that hotel when visiting Orange County.

The urine smell in 2 rooms of this hotel are horrendous and management didnt seem too concerned would only return half of my money...Stay away from this pet friendly hotel..Front desk wouldn't even give me corporates number saying she couldn't give me discount if I called corporate 🤔 Housekeeping is very poor at this location..

I had a horrible experience at this location . I checked in really late at night let’s start with the customer service not so good , room smell horrible , I was so tired from the flight that I went straight to bed. Next morning I got up and noticed that my sheets had blood stain and they were dirty . Called early morning to front desk to let them know about it , later around 11 pm got back to my room and the same bloody sheets were there . I went to the front desk to complain about it and they told they don’t have room service so she gave me another room . Got to the other room and the horrible smell was even worse and the couch had stain all over and smell like dog pee. The only good thing about it was the free parking . I will not stay here in this location ever .

Summary Heading: The Hotel is nice, the location is shady
Summary: My husband, daughter, and I took a short trip to CA to visit the beach. We chose this hotel because it was in the middle between the beach and Anaheim, since we also wanted to visit Downtown Disney. The proximity to these locations is great.   We brought our 2 small dogs and we had plenty of room for their beds, kennel, and food bowls. We loved that we were offered the option of a room on the first floor, so we could easily take our dogs out when needed.  However, keep in mind that since this is a pet friendly hotel, the couches and sofa beds may not be the cleanest. We don't let our dogs on furniture, but I know other people do.   Pros: Clean-ish room (the floors left our feet black.) Comfortable bed. Friendly and accommodating staff. Pet friendly, plenty of places to walk

Lots of  options in the area .  This  one has gone down hill ever  La Quinta was taken over by  Wyndham.  Staff are untrained and not helpful or friendly. Truly a bad experience. Please do not go there.  many other options in the area.

This hotel is clean, the parking is free and the breakfast is awesome with many choices. The staff is courteous, responsive and attentive. During my stay I recommended some of my peers to book a room here and they too were satisfied.

Everything was just like the pictures, super clean and staff was super friendly. The rooms were so cute and comfortable. Will be staying here every time I come down to Disney Land. About 6 miles from Disney but leaving early to get to the park wasn’t a problem since we wanted to be first for everything.

The stay was enjoyable. My children enjoyed hot tub and pool. Convenient freeway access. I requested extra pillows at the time of reservation but did not have them. A call for pillows and they were delivered within minutes. Very roomy area for breakfast, lots of seating.

Nice hotel overall.  Quiet.  Friendly staff. Couple of minor issues with the room, but did not affect stay.  Living room TV signal was intermittent.  Glass frame around bathroom mirror was cracked with jagged corners creating a potential safety issue.

I would rate the hotel as 3.5.  It is clean and well run and the rooms are spacious.  I stay there often and the room rates are economical.  It includes breakfast that ends at 9 am.  I will continue to stay there as it is a good value and well run.

This property seems to be slipping somewhat. I have stayed here several times in the past but this trip was the most disappointing experience I've had at this property recently.  Middle of the road now, trending towards the lower end.

My friend and I stayed here a couple weeks ago and were harassed by a strange man in the parking lot. We feared for our lives. We told security and the hotel staff and they didn’t care. We had to check out and find a different hotel.

This is my go to hotel in Southern CA. Everything is always on point & the staff is excellent. The rooms are clean & comfortable, the location is convenient to where ever I need to go. I would highly recommend this hotel

I and my wife have been quite pleased to stay at LQ for several years.   The Irvine, Santa Ana, Santa Barbara, and Pomona hotels have consistently been a wonderful respite from a long day of driving and business.  Our only disappointments have been the LQs in Sacramento ... loud, dirty, and non-caring.

My stay was fine till the morning I checked out. I was getting ready and discovered I had no hot water when I was wet shaving. I asked my wife to inform the front desk and she was told someone would check it out right away. After 20 minutes, no one came to the room and still no hot water. So I put some clothes on and went to the front desk and found the desk clerk and the maintenance guy visiting. I said I had called the front desk about no hot water and still did not have any. The maintenance guy said he would look into it right away, so I went back to my room. Five minutes later he stopped by my room and said that the boiler was turned off and that he lit it and that there would be HOT WATER right away. Fifteen minutes later still no HOT WATER. We had a meeting we had to go

Summary Heading: Dishonest response toinquiry about Cable Service
Summary: Lied to when questioning lack of TV station availability in rooms. Took talking to four people to FINALLY get a TRUE answer. Talked twice with the front desk, once with a maintenance man and finally with someone with access to the General Manager's office who did NOT identify herself but spoke as though she was in control

Summary Heading: If only all hotels were this way
Summary: Christine,  angel and Josh are the best front desk employees I've dealt with. Above and beyond what was expected.  Miguel maintenance  always brought extras we ordered with a smile! I had strange extension of my stay. They all were very happy to accommodate us.

have stayed here countless times for business and pleasure! - the renovation is amazing so the upgrades are wonderful - great location to Disneyland, John Wayne, beaches, shopping, museums, the local zoo and more

I have always come back to stay at hotel la quinta for its good size room, quiet, convenient location, friendly staffs. And mostly for its free self parking. Oh , breakfast with self made your own waffles, cannot miss that.

Good location and easy access to get a rental car. Nice rooms with ample seating areas. Suggest Newport Rib company for dinner (Costa Mesa), Tommy Pastrami for NY style Pastrami sandwich (Santa Ana, Harbor Blvd.) or Don Jose’s for Mexican Huntington Beach, Adams Blvd. .

We stay here fairly often visiting relatives in the area.  We originally chose this hotel years ago because it is dog friendly.  We no longer have a dog, but continue to stay here.  And will stay here many more times

My stay here was excellent 👍 I will recommend this place to anyone visiting the area. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly especially Christine and Patricia. The rooms are clean and spacious and breakfast is A+.

Our first impression of the LaQuinta Orange County was the cleanliness of the building and surroundings.  The front desk staff was very friendly, the room was clean, comfortable and very quiet.  Very impressed!  And the shuttle driver to the airport the following morning was very cheerful and friendly.  Overall a wonderful experience.

Great location, very close to interstate and close to many restaurant options.  Hotel and rooms were all very clean and well kept.  Great outdoor area to sit and relax with a fire pit.  Staff is all friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was a great added value and not just some simple continental one.  Eggs, waffles, sausage, bagels, muffins, oatmeal, etc!  Would stay at this property again if in the area.

Summary Heading: Great location close to JohnWayne airport, clean and spacious room
Summary: Great location, easy freeway access, quiet area, clean, updated and spacious room with nice employees. Decent warm breakfast, nice outdoor pools and sitting areas without street view which is nice to spend time later at night.

This is a basic hotel, nothing more.  The building is old and although it had a facelift a year ago, many of the rooms are in rough conditions.  The room service team is severely overworked which is why the cleanliness of rooms lack especially when you stay more than a day or two.  The breakfast is super basic and quite frankly is disappointing.  The air conditioners in the room need to be pulled out.  There simply isn't a way to get the temperature adjusted.  Please take these old units out!

I stay here whenever I go visit my daughter at Chapman. Beautiful location, great service, excellent modern and clean rooms. Excellent price. Very near the airport ! And best of all my pets are allowed here as well. There is plenty of CLEAN pet relief areas as well!

Have stayed at this hotel multiple times for the last 5-7 years and every year it’s great. Except for this year. Cleanliness was not what we expected and wish our room would have been cleaner. Sheets and pillows still smelled used.

To begin with, the staff were very pleasant and helpful.  The hotel was clean and well maintained.  The rooms were nice, comfortable and had plenty of USB outlets.  My well behaved, trained, large dogs were welcomed. Breakfast was okay, just like all the other buffet hotel breakfasts.  Yes, I would definitely stay there again, with or without my dogs.

We needed a pet friendly hotel so this one popped up during our search.  Hesitant because we didn't know what to expect but super happy we committed 😁. The hotel has been recently renovated and is well maintained and clean!  Not to mention that parking is free!  Our only fear now is that it will get too busy and the price will go up...

We were visiting with our daughter in college and needed a nice place to stay for one night. The stylish comfy room fit the bill.   The service was good. We encountered a big mess that another guest had left in the hall. We let the front desk know and they cleaned it up immediately.

The hotel is filthy period. I woke to vomit on the floor one day dog poop in the stairs another and dog pee all throughout the hallways. They need to wash down daily but claim cleaning day is only on Fridays sad

Summary Heading: Nice, quiet  overnight place to say.
Summary: Tips: this hotel does not charge for parking whereas some others nearby charge $30.00 per day outrageous! Be sure to ask b4 booking. The hotel was nice and quiet & staff was polite & friendly. The price was more than competitive. We'll be coming back.

I always stay at LaQuinta properties because of their pet policy. This location was very nice, with updated rooms and comfortable beds and pillows. There's easy access as it's straight off of the freeway exit ramp, but I didn't hear any freeway noise. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. They also have pet bags and trash receptacles at every grass area, which is convenient and keeps the grass areas clean. I would definitely stay at this location again.

The appearance was good. The staff was friendly but I left with bug or flea bites all over. Also the blankets where dirty requested for them To change them but didn’t get done. Have stayed at other la quinta and had never had a issue until now.

Summary Heading: By far the bet buy in the area
Summary: I've stayed here many times over the past 10 years and is usually one of the least expensive hotels in the area.  It has recently completed a total renovation, inside and out.  The rooms are clean and fresh with wide plank laminate flooring that is easy to keep clean.  Bathrooms are like new with lots of fresh tiles.  The outsied has been repainted and the reception area has undergone a total renovation.  Breakfast includes sausage and scrambled eggs, cereal, yogurt, danish, muffins, toast, wffels, fruit, etc. and is served in a large clean area.  The pool is nice and they have recently added several firepirts with patio furniture where you can relax - a really nice touch.  Almost all the other hotels nearby charge a parking fee but this place does not.  Also, pets stay free.

My room had no hairdryer, no tissue box, no tv remote batteries. The second day, we left the room around 8am and came back at 2pm, yet the room was still dirty. Around 3pm, a cleaning lady stopped by and asked if we needed any items (She did not even offer to clean the room)  When we asked for batteries, no one brought them up to the room, we had to go get them ourselves.  One of the things that frustrated me the most was I saw the cleaning staff standing outside and texting all the time (instead of doing their job).  Overall, I was very disappointed!

everything was nice, neat and clean.  There is business so didn't spend much time there.  We are now using this hotel for local stays for and near our new office space. Traveled with several other staff and they were also satisfied.

Close to the beach,  Rooms are very clean and well kept, spacious too.  If you are traveling with dogs, Excellent place to stay!!!  Huge shopping mall and tons of restaurants and sports bars just two minutes away----next to Costco.  Great Location!!!

you basically come, check in, and stay. employees are not that welcoming. They do not acknowledge loyalty. They do not know about certificates offered by the brand. There needs to be more training in some areas.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night due to my son's tennis tournament. We brought my little fur baby, Zoe, so our options for hotels were limited. The front lobby was very nice, customer service was top notch, when we got to our room- WOW! It was huge, looked like it had been newly refurbished and extremely clean. The room was more like a suite! There was a gym open 24 hours, a small pool and Jacuzzi. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was good. Choices were waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, bagels, muffins, a variety of cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, a variety of juices, coffee and tea. There are tons of restaurants in the area, so finding a place for dinner was easy, breezy, lemon squeezy! I would definitely stay at this establishment again whether

Summary Heading: NO LAUNDRY SERVICE AND THEN SOME
Summary: I would not use this hotel again but I needed long term parking. There are far better hotels for the price by a LONG SHOT! I did see an issue with the super loud a/c unit that woke me up all night.... pretty ghetto really

Summary Heading: Great location when traveling from John Wayne Airport!
Summary: This property is fully remodeled and beautiful, clean, safe and excellent for travelers using the John Wayne Orange County Airport. You can long term park your car at a safe, cost effective location and enjoy a peaceful nights rest.

I travel a lot! So you are not getting this from a novice which I see quite too often on reviews. That said, this is an excellent property obviously well managed. A Great staff and Clean! The two most important things. It is a hop skip and jump to the beach and restaurants, The Orange County Fairgrounds and we went to a Dodger game one night and that was not bad either. It is Freeway close to everything! We have stayed closer to the beach and it's always a bit of a hassle with parking and so on. We ubered a lot as well because sometimes its just easier! If your having cocktails in SoCal Dont Drive! We got to all the restaurants for about a $10 Uber ride....No Parking Fees etc. So in a nut shell Stay here, This is the only place we will ever stay in O.C

We are staying here for 4 nights and are in town for a basketball tourney. I got this hotel next door to the “team” hotel (Holiday Inn) for an even lower rate than the “team” block rate. We came here straight away after landing at the airport and were able to early check in at 10:00 AM. Nicely appointed room with plenty of space to spread out. Three of us (2 adults and teenager) fit just fine in a room with 2 queens. Cleaning crew came through after 2 days and did a great job. We went to the beach and brought back quite a mess. Very delicious complimentary breakfast. Also close to lots of things. 15 minutes up to Outlets at Orange, 30 minutes to Laguna Beach. Would definitely recommend this to anyone!

American Airlines gave us a voucher to stay here after canceling our flights. The hotel fits the purpose which is a place to sleep at. It is clean and fits our needs. The front staff was kind to suggest a place to grab a drink and have something to eat.

I booked this hotel through Expedia and I got charged twice once by Expedia which makes since and then two days later I got charged by the hotel for no reason. I called the hotel to dispute the charge. They said the reason they charged me because they don't see Expedia charge in their system. I called Expedia to dispute it. Expedia told me the hotel charged it by fault and will refund it to me. 4 days later nothing happened. I called Expedia again and the hotel changed their narrative saying it's a pending charge which is a lie. I am going to dispute the charge through my bank since the hotel is not cooperating. Check your bank account if you ever book this hotel because they are shady.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and affordable
Summary: This was by far the best stay we have had this year. When we asked for a room on the top floor , it was taken care of. Sandy Bell kept our room clean and ready. Very nice lady. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and plentiful.

Make sure you book in advance for a better rate.  Can hear noises from the pool site and kids running.  Great complimentary breakfast with many options.  Breakfast staff kept the area very clean and they're helpful when needed.  Good Luck! Enjoy!
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned. Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us. Sincerely, La Quinta Orange County Airport

Summary Heading: Good Place to Stay for a Disneyland Visit
Summary: We didn't want to pay for any of the Anaheim hotels with their resort fees, parking fees, lack of breakfast, etc.  I tried looking at some of the Orange County Airport North hotels and based on the Trip Advisor reviews decided to give the La Quinta a chance.  Our experience was really quite good.  The room was spacious and clean, the front desk staff were courteous and helpful.  The remodel of the lobby was really nicely done and is welcoming.  The only negative was the lack of cleanliness in the outdoor lounge area.  There was a large amount of litter in the form of beer bottles, bottle caps, and even a pair of shorts.  We know there was a maintenance man on site, because he was often walking around the grounds.  It seems to me that the lounge and pool areas should be checked
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your experience was anything less than perfect. I have shared your comments with my team to help them understand the impact of their words and actions on guest perceptions. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.

Summary: This hotel is well decorated and has a more modern, updated feel than similar hotels in its price category.   Lighting and decor in the bathroom has a similar, more updated look and feel.  The room had a living area as well as a nicely designed bedroom area.
Manager Response: It’s great to know that your stay with us at La Quinta Inn & Suites was as enjoyable as we hoped it would be. I’ll be sure to share your fantastic comments with our housekeeping and maintenance teams, who take special pride in the upkeep of our rooms.

Summary: Love this hotel - came before reno - during reno - & after reno. Always love and feel welcomed here. Mostly quiet, except for guests. Pick not the courtyard view for a quiet time. Breakfast is always hot & delicious. Thank you
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your rating. We appreciate you staying at La Quinta Inns and Suites and hope to see you again!

Summary: The front desk person was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and spacious. The internet worked well. We have stayed here three years in a row and have always been pleased with everything.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your rating. We appreciate you staying at La Quinta Inns and Suites and hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: "Im working on it but you keep calling and I have people here" -Dominic (front desk kid)
Summary: I had just checked in and went to use the toilet to find a lot of fecal matter in the toilet. I attempted to flush it and just call it a day but it began to flood so I called the front desk. They said sure I'll send someone up. So, I wait 20 minutes and call again. Guy picks up and says they are on the way. I wait another 20 minutes and call again asking if it's easier to change rooms since I've been waiting nearly an hour. He very nastily says "it's been like 10 minutes someone is coming" and hangs up. I call back and the phone rings forever and he comes back and I tell him that I checked in and have waited over and hour and I did not appreciate his accusatory tone. He responded with "I am working on it but you keep calling me and theres people here" My calls weren't picked up
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned. Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us. Sincerely, La Quinta Orange County Airport

Summary: Upon arrival, despite the fact that I had a reservation with a requested crib for three months, they confirmed that they did not have a crib available. Apparently, they had given out one of two cribs they had on a "first come first serve" basis, despite the fact that someone had only asked the day before our check-in. They offered to call over to another La Quinta a town over to see if they had one. I waited as they searched and was told they would call back. While waiting, I asked if they could reach out to other Wyndham hotels. The front desk manager said, "I doubt it, they haven't even updated our website yet as we just joined their chain in June." The same front desk manager then told me I could look at one of their dirty towel laundry baskets and take out the springs and it
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned. Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us. Sincerely, La Quinta Orange County Airport

Summary: Every year my company has a show in the area and every year we stay in this hotel. It’s nearby, clean, quiet (except the hotel next door is pretty loud) and a quick bite to eat for breakfast is so convenient.
Manager Response: It’s great to know that your stay with us at La Quinta Inn & Suites was as enjoyable as we hoped it would be. I’ll be sure to share your fantastic comments with our housekeeping and maintenance teams, who take special pride in the upkeep of our rooms.

Summary: Clean, good location, friendly staff and well kept property. Will be staying there again. Pet friendly for those of us with furry family. Pool was clean and felt almost heated. Lots of outdoor seating.
Manager Response: It’s great to know that your stay with us at La Quinta Inn & Suites was as enjoyable as we hoped it would be. I’ll be sure to share your fantastic comments with our housekeeping and maintenance teams, who take special pride in the upkeep of our rooms.

Summary: We got bumped off our flight and stayed one night. The hotel is clean and the employees were friendly and professional. Was pleasantly surprised at how nice this La Quinta was compared to others we have stayed in previously.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay. We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Quick check in (but we did call ahead). We stayed in a king bed with sleeper sofa room - It was clean and spacious.  They offer a great breakfast - scrambled eggs, sausage, mini Belgium waffles, oatmeal, yogurt, bagels, mini muffins, toast, cereal, fruit, etc.  We didn’t explore all the amenities with just a nights stay, but we had No issues during our stay!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay. We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Super Friendly Staff. Fantastic room with sitting area, updated bathroom, TWO TV's! Rooms was clean and stocked well. Excellent Value for the money. Nice Pool and Hot Tub was nice hot temp. Lush tranquil seating area outside the pool. You could hear the neighboring rooms a bit, but fine with TV on.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay. We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: Very clean and professional hotel. Staff are wonderful
Summary: We use this hotel to fly out of JOHN WAYNE AIRPORT  for very early morning flights. We use because of their cleanliness n effective you. Other hotels could learn something from their amazing staff.!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay. We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This place looks nice, but the staff here (checkin guy on Thurs. 16th 2019 who I should of jot down his name for his horrible customer service) is horrible. Asides from the condescending tone the check-in receptionist took with me, he also failed to fix the plumbing problem there was with the tub which made the whole room reek. We communicated that early in the morning to the front desk, but they forgot and when we came back late at night ready to shower and sleep we came back to that foul smell. All in all, horrible service. We were originally planning to stay for 10 nights, great thing we didn't. The Best Western that is on that same block to La Quinta saved our trip with great breakfast and great customer service!
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your experience was anything less than perfect. We strive to give the best customer service to every guest. It seems that we fell short during your stay, and I apologize for that. I have used your comments as an opportunity to review our service standards with staff. Your feedback is very much appreciated.

Summary: This hotel has clean and spacious rooms and is a good value for the money.  It is close to the John Wayne Airport and freeway close to access other points of interest.  The only recommendation I would have is to add a few upgrades to the breakfast menu.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay. We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: We had to be out of our house for two nights while some work was being done on it. I chose La Quinta because we could bring out cat and dog with us. I was not expecting such a wonderful experience ! The room was beautiful, as were the grounds. The staff was helpful and friendly. Also each morning there was a breakfast with hot and cold food selections. I highly recommend this LaQuinta
Manager Response: Wow, five stars! Your kind comments are very much appreciated.  Thank you again for your terrific recommendation.

Summary: Employees of the hotel know what it takes to create a great guest experience. 5-Star hospitality. Take time to congratulate each other and celebrate success. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this property.
Manager Response: Wow, five stars! Your kind comments are very much appreciated.  Thank you again for your terrific recommendation.

Summary: Quite satisfied with the property value, cleanliness and comfort. I was happy with the Executive King Suite because of the large corner couch and the fact that it makes into a Queen bed. The property is clean and ground are well maintained. The jacuzzi was nice and hot and the pool was heated but still a refreshing temperature.
Manager Response: Wow, five stars! Your kind comments are very much appreciated.  Thank you again for your terrific recommendation.

Summary: I stay at this hotel on Hotel Terrace in spite of multiple other quality choices just next door or across the street. The remodelled rooms are very nice and I really like the pool and hot tub.  The breakfast is likewise above average.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay. We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Hotel was nice. Room was clean and comfortable.  Staff were very nice and the included breakfast was tasty and freshly prepared. Only concerns were that someone parked in my assigned parking spot, I could not figure out how to adjust the A/C and the room was cold at nite and the bathroom drain had a bad odor..needed to be cleaned. Otherwise my stay there was very nice 8.5 out of 10 star rating.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your experience was anything less than perfect. We strive to give the best customer service to every guest. It seems that we fell short during your stay, and I apologize for that. I have used your comments as an opportunity to review our service standards with staff. Your feedback is very much appreciated.

Summary: Lovely guest rooms and a great bargain for such a nice room. Nice grounds and breakfast with many choices.  Excellent internet service. Parking close to our room. Fast check in and courteous employees.

Summary Heading: Transition to Wyndham  has been pretty smooth, still a great place to stay for business
Summary: This LaQuinta property has undergone a big upgrade of the property and rooms over the past couple of years, and is now in great shape.  Very friendly staff make it a pleasure to return to,  which I do at least once or twice each month.  My only current disappointment is Wyndham  immediately discontinued the LaQuinta Elite gift bag - a cookie and water on check-in, which was a simple but nice gesture  now gone.
Manager Response: We strive to give the best customer service to every guest. It seems that we fell short during your stay, and I apologize for that. I have used your comments as an opportunity to review our service standards with staff. Your feedback is very much appreciated.

Summary: The front desk didn't answer the phone for two hours. The smell was bad in some area of the room, the bathroom was not clean enough. The wifi & breakfast were good. They have shuttles, it was convenient.
Manager Response: We strive to give the best customer service to every guest. It seems that we fell short during your stay, and I apologize for that. I have used your comments as an opportunity to review our service standards with staff. Your feedback is very much appreciated.

Summary: We stay at this property 3-5 times a year.  It is remodeled, very pretty, clean newly remodeled rooms, great, pleasant friendly staff, nice breakfast and very clean dining area and pool.  Dog friendly hotel, with great facilities, and respectful dog owners.
Manager Response: Thank you!  See you Soon!  Will share with team!!

Summary: Comfortable mattress and great service. The room was better than we expected. Definitely a fan of La quinta inn. The check in was painless and they honored the booking fee, no extra unexpected charges. Great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you! See you again soon!

Summary: Screaming running children, noise so bad there is no way anyone can sleep. Do not stay here if you need rest and are not on vacation. The front desk staff will not do anything not even apologize just acknowledge yes others have reported the dame thing
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your experience was anything less than perfect. We strive to give the best customer service to every guest. It seems that we fell short during your stay, and I apologize for that. I have used your comments as an opportunity to review our service standards with staff. Your feedback is very much appreciated.

Summary: We loved this La Quinta for the great service by the front desk staff and other hotel staff.  Staying near the freeway made it accessible for us to go to sites in the area and enjoy the vacation.  Love the comfortable environment, breakfast and the free parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta by Wyndham Orange County Airport. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.   Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: ve stayed here before, and prior to the recent renovations. Walls now have little to no sound proofing. Clerks checked in a family of three late at night, 12:30AM. Child of the devil was hitting the walls, screeming and crying. The adult male and female let this continue through 2AM.  Room was very clean and large. All the pillows were well used and very lumpy. Breakfast was meh! I'll stay at a different hotl in the future that is not so loud.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear about noise issues. We do our best to try and control.

Summary: Great hotel, great evening staff! Good breakfast!12 minutes away from Disneyland! This hotel is right off the freeeway. Our overall experience was amazing! Thank you all for your service. The rooms were clean and the beds We’re comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta by Wyndham Orange County Airport. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Very affordable , very comfortable, and very clean !!! Staff was polite and friendly!!! I would have no issues staying here again .  Parking was very tight but pretty much expected!!  and location was convenient
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta by Wyndham Orange County Airport. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Hotel is in a clean and safe area. Room was quiet and clean. Bed was not lumpy. Bathroom was clean. Breakfast was quick and good.  Staff was helpful. Check in and check out was quick. We stayed for the weekend. Overall, a pleasant and relaxing stay!
Manager Response: Thank you!! Hope to see you next time!

Summary: I stayed here for just one night but it was the most comfortable I felt during my whole week in L.A. When I got into my room I was pleasantly surprised by a truly spacious room. I was in a single bed room which had two TVs, one for staying in bed and another for sitting on the large couch. The large desk was great for getting work done that evening. The room in general was really clean and didn't have any bad or strange smells as I have experienced in many other hotels, including other La Quintas. The bathroom was huge with a nice shower; once again this was perfectly clean. The gym was nice with free weights and a spin bike along with the usual treadmills and exercise balls. They were missing clean-up towelettes at the time although I saw it was something usually available. The
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta by Wyndham Orange County Airport. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Once again I had a fantastic experience at this hotel. From the minute you walk in they make you feel like you are at home. Rooms are beautiful & very clean. The entire staff is warm & friendly. I love the way they remodeled the area out side the pool creating a lovely outdoor seating area with cushioned furniture. A+A+A+A
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta by Wyndham Orange County Airport. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This place is a great property to stay at when in town. I was in town for a business trip and my wife tagged along on the trip also. The central location to everything that we wanted to we was paramount in our trip. It made going to the beach and Los Angeles effortless.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta by Wyndham Orange County Airport. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  We strive daily to ensure that all of our guests are well taken care of, and we never tire of hearing when we succeed! We hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: My last stay at the La Quinta Inn & Suites Orange County Airport
Summary: Our last stay was very good. Everything went very well. The refurbishing is finally finished and the hotel looks terrific. The staff and the people who take care of the rooms were very good. I look forward to staying there the next time I go to California.
Manager Response: We’re looking forward to having you again as our guests! We are happy that your family enjoyed the spacious room, the pancakes at breakfast and the attentive housekeeping attendant. I have shared your comments with the team, and they are thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: The hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable. It came with microwave, small flat screen TV and coffee maker. I would have liked to have a mini safe in room. The room stay comes with a buffet breakfast. This included scrambled eggs, sausage patties, waffels, and all the other trimmings. My only complaint was the eggs were horrible. They tasted like rubber and were all dried out. Maybe too long on hot plate. You also get a free airport shuttle if needed.
Manager Response: Sorry about the eggs. We are trying some new ones today.

Summary: Why is this LaQuinta not like the other ones in Orange County.  I have not seen the ones in Los Angeles County but I assume they look like this one,  renovations or not. I have seen the ones in Anaheim,  Buena Park,  Irvine and the LaQuinta Inn near the Irvine Spectrum.  What a difference between the four.   Is it because this Inn is located in a blighted area so the powers to be thought it was not worth a decent face lift.  The people in the area and the people of Orange County should picket this Inn to make sure it comes up to the standards of the others.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback. We are very sorry to hear that the hotel was not up to par in the areas mentioned. Please note this information has been passed on to our management staff to ensure improvements are considered and made. We very much appreciated your business and thank you for staying with us. Sincerely, La Quinta Orange County Airport

Summary: We stayed at this La Quinta a couple of years ago during their remodel, and everything was just okay.  Due to having work done on our home, we stayed here again a week ago, mostly because of their wonderful dog-friendly policy.  I am happy to say the remodel is done, and everything is very nice!  The rooms are beautifully decorated, the overall service was much improved, and we were very pleased with everything. The complimentary breakfast has hot and cold foods, but is very crowded during peak times.. go early. Would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: We’re looking forward to having you again as our guests! We are happy that your family enjoyed the spacious room, the pancakes at breakfast and the attentive housekeeping attendant. I have shared your comments with the team, and they are thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: Well seeing how the manager did absolutely nothing about my stay at this hotel I feel compelled to let others know so that this doesn’t happen to them! To begin upon my arrival to my room I discovered the ice bucket still had trash in, towels had yellow spots on them, stains on sofa and the refrigerator still had items in it from the previous occupant .  I ended up having to clean all of it myself as housekeeping neglected to after leaving them a note to clean it.  Housekeeping also chose to take old linen and short change me back!  And don’t bother using the Do Not Disturb sign because it gets ignored!!!!!!!! I am so frustrated after multiple emails and phone calls nothing happened and I ended up paying full price for an awful stay!!!!
Manager Response: Manager tried reaching you via email three times and called multiple times.  Sorry to hear you did not enjoy stay.

Summary: I stayed here for one night while in the area for an interview and I wish I had had time to stay longer. Before booking my room I saw that they had recently done some renovations, and although it was a little further out than I originally intended, it seemed worth it for the positive reviews and similar price to places closer to my destination. The room was great. Everything still looked brand new, it was clean, SPACIOUS, and very comfortable. Parking was easy and included. Breakfast (waffle bar, eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, juice, tea) was nice and also included. Plenty of places to sit and hang out in the dining room, lobby, and patio. The staff was very welcoming and helpful from start to finish. Again, I just really wish I had been able to stay longer - I
Manager Response: Thank you!  Will share with team!!  LQ

Summary: My husband and I was in the area for my daughter's volleyball tournament. Found the hotel as best location for its buck. We both were so surprised how beautiful the property and the staff were. Will definitely stay again.  My only problem was... no security to help take care of a homeless that was taking food. I would rather have seen someone with authority take care of the guy instead of front desk agent or I'm guessing the  manager. She was able to get him out, I gave her kudos for taking the homeless on.
Manager Response: Hi,    Thank you your for your email. I wish the police would help us more with this.

Summary Heading: Nice for leaving car while traveling from SNA
Summary: We stayed at La Quinta Inn the night before leaving on a trip out of SNA.  The hotel is clean, checkin was quick, the grounds were nice, and it was convenient to have breakfast before our flight.  We left our car there for a week and caught the hotel shuttle back to the hotel after our trip.  It all worked perfectly except when we called for a shuttle to pick us up from the airport at  10 pm, we were put on hold for 25 minutes.  Hopefully that was an unusual circumstance.
Manager Response: Sorry about being on hold. We were very busy

Summary Heading: Amazing renovation. Pleasant stay for business trip.
Summary: I used to stay in this hotel between before and after its renovation. It has been completely remodeled. The guest rooms and common areas are totally upgraded from what they were and include a brand new fitness center. I find this hotel ideal for business and short stays. The staff is great.
