The manager, Nicole James was outstanding and her owner and management should recognize her for outstanding service to guests.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler, Thanks for taking time to write such a great review of your recent stay.  We are extremely delighted to hear that the quality of our staff members were so accommodating.  They really do take great pride in guest satisfaction, and it sounds like we exceeded your expectations!  The General Manager will be thrilled to hear that you mentioned her by name.  Your kind words will be shared with hotel management and this will make her day.  We look forward to having you as a guest again in the near future. Thanks again for your review!

Summary: This was an excellent value in a great location with attentive staff who were way beyond the level of the accommodation provided.  The room was dingy and depressing, and in need of redecoration.  It was clean, though with a slightly unpleasant odor.  The refrigerator froze apples.  The TV station selection was very limited, even not offering the full spectrum of the local PBS station, and no MSNBC.  The TV set had no sleep control.  I want to emphasize that staff were very helpful, and the price was very good for the size of the rooms and the location.  The annoyances are enough to say that I would not return, but if you are looking for a bargain, with nice people to wait on you, and you love austerity, this is your place.

We have stayed twice now and both times we had a perfect stay and trip.  Car was fine after our stay the shuttle was not available but they paid for a private cab...right on the spot at the hotel in cash.  Nice rooms, not fancy, but everything works well and it is clean.  good hot tub and pool (heated) workout room.

Summary Heading: This is NOT the typical Inns & Suites
Summary: This property is listed as a Last Quinta Inns & Suites, but instead is the old style with all guest rooms accessed from outside, not an interior hallway.   The room was adequate, bed & bath clean, but all furniture was old . Room definitely due for update. Slight odor of bug spray but no insects visible.  My biggest complaint was that vending/ice only available on foods 2 &3.  Being on first floor, I had to take the outdoor elevator to 2nd floor, which of course the vending did not work.  Had to then go back up to 3rd floor. At night this was a bit sketchy as the courtyard is not secured,  and the ice/vending were not even close to the elevator.
Manager Response: Chalkmtn,  we are pleased to know the room was adequate and clean however we sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced. Please know that we are working diligently to address your comments and improve upon these areas. Should you give us the opportunity to welcome you back, it would be our absolute privilege to better ensure a more valuable and wholly satisfying experience. We look forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary: La Quinta is our choice when traveling.  Especially when we have our pets.  We have had nothing except great experiences.  You can't beat the value and the great pet policy. I wish they were in more locations.  Sometimes we're unable to locate a La Quinta in an area where we're traveling.
Manager Response: E7824RXbarbarah,  thank you so much for your most excellent review. We are very happy to hear that La Quinta is your choice when traveling. We very much look forward to serving you again, and it is a pleasure sharing our hospitality with you!

Summary: Bathroom and bed were OK, but the rest of the room furniture was old, stained, and badly worn.  This hotel property desperately needed upgrade.  I have stayed in may other La Quinta hotels and it is always a crap shoot as to what one might get.  Many wete upgraded and very nice rooms while others such as this one was pretty bad.
Manager Response: Thomas B, we sincerely apologize for these most concerning and disappointing circumstances. We agree that this is unacceptable and does not accurately reflect well upon the impeccable facilities or level of service we strive to maintain. We regret that this affected your visit.  Please know that I have personally investigated this and have shared your comments with my team.  I hope that your travels bring you back to the area again to give us another try.  We await your future visit.

Summary: This was a great place to stay and leave our car while on vacation. felt very safe at this location. bed was comfy and had a sofa and chair for a very comfy stay. breakfast  was also very good with several choices to choose from.
Manager Response: Cheryl S, thank you for your most wonderful review!  Our team is pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and had to the chance to enjoy our Bright Side Breakfast.  We await your next stay with us!

Summary: sorely disappointed in this old hotel. microwave didn't work, alarm clock buzzed all night, was afraid to take a shower due to the paint peeling off the bath tub and walls. Breakfast was a joke, the over worked worker couldn't keep the runny scrambled eggs and puck sausages service treys filled. And the biggest surprise was apparently this is a pet friendly joint as the parolee looking fella was walking his two large pit bulls around the breakfast and pool area during the breakfast hours!
Manager Response: Lance, we sincerely apologize for these most concerning and disappointing experience. This is unacceptable and does not accurately reflect well upon the impeccable facilities or level of service we strive to maintain. We regret that this affected your visit, especially because your experience was great and what you were looking for overall. We would love to have you give us another try, we hope to see you soon!

Summary: My girlfriend and I were planning a trip for the weekend in Santa Ana for a concert. We needed up finding s deal that was to sweet to miss out on so we book a suite room at La Quinta in Santa Ana. The room was big and spacious for the both of us and we had a balcony so it was a whole lot cooler. We enjoyed the stay, ate free breakfast in the morning then headed  out back home. It was a perfect weekend
Manager Response: Hi Lexis, thanks for taking the time to share your experience with us.  I am pleased you enjoyed our spacious rooms and our Bright Side Breakfast.  It brings us great pride to know that you had a perfect weekend!  We look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary: Overall enjoyable hotel and mostly clean. Staff was quick and efficient to answer questions, respond to requests, and friendly. Room was nicer than I expected. Facilities were nice as well. Probably would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hi James, thanks so much for your wonderful feedback!  We are pleased that you enjoyed our hotel and our warm hospitality.  We await your future stay with us again.

Summary: Nice clean spacious room - appreciated the ground floor. EZ access to fwy. Friendly Night Watchman who found me walking my dog withing a minute of exiting my room - nice to know he was on the job. Quiet safe area.  All staff were very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Hi Terry, thanks so much for the wonderful review.  I'm pleased to know that you enjoyed our spacious rooms and our staff were friendly and helpful.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Front desk staff very friendly, property was nice, child enjoyed pool and hot tub - beds are only full size, would prefer Queen as they are rather small.  Enjoyed our stay! Breakfast has minimal choices would be nice if there were more of a selection.  Kitchen staff was very pleasant!
Manager Response: Hello JonnaJ851, thanks for sharing your review.  I'm glad your family was able to enjoy our pool and hot tub.  I will be happy to share your comments with our team and we all look forward to your next visit.

Summary: First, the good: the desk staff are very nice and can be quite responsive.  Lastly, the bad: I have now stayed in this hotel on four occasions within the past eight months and have concluded that most of the rooms are poorly maintained and in very poor condition; the walkways are very dirty; roaches abound on the exterior walls and walkways at night; and the hotel is regularly frequented by gang members and others that will -- minimally -- interfere with a sense of well-being during ones stay.  The first room I had in December of 2015 was roomy, clean, and well-maintained.  It was raining at that time, and so the walkways were nearly always wet and clean, and it seemed like most guest were comprised of nice holiday travelers and business people.  The room I stayed in in January
Manager Response: Hi Michelle,  thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We deeply regret that we did not more fully deliver an outstanding experience and apologize for these inconveniences. Please know that we are working diligently to address your concerns, and we hope to have the chance to earn your full confidence in the future.

Summary: The room was great we had king suite with couch bed. It had mini sink, fridge, desk and comfortable beds clean linens and towels.  We enjoyed the warm breakfast and nice swimming pool and hot tub.  Short drive to Disneyland perfect for a more affordable stay than other hotels closer to Disney with less noise and congestion..
Manager Response: Hi Lisa, thanks so much for the great review!  I'm glad you were able to settle in to the room along with enjoying our pool and hot tub.  We look forward to sharing our hospitality with you again in the future.

Summary: The area was good. Breakfast was good. Also, the front desk agent who helped me was very kind and she was very polite. The room was quite spacious and very clean. The only issue I had was that they are currently doing a bit of construction at the main entrance and I had some trouble finding my way to the lobby. And there was a bit of noise when you stay on the second floor.

Great people worked with me on the phone to get a reservation; super nice folks; complimentary shuttle; easy and friendly check-in; comfy room- very nice; relaxing to walk around on this property; I really enjoyed my stay; nice pool and hot tub; fantastic complimentary breakfast near the patio- it was a great California experience; easy, friendly, check-out and shuttle to airport.

Keep out sign on construction fence made it look condemed, poor signage to lobby. Handicapped parking on other side of entrance. When I checked in there was no porters to assist me, the cart was user unfriendly. Pool closes at 10pm.

Summary Heading: hotel stay was for leisure. hotel was picked because of location to activities in southern calif.
Summary: usually on other occasions, hotel fees are reasonable, however, this time fees were inflated because of County fair. probably hotwire,  priceline, etc. could have given a better rate. hotel is in an ideal location, close to OC airport, beach, shopping malls and entertainment centers.

This hotel is very nice! Large rooms, laundry facility. Clean pool, nice breakfast area! Office center is good. Very pleased. Good price for the area. Good housekeeping. Parking is abundant. My room has a fridge, microwave, large flat screen tv. Stayed in room 254! Thank you!
Manager Response: Hi Wendy, thank your for your great review. I'm pleased that you enjoyed our Bright Side Breakfast and our spacious rooms.  Our housekeeping team are proud to have delivered an experience you value. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: My car was vandalized while parked in the hotel parking lot.  There is no security to oversee the parking lot.  Plus no security cameras that could bare witness to the account.  My poor rating is based strictly upon the value of the security this location offers.  I stay at many La Quinta locations yearly in the States of Florida and California.
Manager Response: Dear Luis,  I’m sorry your car was vandalized. Since we typically don’t have these types of incidents, I was concerned when you reported this to me.  As a result,  our on location security team has increased their security walks and we have also added additional hours. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.  I hope you will come back and see the changes we have made!  Nicole General Manager

Summary: Friendly staff, Rooms are spacious and comfortable enough to get some rest. Easy to find close to freeway.  Gas Station right across the street. Plenty of places to get quick food and not have to drive to far.
Manager Response: Mecaim13, thank you for your superb review.  We are absolutely thrilled you enjoyed our central location, and friendly service. We sincerely appreciate your patronage and eagerly await your return for your next visit.

Summary: very clean and easy access to fwy, room was clean and shower was clean but older. appears they are remodeling so there is some construction areas but they were well marked and not in the way. breakfast was good, plenty of food and coffee was good. juice bar was adequate and the outside seating was plentiful and clean. lady at the breakfast was friendly and helpful, she also kept the tables cleaned and food trays filled up

This hotel had an exceptional staff that was always willing to help.  The rooms were quite spacious, especially when compared to standard hotel rooms.  For the price paid, this is a very good value and I will stay here again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Nicely Furnished Room but Need a Car
Summary: The furnishings, lobby and pool are very nice. The breakfast buffet gets a bit crowded so do not wait for the last half hour if you want a hot waffle on the weekend. Our room came with a fridge and good AC but was on the back side of the property. The parking lot activity seemed a bit scetchy but many local residents live there w/animals and are very friendly. The Hotel Circle provides a nice variety of accomodations and nice lawns, pleasant for a night stroll. There is not much other retail business in the area except a gas station with a quick mart. Best to have your own car to get around.

We had a king bedroom.  The room also had another big area with a fold out couch.  This is where the TV is, not easy to see from the bed.  Our first room the tub didn't drain and the toilet sort of flushed.  And it all smelled bad.  They moved us for the next two nights to a easy to get to room by the pool.  The fridge didn't work.  The place is getting remodeled.  I wasn't expecting a five star hotel,  but I think everything should work and be clean and not stink.
Manager Response: I am so sorry that you were disappointed during your stay with us. Providing a clean and comfortable room to our guests is extremely important to us. We appreciate your feedback, and it will be shared with management as well as housekeeping.  Sincerely,	 La Quinta Customer Care Team

Summary: Needed a spot for thee night. Hotel is conveniently located to freeway. Quiet.   The check-in was smooth. The agent was polite.   He was very pleasant.  Facility is being renovated.   Room was spacious.  Parking is adequate.  Breakfast was included. No charge for parking. Free WiFi.

I was a little skeptical when I booked the 3 nights. I talked to Tim on the phone and asked him how old was the hotel. He checked and told me it was built in the 80's but refurbished in 2007. That made me feel better. When we arrived and found the lobby very well maintained, we were impressed enough that our room also would be. And it was GREAT. Thank you

This is a typical American hotel facility. The rooms are large and the beds great, showers are terrific (thank God), and the breakfast very average. Reception was perhaps the most efficient young woman we have ever seen.  Not a bad stay.

In my stay back from Disney with 4 small children at 12 midnight and reach the room is dirty and unwashed and the bathroom was covered with excrement overflowing collaborator reception did not help us, just change us room on the fourth floor and had to switch to 4 children and suitcases alone, I do not provide us assistance, extended the phone not served and had to go to reception to ask for help.  Additional breakfast and very slow as there are many people not enough food and you have to wait long to replenish the food.
Manager Response: I am sad to hear that your stay with us was unsatisfactory. We will be using your feedback for further training purposes in order to improve. We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your experience and hope you will consider us for future travels. Sincerely, La Quinta Customer Care Team

Summary: This hotel is under a bit of a renovation.  Arrived at night it was dark and we couldn't figure out WHERE check-in was!  Had to park and wander a bit till we located the "new" check-in area.  The room was not bad.  A bit of an out dated bathroom but everything worked! You do get a breakfast with the price and that was interesting... My husband and I had never seen people pile their plates with quite so many scrambled eggs...only to set the plate down and go for a plate filled with sausage!! The VERY NICE young woman attending the breakfast room kindly made me a waffle as there were a lot of folks wanting the THREE waffle irons available to cook in. Price was right and for one night it was fine!

My history with this hotel property goes back a long ways. I was an investor in the partnership that originally built the hotel (at that time as the Woolley Petite Suites)   Robert Woolley was the person who started the Embassy Suites Hotel chain (that was later sold to Hilton).  The Petite Suites Hotel was sold  a few years ago (maybe 6 or 7) and rebranded as La Quinta.  When it was the Petite Suites we stayed there many times and it was always very nice and well maintained.  At that time they offered a free "cooked to order breakfast" was was outstanding. Fast forward to our stay at the La Quinta In July.  The hotel is badly in need of refurbishment. They are currently doing some renovation on the entrance. The rooms are somewhat worn with age. The front desk is badly
Manager Response: I’ve received your review and it looks like we dropped the ball on meeting your expectations.  I appreciate your feedback; this is definitely not the experience we want you to have when staying with us!  Your feedback will help us improve our operation.  Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it’s through comments such as yours that we’re able to improve.  Thanks again for your time, and hope we’ll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.

Summary Heading: La Quinta Inn and Suites Santa Ana
Summary: Located very close to the 55 freeway, so easy access to all the major spots close by. They also allow pets, which is FANTASTIC! My dog was very happy while at this hotel.  The room was cozy.  I'd stay here with my puppy again.
Manager Response: Hi Amy, thanks for sharing your comments regarding your recent stay.  I'm glad you were able to settle in comfortably.  I hope that your travels bring you back to the area to stay with us again!

Summary: There were blood stains on all bed sheets. Restroom floor was really dirty. The hotel workers and manager did help us with a change of sheets immediately but my wife and I were not comfortable staying at hotel or room after seeing the dirty covers.

The room was spacious and comfortable.  Only complaint about the room was the bathroom lighting was very dim.  The hotel exterior shows its age and needs a major facelift. Breakfast was the standard fare, however the attendants were quite friendly and helpful.

The carpet was stained, leaking shower faucet, the room smelled when we entered, disappointing breakfast, loud tow truck drivers at 4am. There was mold in the bathroom. Other hotels in area are nicer.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing LaQuinta.  We truly regret that our accommodations did not meet your expectations but mostly we regret that we were unable to resolve the issues to your satisfaction while staying with us.  I have shared your review with my management staff for training and better improvement.  Thanks, LQ Customer Care

Summary: We chose this hotel over the Anaheim property due to cost - we saved about $40 per night and it was an easy drive to Disneyland. We would also recommend this site because it was very clean & quiet- staff were extremely helpful!

They were doing some construction on the front entrance to the hotel but this did not interfere with our stay. The hotel is easy to get to and in a good area of Santa Ana. The hotel staff were very helpful. The breakfast area was nice and the food was good. We would defiantly stay in this hotel again if in this area.
Manager Response: Hi Patty, thanks for your feedback! I’m pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay at Orange County - Santa Ana La Quinta. Our team looks forward to providing you with exceptional service in the future.  It’s our commitment to serve our guests to our best ability and hope to always exceed your expectations.  We’ll see you soon.

Summary: Stayed a full week here.  Had a room right off the pool.  Yes, the entry to the lobby is in need of repair.  Easy enough to avoid that.  My room was clean.  Breakfast was hot (scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles).  Pool area was nice and well maintained.  Staff was very helpful.  There are two guest laundry areas and a fitness center.  Car rental is just next door.  Very convenient location and tons of restaurants around.
Manager Response: Thanks for choosing La Quinta!  My team and I are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thanks for your patience while we repair our entry to the lobby.  I hope your travels bring you back to the area to stay with us again.

Summary: Hotel is old needs a serious remodel. I would gladly pay more to stay at a more modern and new hotel. Breakfast staff rude and unwelcoming I just wanted my family out of that environment. The lobby was not easy to get into due to some emergency construction. Pool area old and dirty.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing La Quinta!  I have read your review and l apologize that you did not enjoy your stay with us.  I would like the opportunity to discuss your experience.  Please reach out to me at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com

Summary: The hotel is in desperate need of renovation. The carpet was filthy and stained. The furniture did not match. The floor tile in the bathroom is cracked and pitted. There were long hairs in the tub and on the floor. A dirty wash cloth in the closet. This was my worst experience with La Quinta Inn and Suites. The staff was very friendly, however.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing La Quinta!  Looks like we dropped the ball on providing you a comfortable stay.  I would like the opportunity to discuss your experience.  Please reach out to me at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com

Summary: Staff knowledge of their own Preferred customer program. Staff was however generally helpful and pleasant. Room was clean. Linen however was stained and looked so wrinkled that I had doubts they had changed linens between customers.

I enjoyed the breakfast also Iam happy about it I wish the price was lower everyday of the week but it was affordable and clean and the parking wasn't a problem I would stay again in the future and it was very nice having a computer that we can use with a printer was great I wish the laundry facility was better but it wasn't bad I wish there was more then one washer and one dryer but hey I enjoyed my stay
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing La Quinta!  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us!  I have shared your comments with my team and we look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary: Room was very spacious, beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The front desk workers were friendly and helpful. When we called for more towels and a blanket we had it within minutes. The pool and hot tub looked very nice though our flight left before we could use it. The breakfast was typical but the food was hot when it should have been and there were good choices.  Important to us include a fan that runs all night if you choose ( we like the noise) and a good shower.  This hotel had both! We will definitely be back !

Does what it says, clean room and perfect location should u wish to do LA city and the beaches. Don't go here for a holiday it's a bed to let u explore on a budget. The free breakfast is brilliant for being free but please do not try to compare breakfast to something u pay for in another hotel

I needed to stay in Santa Ana one night for business and the hotel staff had me checked in immediately. My room was affordable, quiet, clean and spacious. They have a lovely pool, hot tub, free wifi, and a free breakfast.

Summary Heading: A great hotel to stay at in Orange County
Summary: Great caring staff that want to make your stay enjoyable. Great atmosphere and location. Close to IKEA and other shopping places. We loved staying at this hotel and we will definitely be returning in the near future :)

Fly in , Hotel shuttle pick up. Very easy and staff on point. 1 bed suite comfy but the breakfast was not good. Staff seems young but able to help at any moment. Easy drive to anywhere. Restaurants everywhere.

The room was clean and the staff was friendly.  Breakfast was good.  The hotel is very close to freeways, gas stations, and fast food.   Bathroom had a strong sewer smell, kept the door close and my stay was fine.

Bad stay. was given a room that was still dirty from previous guest. second room was on a floor with trash on walkway and non working ice machine. Staff left cleaning equipment in passage way and hotel appears to have structure issues as the entrance was blocked off due to roof collapse

Summary Heading: Not representative of most La Quintas
Summary: Room was not up to par... stained carpets and bed covers and dirty bath tile. Just felt that the room was not up to past experiences with La Quinta properties and I have stayed in many because I often travel with my dog.

I stayed one night and enjoyed every aspect of my stay...EXCEPT the room was spacious and walls were "thin" that I could hear normal conversations at 10:30pm!  Bring earplugs, or use the tv ocean sounds to drown out the poor room design/structure.   Breakfast was great with varying selections of fresh food.  Internet worked fabulously!  Staff were helpful and courteous from start to finish.

Uber driver pulls up. We look at each other in sheer curiosity with maybe a little fear. The front is cordoned off in yellow hazard tape. I ask the nice young man at the front desk... before checking in, why is the front all yellow taped... his response-- oh, it rained and started falling apart so we didn't want anyone getting hurt. Hmm, ok. That's "good" right? Anyway, I'd like a room on first floor please. Sure, he says. No problem. I get to my room and open the door. First thing I see is a big arm chair laying in the bed...maybe they shampooed and forgot to.... Nope, it smells opposite of freshly shampooed carpet. I back out to look at room #... Yup, it's the number he gave me. I leave my bag near the door just in case furniture is not done being moved around or .... I reach

I am again in Santa Ana, Ca. for business. Typically I stay at another hotel in Santa Ana but this La Quinta  was less expensive. Having had an excellent experience at another La Quinta, I decided to stay here this trip. Boy what a mistake....... I asked for a king suite. I was first given a wheelchair accessible room. The room was supposed to be a no smoking room. It smelled like it was a smoking room in the past. It was musty and smelled like it used to be a smoking room. The room looked like it had original everything... from carpeting, to cabinetry, and the bathroom is in sore need of an upgrade as well. The front desk did a courtesy call to see if I liked the room. I expressed my issues and the very nice desk clerk offered another room just 2 doors down. I asked if I could

A family of four staying in town for a memorial service of family member. Hotel was convenient to freeway, loved the breakfast that comes with the price of the room. Found old food in the microwave when we went to use it, so had to clean it out first, but otherwise the room was clean and beds were comfortable (if not small for two people).

The hotel needs some work.  The place is falling down.  The front of the hotel is covered with yellow tape.  The entrance where you would park to check-in is deteriorating and was not fixed during the week we were there.  The hotel needs updating badly.  The good thing I have to say is that the hotel is in a good location and that we were able to park our car for a week with no problems.  The shuttle doesn't start running until 5:30 am and we had an early morning flight which was a real rush to get to the airport on time.  We called a cab to pick us up at 5:00 am but it never showed.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your comments about your experiences at our La Quinta Inns & Suites in Santa Ana, CA. We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your stay, and we're sorry about the construction at the entrance of our hotel.  I assure you we are working diligently with our contractors to complete this project expeditiously. Once again thank you for sharing your experience with us. I hope you'll come back and give us another try!

Summary: When in Tustin visiting my family I always stay at the La Quinta.  Clean rooms.  Adequate breakfast. Price is right. The breakfast is a bit Spartan but all in all good enough.The location could not be better.  5 minutes from John Wayne Airport.

The room was very clean and seemed quiet.  I didn't know where the ice machine was and that would have been nice.  7am is too late for travelers to eat breakfast and get on the road, 6am would have been better.  I left without eating.

Just staying over night to catch an early flight.  Dirty walkways, cig butts littered about.  But inside the room was great.  Comfortable bed and recently renovated room.  It got worse as there was a couple in the room next to us that were up all night going in and out of the room going out to their car and turning their radio up. When they were in the room I could hear them through the bathroom wall.  Told the manager when we checked out but he did not seem that concerned.  Apologized and said that's too bad...... The outside entry is not good here, In my opinion it is inviting for people like the couple who were in the room next to us.

This hotel was a great deal- and in a perfect location. It is close to John Wayne airport, Irvine shops, Irvine Spectrum, Santa Ana, Anaheim sights. The breakfast was good- a wide variety of choices. I did not have to walk far from my car to the room.

After I checked out, it was reported to me, by both my adult daughter and by my boyfriend that they had found cockroaches in the bathroom. Had I known that I would have had an absolute fit. Because I had already been upset and called customer service about the double beds.I would have called and demanded my miles put back into my account. I am still very upset about this hotel stay that almost all my miles were deducted and no type of compromise about the hotel room. I love LaQuinta hotels, but this one fell far below my expectations.

We stayed here on the third floor on March 12, 2016. The staff was friendly and our room was not too bad, except for the strong odor of dog and a stain in the middle of the floor. Otherwise this was a friendly, safe, and somewhat affordable hotel very close to the airport and interstate highway. There isn't much around other than other hotels, but it doesn't take long to find a restaurant or gas station. The pool and courtyard, as well as the glass elevators, make this La Quinta Inn stand out. We especially liked the breakfast area in the courtyard by the pool.

asked staff before we went in our room to remove feather pillows and anything else that had pillows. My wife has huge allergy. We went to dinner came back slept and guess what feather pillows. My wife eyes we swelled shut thank you for listening. Entrance you cant drive in its falling down marked off. Hey why don't you play banjo music to deliverance ?

Summary Heading: Great location for our soccer team
Summary: Nice and convenient location.  Close to malls, food, freeways and even the beach.  Rooms were clean, breakfast was nice and staff provided excellent customer service.  Only wish beds were queens vs. full size, but not a huge deal.

La Quinta is one of the most dog friendly hotel chains in America. They don't have size restrictions and they do not charge pet fees. As a family that takes our dog with us on vacation, this is the perfect hotel for us. Good places to walk your pup and the free breakfast is a plus.

Upon arrival we were greeted by several 2x10 beams supporting the entry canopy, so check-in was awkward. The outside of the hotel was rather worn compared to the other hotels in proximity. The staff was very pleasant and quick for check in and out, so there are no complaints there. The room was simple and clean, but just seemed as though it was half renovated. For the price in this area it was a good pick though.

I booked this hotel through a third party and it was prepaid.  Four days later looking at my credit card statement I see an additional charge. For what?? For years I stayed at many hotels that once I checked out it was settled (because prepaid). This is the first experience where This hotel charged me for the stay.  If I had not pay attention I will be double billed. That is shady practice. I think the hotel is nice, but this really ruin it. I don't want businesses that put additional charges on credit cards and if the customer doesn't pay attention then too bad you'll be charged more.

carpets and furniture were gross. didn't feel comfortable walking on carpet without shoes and sofa looked soiled from who knows what. bathroom and bed seemed clean and nice. place just needs some tlc.
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel.  I apologize the room condition was not up to standard, I will share your comments with my team to better improve our product.  I hope your travels bring you back to the area so we can show you the improvements we are making.

Summary: Stayed at this La Quinta several times and always been satisfied with the room.  The room with the kingsize bed feels almost like a suite.   Breakfast ok.   Didn't have my dogs with me this time, but love La Quintas for allowing dogs.

Valentine Weekend all hotels were full. I needed a place to stay to lay over for early morning flight. I used sleepparkfly website to purchase the room but it had not appropriately scheduled my hotel stay with Laquinta. The attendant Jose and his supervisor found accommodations for  me.The was was clean and comfortable. Now the breakfast was horrible. No meat no eggs and the only fruit was bananas and apples. I really appreciate their help.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing La Quinta Inn & Suites Santa Ana!    I am pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and will be happy to share your comments with our team.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: Friendly staff. Basic breakfast. Room was clean, but flooring could stand to be redone. Room quiet, except for noisy inconsiderate guests in front of hotel. (Room was directly above entrance.) Elevator available, but plenty of stairwells to  I needed a quick access to freeway, but in decent neighborhood. This property is in a cluster of other hotels and has quick access to simple dining (nothing fancy and walking distance), with plenty of other options within 2 miles driving distance. Price was under $100 on Friday night in Orange County, which was really good considering the alternative lower priced (and scary) options. Plenty of parking.

My family and I are use to staying at the Quanlity Suites there in the area and decided to give the La Quinta a try. It was still close to the 55 and Disneyland. Plus free breakfast isn't bad. ;-)  However, our room was smaller than we thought and the bathroom did carry a musty smell. Though this was a non smoking room, there were burn marks in the couch and ottoman which made them not the most desirable to sit on. The breakfast was also very limited.  Overall though, I would say our stay was good, but not anything great. We will be staying at our usually more than likely next time.

Rooms need updating.  Stained rugs and broken tiles in the bathroom.  Grouting is filthy.  They used of offer USA Today. They used to offer bacon/sausage and eggs. Gone down hill Price is very affordable Staff is wonderful

Born and raised in Orange County California now living in Texas and also being a La Quinta rewards customer I expected a much nicer place! After reading some bad reviews I went ahead and booked for five days. I'm the type of person that likes to see for myself and that I did! My expectations are not high but this particular La Quinta really needs to make changes! As soon as we walked in, the room smelled muggy, rug was dirty, bathtub had chipped paint and somewhat dirty, water backed up in shower, needs serious furniture update, couch was hard and uncomfortable. It seems like they let people live there and at night we noticed all types of people. Our neighbors had different people coming in and out all day and night and that says a lot! Honestly, not a good choice to stay here!!
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I would like the opportunity to chat with you, please email your contact number and a good time to call at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com.

Summary: Transients wander the halls, parking lot and eat breakfast in the breakfast room. They do have smoking rooms which is very rare.  The room smelled moldy/musty not like smoke. TV connector was loose and not working well.

I first stayed here when I was going to see a show at The Sanata Ana Observatory just up the street. I have been back ever since due to their quality clean rooms that are worth their price. The staff is very friendly and open to my many questions about the area.  It is a little noisy due to the area it is around, but nothing that's unbearable. I always stay here when traveling from John Wayne airport that's just a 20 minute drive down the street. Anytime I will be in Santa Ana I will stay definitely stay here.

Stayed at La Quinta Inn for my  husbands birthday.  Only thing was we thought it was a bit pricey for the accommodations and it was very crowded (the other La Quinita we stay at usually was filled).  The room was comfortable and the bed was VERY well made

When I arrived both the room smelled and the bathroom smelled. There were long hairs visible on the floor, the toilet, and in the bath. After showering in the morning I grabbed what I thought was a clean towel folded with the other towels. Long hairs began sticking to me from the towel. Someone had used the towel and folded it back up.  That's when I sniffed the bed linens. All but 2 of the pillows smelled of hair products. The room hadn't been cleaned. I notified the front desk and asked them to have the room cleaned thoroughly during the day while I was gone. When I got back to my room that evening the room hadn't been serviced. Everything was just as I'd left it. I called to the front desk and told them the situation. I asked for clean towels and linens. They brought up a few
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your stay at the La Quinta Santa Ana. We're very concerned about the issues you've mentioned and are sorry that we dropped the ball as we did during your stay. You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and we failed you here. We're very sorry and we'd like to chat with you further about your specific situation. Would you reach out to us at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks again for your review, and we're looking forward to chatting with you soon!

Summary: The hotel room smelled heavily of smoke and foul smelling cleaning products.  The air conditioning/heating unit emitted moldy, musty odors.  The room and furniture were old, worn and needed a serious update.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments regarding your stay at our property in Santa Ana. We're sorry about the experiences you've mentioned, and your comments are concerning to us. I would like to opportunity to chat with you.  Please reach out to me at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com. I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: I ended up staying at 3 of the hotels adjacent to this at one time or other and this was not the best of those but it was good for the price. Breakfast was average for a low cost hotel except that they fixed the waffles for you. An adjacent property actually makes a full breakfast for you.

I was very disappointed with this hotel, I stay at La Quinta Hotels often, there breakfast buffet consisted of a large pot of oatmeal that looked like paste, bananas, apples, yogurt a very SMALL variety of  breads, cold cereal, and a waffle maker which you could never get on, juice and coffee, and it was the same EVERY day and we were here for 10 days, need less to say we went out to eat. We were on bottom floor and had children upstairs and had to call the front desk a few nights at the same time to call this quest to be quiet and tell children to quit running and jumping. My husband is handicapped and we needed the bottom floor or would have changed rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay.  Your feedback is important to us and we will share your comments with our team to better improve our service and product.  We hope your travels bring you back to the area so we can show you our improvements.

Summary Heading: Very Tired but Clean, Inexpensive, Good Parking
Summary: This hotel is very tired.  It was clean, though some mold in the bathroom, but just a little. Bed was comfortable.  We choose the hotel because one nights stay included a week of free parking and that worked for us.  It was okay for one night, very inexpensive.
Manager Response: We've received your comments regarding your recent stay at the La Quinta Inns & Suites Santa Ana, CA. We're sorry for the issues you encountered and appreciate you taking the time to write of your experiences. We've definitely got some training opportunities at this hotel and your feedback will help us correct these issues with our team.

Summary: The desk clerks, especially Jose, welcome you and are attentive and accommodating. I walked in without a reservation due to finding a hotel I had previously booked very undesirable. Jose let me inspect and choose between two vacant rooms prior to checking in, and even let me check in early without a reservation -- very helpful and much appreciated with my dog and cat in tow! The room smelled wonderful, was clean and inviting, was spacious, and well-appointed. The bed is a Beautyrest, the bedding is plush (down comforter and pillows and high thread count linens). The towels are soft and a nice weight as well. Breakfast is continental with the addition of waffles. USA Today is complimentary while supplies last. Most of the guests are respectable and polite adults. I stayed twice

I was very disappointed for the first time in all the times I've stayed at a La Quinta Inn. The condition of the room was not as usual for the La Quinta Inns. There was a mix-up in the reservation and after we had gotten in to a room and settled it was the wrong room and we had to move everything again to another room. Just was very disappointed. The young lady on the front desk was very helpful and sorry for all the problems.

I have stayed at MANY La Quinta Hotels in the past year.  This one did not seem to have the breakfast that the others had.  The hotel staff was great, however.  The last day the computer in the lobby did not work.  The person behind the counter was able to print my boarding passes and pay for the suitcases for me.  That was above and beyond.

Some good , some not so good.  The experiences detailed to my satisfaction  in earlier comments associated with this survey.   Good location, good staff and services but very poor condition to the room itself , maintenance to the exterior of the building and lack of attention to the landscaping areas, especially in the pet friendly areas.  Although waste bags were provided to address pet elimination, they were not used, at least in the grass area in front my of my room

Hotel is average and works well for a vacation on a budget. Grounds and pool are very nice. Rooms could use a remodel but bed was clean and comfortable. Not far from the beach but traffic on the surrounding freeways is terrible.

It was a mixed bag. The first room was smokey, second stained, but they graciously switched us to a nice clean room. It was definitely adequate, but not great. The eating area outside of the buffet is beautifully landscaped and the food offering pretty good.

We wanted to arrive close to the OC Airport the night before our early morning flight. The hotel offered park, stay & Fly at a reasonable price.The room was basic, a little dark especially in the bathroom. The room was clean with a comfortable bed perfect for our short stay. I don't think we would stay any longer just because it was so basic. Parking was outside with no apparent security, somewhat disturbing since the area is industrial. The shuttle to airport was on time and quick with very personable drivers.

I've stayed at several La Quinta locations and this one by far has been the best. The room was huge and the beds always comfortable. The man at the front desk was super nice. I already have a second trip booked at this hotel
Manager Response: Thanks so much for choosing La Quinta!  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay!  Hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed there for one night before leaving on an early morning flight out of John Wayne airport.  We did the park and fly which allowed us to park the car for seven days for free if spending a night at the hotel.  The shuttle service was efficient, both to and from the airport.  The room was comfortable for one night.  Would stay there again for an early flight out of John Wayne airport.

Summary Heading: Need to have better wall and carpet
Summary: Need new Lock, was very hard to open each time going in to the room. The Carpet is old and need to be replaced. Wall was pretty thin which one can hear other people having affair at night. Would like to have little bit more choice of food variety for breakfast. Very convenient location close to freeway exit and gas station for quick shopping.

The location is good,close to the airport with a shuttle available. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient. My room was cleaned but smelled strongly of cigarette smoke (it was a no smoking room). The carpet was badly stained in several places,as was the chair. the carpet was also wet in several places. There was no shower curtain.

I've been staying here thanks to PL's Express deals...it is solid and I actually prefer it to the Quality Inn next door. Also a suite, I like the layout. A friend who has to commute from the Eastern SGV was able to stay with me a few times during the past months that I've stayed here, and the location is perfect. The breakfast isn't as good as Quality, but more than decent. I'll keep staying here as long as the price is right.

Summary Heading: a nice 6 night stay and close to where we wanted
Summary: The Hotel breakfast was adequate and service excellent. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We have stayed here before and always enjoyed the stay. It was located where we needed to be. Will not fly into LAX again and stay down there .We know the area and close to what we wanted.

Hotel is not properly rated.  This should be at best a two star hotel, not the 2.5 as indicated.  That being said, the rooms were not as clean as they should be, carpet stained, dated decor and so forth.  Shower took some playing with to get it to work right.  BEWARE:  I had a couple of items stolen from the back of my pickup.  While I know better than to leave anything of real value out like this, it was a trunk that was chained and locked.  The thief used bolt cutters.  I went to inquire about the security footage and was told that they don't use camera systems that it was too much hassle.  If a hotel can't use security cameras to help deter thieves, then they obviously don't take care of their guests.  The trunk was worth more than the two days worth of dirty clothes we had
Manager Response: We've read your review of our La Quinta in Santa Ana.  We're concerned about the issues you're mentioning and we'd like to chat with you further about your situation so we can ensure what you’ve experienced doesn’t happen again. Would you mind reaching out to us at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com so we can talk to you further? Thanks for your feedback, and we're hoping to hear from you soon!

Summary: The staff at this hotel were very nice and friendly. Unfortunately, the room was unclean and out-dated. Bathroom floor obviously was not cleaned before I checked in and the carpet was stained and dirty. The white socks I was wearing were dirty after walking on the carpet. The furniture was old and outdated.  My worst La Quinta experience. I was supposed to stay two nights but I checked out after the first night and went to stay in another hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel.  Our goal is to ensure all of our guests are settled in comfortably.  It appears that we dropped the ball on providing you that, and I would like to discuss your stay with us.  Please contact me at lq2006gm@lqreviews.com  Kindest Regards.

Summary: We had a great 14 day stay due to home renovation. Friendly, professional staff, good continental breakfast, nice jacuzzi, very clean, would stay again. Great for pets!  All of the staff were great! Our dog escaped our room once while we were at breakfast and she was safely rescued by the staff and taken to a room until we returned to find her missing. She's a great dane (large animal!). They were wonderful! Any per owner would love this place!
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to share your experience with us!  We are pleased you enjoyed your stay!  We hope your travels bring you back to the area again to stay with us!

Summary: Picked up at SNA, quick drive to hotel, check in took maybe 2 minutes, room, pool, hot tub all fine. Check out quick, easy and efficient, driver left for SNA right on time and dropped me off at my airline. All the staff was very friendly and courteous. No problems, good value.

This hotel is perfect for the business traveler, or who needs proximity to the John Wayne Airport.  But for the tourist, there are no sights, not even a place to walk nearby.  The hotel is surrounded by strip malls and industrial parks.

Summary Heading: Great place to relax at the end of the day
Summary: Clean and spacious room, comfy bed, relaxing soak in the hot tub.  No need to worry about breakfast because it's all laid out in the morning.  Makes staying away from home for work (or play) easy-peasy.

My cousin & I stayed at this property 2 nights, first while awaiting availability to our timeshare in Laguna Beach & last the night before we flew back to Portland Oregon. It's clean, comfortable & conveniently located to John Wayne airport. The "Brightside" breakfast is okay, however the hotel generates a tremendous amount of trash, by using styrofoam dishes & plastic flatware. It's completely irresponsible, for a property of this size to be so wasteful. The pool & spa close at 10pm, which was inconvenient with temperatures in the low 80's at closing time. I will stay there again, because I'm a returns member, but I'd be more enthusiastic if the afore mentioned policies would change.

I stayed from 9/30 - 10/5/2015. The property was clean and well maintained. The guest room was very clean and well appointed. I stayed in room #350 which is a very quiet end room, I really appreciated this! If you stay here, remember to ask the front desk for a map of the grounds upon check in otherwise you might walk around for a while looking for your room. I highly recommend this motel, the staff were all helpful and the room was excellent! I used their airport shuttle the first night and back to the airport the next day to pick up my rental car. Every staff person I met was helpful and knowledgeable.

I was nervous after reading some other reviews, but hotel was clean, room was large, bed was comfy, and it was quiet.  My flight was too early in the morning to be able to try the breakfast, though.  Location for me was really good, too, so I'll definitely be coming back.

I stay at many La Quinta hotels around the country. This location has huge rooms, a nice lobby and large indoor/outdoor breakfast area. The bathrooms could be a  bit larger, but most budget hotels are pretty old buildings. My room was clean, quiet and a great value.

Excellent location for one arriving from the airport. The room was extremely spacious so it's excellent for the whole family. The room could definitely be a bit more clean, because of the weather in Southern California it is easy for bugs to get into the room and if it not cleaned properly you will find bugs in room. Breakfast in the morning gets extremely busy, not so sure if it's worth the whole hassle.

I stayed for one night because I had work in the area.  The staff I encountered were all professional, helpful, and friendly.  The room is spacious and had a small refrigerator and a microwave.  The room was a bit run down and dark.  Parking is free.  The rates here were less than the hotels nearby.

Read the good reviews, they're true. Read the bad reviews, they're true too. My husband had a seminar in Costa Mesa, so needed a decent, yet affordable place for the baby and I to post up for the weekend. I initially asked for a room on the first floor that was close to the parking lot, so Jose gave me 161. Right as I stepped into the room I could smell dog! I understand that LQ is pet friendly, but it smelled like a dog lived in there, unacceptable! I asked to change rooms and there was no problem, Jose courteously fulfilled my request. The 2nd room smelled normal, phew! Paid $99/night and I think that was fair.  PROS:  - Bed and pillows are comfy, I prefer softer beds so this was good - Centrally located - Free parking - Free Continental breakfast  - Free late checkout at 1p -

Summary Heading: Good location, spacious but not so clean rooms
Summary: This La Quinta Inn's location is great. Very close to freeway however not noisy. Very close to the District Mall and also near to a shopping center which includes Walmart, etc. It's a bit far away from beach.  The room was very spacious but not very clean. The bathroom and shower were very clean.  Comfortable and clean mattress.  The breakfast includes waffle, boiled egg, oatmeal, toast, bagel, cheese, and drinks. I would recommend it if you can get a good deal.

The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was pretty good and the pool area was very nice.  The location is very good also. We really enjoyed our stay.  The only thing that would have made the room better is a mini fridge and microwave.

if you are looking for relaxation, don't come here.  staff allows tenants to crank music and TV all night long.  despite my multiple calls to the front desk, nothing was done.  rooms are nice, staff in general are nice but I believe that the night staff either doesn't care or are afraid to confront noisy guests to satisfy the comfort of everyone one else.

I prefer the hotels where the room opens to the outside instead of a hallway inside a hotel so I was pleased this hotel was like that.  Staff was very friendly and the grounds were great.  Not too far from Disneyland.  And of course they accept pets, which is why we always stay at LaQuintas when they are close to the area we are visiting.

Since our last stay in 2008 the rooms did not get any makeover. Rugs are dirty and smell bad. Breakfast Items are average. Nothing special anymore compared to other hotels. Surrounding is nice, quick to nearby freeways. Noisy because of freeway and nearby airport.

Had tickets for Hall and Oates at the Verzion Amphitheater knew it would be late so got a room near by. What a nice clean room. Big and near shopping areas and resturants.  Laundry rooms on every floor and free continental breakfast in the morning.

Stayed in room 310; very clean and spacious. King bed was comfy, couch was a good size, and there was plenty of closet space. I loved how many pillows and towels the hotel provided us with. You can hear the occasional airplane flying over, but it's not too bothersome. The pool and jacuzzi were great!

We switched reservations from one La Quinta to another as my husband wanted and a Jacuzzi and they are Pet friendly.  We brought our dogs, they have an area with poop bags and everything.  From check in to check out; the staff was on it.  I have traveled a lot, but don't as much as I used to.  When we walked in the room it was perfect! Large, open, a nice little couch and table, fridge, microwave, clean and smelled very nice, the bathroom was immaculate.  I highly recommend this property.  I will be back; it's only 20 minutes to Dog Beach (HB).  I will tell others. We were completely satisfied.

The room was good but wish the lighting was brighter making it easier to read to my children at night and find their toys thrown about the room. The toilet didn't really want to flush resulting in arguments between my two kids of one or the other not flushing. The towels were extra soft and the staffed seemed really nice.

Upon entry room appeared to be nice.  But carpets were heavily soiled and material covered chair needed cleaning as well. Didn't want to walk on carpet, so I keep my socks on.  I used a towel to cover desk chair and placed my suitcase on bed. On entry into bathroom I was alarmed that the bathtub needed scorning and the faucet had fungal growth on it.

Stayed in this hotel one night in Aug 2015 (was planning to stay two nights but left after one). The hotel is ok for its price in this area but I would not recommend staying there for business travel. The room is big and generally OK but the TV is in the sitting area and far away from the bed. The window is facing the balcony which is used to walk between the rooms so it needs to be closed all time. Breakfast was very poor but typical to La Quinta (Its been years since I stayed in La Quinta so got used to a different level of breakfast). Bottom like - good for family that is looking for something not expensive in the area. If you are a businessman I would recommend to look for something better even if it costs a little more,

La Quinta Inn & Suites Orange County - Santa Ana was an OK hotel.  For the price in Orange County it was fair.  Not a bad place, it is just the area that it is located is just not too great....Again, the price was right..

Great hotel, Nice people , Nice stay. Would come back. This location is close to work and many attractions in the area. Accommodations were clean and tidy. I would come back and stay anytime here. I recommend it.

This is not a hotel you travel to for the hotel, but it is near several great attractions (mostly Disneyland resort).  The hotel is comfortable (though my husband and I found the beds way too soft), the breakfast is nice and the price is right.

We are planning a road trip in the near future. We will look for La Quinta hotels on the way. We were happy with our last stay . It was clean and affordable. The staff was very helpful and greeted us when we entered the lobby.

Very nice and clean. however I think it's time for a remodel or an upgrade. But it was a nice stay and comfortable. The breakfast could use a little more variety but it was a good location so I would stay at this one again.

I stayed for business.  It was close to the places I need to be & it was safe. Close to restaurants.  Clean rooms & they were very spacious.  Lot bigger room than most hotels.  Breakfast was good & they were very friendly.

Very comfortable room and clean service, breakfast is very good, staffs are very friendly. I arrived the hotel later, and still received a very friendly welcome in the front desk. The hot breakfast is very good, included fruits and other stuffs, very taste.

Love that you can travel with your dog and have a nice place to stay. Love the free breakfast. easy freeway access. We stay at the Flagstaff Arizona La Quinta a lot and that has a great area to walk your dogs. The staff is always nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Average at best, not the nicest La Quinta
Summary: I am a fan of La Quinta's in general,  but this location is not up to standards.  Room size and amenities are ok. Not the nicest, cleanest room. WiFi is free but weak. Free breakfast is in a hot room that served the same items daily and ran out a lot. Location is good, right off a highway and close to many beaches and locations.  Service has been average,  below average in the breakfast area. Water pressure is not that good in the shower or toilet!  Will not he my first choice when visiting this area again.

This is not the top La Qunta and perhaps another hotel there on Hotel Terrace would be a better choice.  We just needed a place to sleep after a long day of driving and needed to be close to the Orange County Airport to pick up family early in the morning.  It is definitely close to the airport and the planes overhead are evident!!  The planes do not fly all night however.  The room was large, just seemed dated.  We were not happy with the TV and a call to the desk quickly brought two maintenance men.  They could not fix our complaint since it was more about the cable service. We didn't bother to go the the breakfast in the morning.

Spent 7 days and not a problem. Everyone was very helpful and the place and rooms were clean and tidy. will stay there again when in LA. Location was central to all the places we wanted to go and not hard to get to.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Great Staff, Average Accommodation
Summary: I'm a La Quinta fan and stay at LQ whenever possible, mainly because I tend to travel with my dogs. However, even though this trip was a solo overnight, I thought I'd try LQ anyway. The property was a little odd, looked like it was a '50s style motel that LQ tried to dress up with a nicer lobby. The rooms were situated on three stories surrounding a central pool area which was not so nice (and lots of noisy kids splashing around the night I was there, but that's neither here nor there). My room was fine, clean and not unattractive, and was large, with a small seating area with a couch and table, in addition to a desk. The staff was super-friendly and helpful, and the location was conveniently located right near a freeway. Would I stay there again? Probably so, but not for more

I don't know how this La Quinta got such high scores. My daughter and I stayed one night. We found long strands of hair everywhere; on the towels, sheets, toilet and sink. It smelled old in our room and the layout of the room was odd, to say the least. I would not stay here, again, even if it were free.

Ok so I'll admit, this place wasn't exactly my first choice. But since a member of the family has a dog, it was our go-to place. First thought walking into the room: it's okkkkkk. Room was actually a little bigger than expected. Enjoyed being able to freeze a few bottles of water in the mini freezer/fridge. Bathroom is definitely on the small side and is located right in front of the bed. Breakfast is very basic. Parking gets pretty full at night. Pool is on the small side so don't expect too much from a motel. Shower made a drilling sound when turned on. If you just need a place to crash and shower and don't want to pay a arm and a leg, this is your spot.

I stayed with two other co workers and we were very happy with our stay. We stayed in a room with a pull out bed that maybe could have a little better mattress but I slept fine in it. The breakfast was very good too.

Room had smell, breakfast was very lacking, filthy carpet, dirty bathroom. Tried to tell us that there was no doubles left and tried to split us into 2 rooms when clearly the reservation showed we had children.

This location is complete trash--both the people who stay here and the actual hotel. Our room smelled like animals and cigarettes. There was a bag over the smoke detector and the room looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years. I stayed at this location 2 years ago and it wasn't this bad. But I will certainly never stay here again.

For a budget, family traveler. This hotel can't be beat. Clean rooms, not far from Newport or Huntington Beach. Only an hour from LA. Free great breakfast. Friendly, helpful staff. Great prices! Will definitely stay again!

The property was clean and very convenient to the airport.  At some point they built a a restaurant in the courtyard rendering 50% of the rooms that had a courtyard view no view at all plus the noise of breakfast being prepared at 6:00 am on.

Our room was awesome, very clean and roomy, would definitely stay here again. Good access to airport and shopping and restaurants. Hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Hotel grounds were very nice and clean and well kept.

I have been to other La Quinta's and had been satisfied with them.  But the Santa Ana location we stayed at had the dirtiest carpet I have ever seen in a hotel/motel.  There were numerous stains, I wonder if it ever gets shampooed/steam cleaned.  The twin pull out sofa bed had a stained and worn cushion, and the very thin mattress let you feel every metal support.  It was the most uncomfortable mattress I have ever slept on.  Also unlike the other La Quinta's I've stayed at, this one's breakfast was the same every morning, the items never changed.  On the plus side, the grounds are nicely landscaped with plenty of grass areas for those with dogs.

First time staying at a  La Quinta hotel. Choose this chain because they were pet friendly. Not sure what to expect but this hotel was near what we planned to do. First location-hotel was situated within a group of several hotels in a good area  We felt very safe and secure. This location was  centralized to what we wanted to visit. Approximately 9 miles -20 minutes in traffic to Huntington Beach State  Park - 10 miles from Anaheim Stadium-less then 30 minutes travel time in rush hour traffic Park  The hotel itself was well maintained and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a King Suite. This room had a separate sleeping area divided by a closet from the living room. We had a love seat, chair and ottoman. We also had a wet bar with microwave and a

Summary Heading: carpet was old. sofa had holes and was worn out
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 1 wk. This hotel needs remodel. The bathroom is right in front of the bed. furniture was old and worn out. Staff is friendly. check in and out process are good. Happy with free wifi and parking.

Attractive and very clean hotel.  No loud people.  I actually used the washer and dryer for the first time in a hotel was very clean.  Jacuzzi and pool very clean.  Lots of places to eat around the hotel even walking distance.

Even though she was limited in the ways she could be of assistance to me, Angelica Flores still managed to put a smile right back on my face and made me feel right at home and comfortable all while being locked out of my room. Geeze. Shes better to me than the friend i'm staying here with who freakin' forgot to put my name on the reservation!!!! Thank you for being a sweet heart!

This is our favorite hotel to stay at when visiting friends and family in the Santa Ana area.  Reasonable rates, clean rooms, helpful staff, and a great breakfast.  The check-in was quick and they were able to accommodate the floor we wanted.  I did notice that the walkways are a bit slippery.  Positive interactions with hotel staff was 4 out of 5.  In other words, four were very helpful and friendly.  The person working housekeeping must have had an off day because I got nothing but a sour look when saying good morning.

Summary Heading: Great price - Good location - Big comfortable room
Summary: We just needed an inexpensive room for one night before our cruise out of Long Beach. *The price was right, and the room turned out to be bigger & nicer than I expected. We called for their airport shuttle when we arrived. Check-in was fast and easy.  We sat out by the pool for a while. It's really cool to hear and see planes flying right over, since it's so close to the airport! There were lots of other hotels nearby, so we just walked next door to find a nice restaurant for dinner. Breakfast is out near pool area - just typical continental fare - nothing special. Ladies stocking it were very nice.  -Overall, we were pleasantly surprised by how comfortable the room was. Nice big desk with ergonomic chair. Big sitting area with couch and chair. Bar with fridge & microwave. Free

I stayed last year in Destin ( Florida) , but your Hotel is comfortable to us, especially has Shuttle to Airport. Problem to my friend that they pick -up very far from Orange County. Next time if we travel to CA, we will rent a car or choice La QUINTA  in Orange County.

Hotel is OK. Free parking and shuttle to the airport. Overall hotel common areas could be cleaner. Our room had basketball size spot on rug by front door and shampoos not provided.  Beds were very comfortable and bedding very clean. Inconveniences were typical for this price range hotel.  Mostly quiet and easy to sleep considering the number of families and children there on the holiday weekend. OK value for the money.

Coming to Orange County can be a cold and harsh experience. The traffic and hustle of the city is very daunting. La Quinta was a haven of peace and quiet in the midst of the noise and stress of the city. The staff made me feel welcome and the atmosphere of the hotel was one of a beautiful oasis. My room was comfortable and very restful. Very nice to come home to.

Stayed here for a couple of days on business. The room was clean the grounds were nice and the staff pleasant. The grounds were well kept and I liked the open feeing. The room was bigger than I expected. The bathroom was a little tight but fine. The carpet was very dirty and in need of regular cleaning.

Summary Heading: Didn't Get What I Paid For...
Summary: When I arrived at this hotel I was informed that my reservation for my 2 Queen Beds Room had been given away because I had not reconfirmed my reservation. Additionally, the staff was very rude about this and didn't apologize for the inconvenience. No matter what I was going to be upset about having to sleep on the floor with my wife but maybe an apology or a room discount would have made me feel a little better. The following day when I received my new room the cards to enter were not working. Same rude employee stated that I need to be more careful because I demagnetized the cards. So if something goes wrong at this hotel, please know that it is your fault, not the employees. Definitely would not stay here again. Pay a little more to stay closer to Disneyland and get better

Great staff. Very helpful and warm. I stay here every time I am in Sanata Ana. Close to LA, Angels, Disneyland and work. Great value compared to all hotels in the area. Easy entry to all freeways and close to Newport if you want to go to the beach.

it was a place to sleep, convenient to where we went, but definitely not comparable to most LaQuintas we have been at.  There is someone who cooks your waffle just to get tips.  Front desk staff does not even tell guests there is a free breakfast.  Bathroom fixtures are pretty gross.

My wife booked this hotel for myself and our two kids, while she stayed at another hotel, in the area, for her conference.  It was a comfortable hotel and the kids enjoyed the breakfast - mini waffles or large waffles, your choice.  The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and my son (7) loved the pull out couch just his size - which would be small for an adult. It was conveniently located to where we needed to be without a lot of miscellaneous driving.

It is hard to find a pet friendly hotel for one night without paying a ridiculous surcharge but this hotel is pet friendly with no added expense. We were able to bring our dog and found the facilities perfect to get in and out quickly when he needed to go outside. What a deal!!   The location is great- close to John Wayne Airport and right off the freeway.   The room was clean however the carpet was filthy. Perhaps this was because it was a pet room but we had to wear our shoes even from the bed to the bathroom. I would have expected better maintenance of the flooring. Also the decor is dated - perhaps time for a remodel considering the big marketing campaign La Quinta has going right now?  All things considered- this is a value hotel. Expect to get what you pay for and you

bad shape furniture and carpet, need to fix the rooms, its very good area, and probably many business  people stay there, so we want more clean rooms, also for kids. thanks for the attention, I wish next time the rooms looks better

Convenient location, comfortable room, friendly efficient staff, and a nice variety of foods and b.everages for breakfast. The location is minutes from John Wayne Airport as well as near to shopping center with many restaurants that range from fast food to fine dining.

These are rooms that you can park in front of, like a motel. This was convenient because I'd been traveling for 2 weeks and had heavy luggage. I wasn't here long to check out all of the property features. That said, I had a spacious and comfortable room and bed. If I had traveled with friends I could have easily brought them by for drinks given the spacious layout, additional seating, and the bed being logically situated at the far end of the room. The bathroom wasn't large/fancy but more than adequate. It was an easy drive to the airport. I would stay here again.

Great location near freeway, Clean rooms with comfortable beds.  Room had a microwave and mini-fridge plus a sleeper sofa. Plenty of free parking, friendly staff.  Free breakfast was ok, not much of a variety though

Summary Heading: Rooms as clean and nice as depicted in professional pictures
Summary: Always afraid the room we get is not as nice as the ones depicted on the website. However, this one was.  We had an executive King room which was a bedroom AND sitting room with couch, chair desk, and flat-screen tv.  Room's breakfast bar had a clean sink, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker.   In fact, the entire room was spotless.   And this is a pet room!    It smelled fresh and clean.  Would not know anyone with pets was here before.  Bonus... they don't charge extra for pets.  My husband and I AND our cocker spaniel will stay here again.

I almost always travel with dogs so will always look at how easy a hotel is to stay at with dogs.   Pros:  Room size. I had a room with two double beds. There was a ton of extra room for the dogs to play as well as to set up their beds.   Amenities. A useful bar area with additional sink outside of bathroom. Nice sized fridge. Small but usable microwave. Decent flat screen tv. Air conditioning that worked. Nice privacy shades that allowed light in without being completely exposed. And good room lighting.   Outdoor spaces. Traveling with dogs it is essential to have outdoor spaces suitable for a dog to potty on. Lots of grass spots that made it easy for my finicky dog to relieve himself.   Comfortable beds. Enough said.  Convenient location. Located right off the highway and a

The Santa Ana La Quinta is ideally located near the airport and freeways, with easy access and parking.  The inner courtyard rooms are best, pretty quiet facing the courtyard pool.  For dinner, just walk next door to the Embassy Suites and you have everything you need.

Summary Heading: Good value for the money and location.
Summary: good clean room, good breakfeast,free news paper,computers available in lobby,  ease of parking,etc.  security was good, good  tv,fridge microwave etc.  Nice pool area and public grounds etc.  have stayed here before and will again.  service was good and people friendly.

Will not be staying at this location ever again. My bathroom was gross. The first couple of layers of the wall behind the door were sticking out. The bathtub was old and had a lot of damage.  I have stayed in many La Quintas, and never have I seen such a thing.

This is a nice hotel with very large rooms, including a partition between the front room and the bedroom.  The pool is heated to about 84 degrees, which is great for swimming.  And the entire complex is very comfortable and attractive.  The employees are helpful and friendly.

Although not new, this was one of the nicest La Quinta locations we have visited. It is a courtyard design with an outdoor pool in the center and the breakfast area centralized as well. Being from Nebraska in March we loved the blooming plants and just the fresh air flowing through the hallways. The room was very large and art deco with lovely lamps and wall décor. It has a nice bar area with a second sink. As always, it was totally pet friendly and we were close to a pet area so all was perfect. Will stay again as we have friends in the area and have been looking for a home away from home.

Summary Heading: Average Hotel but good price and convenient.
Summary: The hotel is a little dated but clean.  The pool area is nice, continental breakfast is nice.  The front desk staff was very nice & accommodating.  The bed was comfortable.  If you're looking for luxury this is not it, however if you are looking for convenient, clean and affordable this is a good choice.

Issue with my reservation. Nicole the GM a great understanding person helped me and worked with me as well as all the front desk staff.. Im from AZ so for me the hotel is not worth the rate need fixing to do, paint the outside walls etc. Breakfast area a bit too small. But over all a good place to rest.

Summary Heading: A little on the dark side.
Summary: Stayed there with my 2 adult daughters to go to Disneyland.   Ww stayed on the ground floor.  Room was clean, and quiet.  Nice friendly staff, breakfast was descent.  Our only problem was room was on the dark side including the bathroom.   We put our makeup on in our under garments, so opening the curtains was not an option. We had to resort to removing the lamp shades to be able to see to put our makeup on.

Summary Heading: Tim at front desk did his best
Summary: Helpful staff makes a huge difference, and Tim did his best to get me a room w King that had a working AC. Arriving late, as I drove in that night, I expected my prepaid reservation without a glitch. He warned me the AC made a serious noise and I might have to turn it off. I don't use AC but need a heater at night and fan for white noise and ventilation. He struggled with his search but found me the room. Never mind that it had a bad smell, but I soon identified it as mostly fresh paint on the walls, or that the closet had to door and the top was missing. It's not fancy but it's safe and for the location economical. Breakfast is abundant and wholesome with oatmeal, waffles HC eggs, bananas, apples, juices, walnuts and raisins and plenty of yogurt.
