The attendant is incredibly

This is one of the best experiences we've had at the La Quinta. This is not a five-star hotel, but it was very nice. We enjoyed the outdoor breakfast in the courtyard by the pool. We liked the glass elevators in the interior courtyard. Our room was clean, large, and had a sink, refrigerator, coffee machine, etc. We like the fact that it was so conveniently located near John Wayne Airport but wish to warn future travelers that another La Quinta Inn with a similar name is located close by.

No available plugs near the bed.  Had to plug my phone in across the room on the desk. Could not open the bathroom door completely because the door hit the shower curtain rod. Requested a quiet room at booking away from elevators and ice/vending machines--the elevator and ice/vending machines part was taken into account, and it was an interior courtyard location, so better than facing the parking lot, I guess, but my door and window faced the breakfast area where people start to gather pretty early in the morning, so not so quiet when breakfast starts getting served. Only one (slow) toaster in the breakfast room, so there was always waiting to use it, so everyone is just kind of standing around waiting to use the toaster and kind of in the way of accessing the rest of the

I loved having our pets stay with us and there was enough room for them to play as well as room for me and my boyfriend to spread out. I love their ocean sounds on the TV that lull me to sleep! It was quiet enough for me to sleep during the day too. I asked for first floor so it was great to have easy access with pets. I love their mini waffles for breakfast too!

Really liked the clean rooms which appeared to be almost new. The upkeep is well done. The glass elevators in the courtyard were fun and so was the poolside breakfast area. We were treated well by the staff and enjoyed a small kitchen in our room.

Summary Heading: Always stay at this dog friendly hotel
Summary: We travel with our big dog & This La Quinta has always been the best for our needs.  The location is perfect. The rooms are clean ( except for the carpeting that's due for replacement) Airport is close by, but we never noticed the sound being any kind of problem.  Breakfast is fine & the staff has always been the best. My only complaint is the LOW toilets.  I feel like i'm in a kindergarten classroom every time I sit down.  Aside from that, The price is always right and I would highly this hotel.

Place was filthy.Need,I say more.The breakfast is not what it's cranked up to be.Front desk personal seem rushed and overwhelmed.They also rent rooms out  to people on long term basis in which creates a unhealthy loitering experience outside rooms.Hotel is in good location and has many resteraunt in the area.And outside property is well kept.

Room is large but smelt very musty.  The TV is not near the bed and is in the living room. Not bad for the price but not sure I would stay here again. This hotel is Very outdated. Good location to where I needed to go but there are a lot of other hotels in this area to choose from

Summary Heading: I'm not seeing what they are seeing
Summary: Ok, so maybe I haven't stayed at enough hotels in S. Cal to truly appreciate the"value" here. But I thought that since this place got pretty good reviews I would try it out. I don't stay at 5 star hotels, so I'm not comparing to high end hotels, but this place definitely has its issues. But as I always do, let's start with the positives.  The entrance is very nice. I liked the overall look of the place when I walked in and the gals at the front desk were very friendly. The look of the rooms are nice too. Modern, looks like they may have had some updates to furniture/accessories. "Kitchen" area is nice. I always like having a fridge and microwave in the room. Good sized rooms, complete with couch, some chairs, comfy separate area to sit a few people and watch tv and a desk area.

I ike La Quinta overall, have stayed at La Quinta many a night.  This particular one needs an update.  Especially the carpet and the mattresses.  The location is great, easy to get to and near airport and shopping.

The la quinta in santa ana has superior service and such a friendly atmosphere that a wonderful time is automatic.the property is always immaculate and rooms are first class. We have stayed at this facility more than ten times and each time we stay there we seem to enjoy ourselves more than the time before. we always look forward to our next visit.

Good clean hotel and friendly staff and well located by John Wayne airport-Every thing you need within 5 miles-Good breakfast too-We will stay here again when we return next year during winter time as we really enjoyed our stay for one week.

Summary Heading: For a "suites" lower end of scale
Summary: Booked this hotel because of the "suites" in its name.  Generally these are wonderful La Quinta premises in which to stay.  However not this one.  It needs an updating. As an ordinary "inn" I would say it is good.  But calling it a "suite" overstates its value.  First room provided had an A/C unit which was not working. We asked for a move and they graciously moved us a few rooms down the hall.  Much better room, even to the point of being in a better state of repair.  Outside area has plenty of parking and many areas to walk your dog.  Plenty of bags for the dog's use. Breakfast was fine.  Really liked a member of the staff making the waffles rather than seeing people make a mess of the area.  Also appreciated a small 'gratuity' plate there where I could say "thank you" for her

A nice value.  The room was large and clean.  It was located close to freeways and in a safe neighborhood.   The breakfast was not very good.  The decaf coffee was the worst.  But overall I would stay here again.

Cheap Price, spacious room, AC didn't work properly.  Locked myself out of my room and the maid next door said I would have to show my ID at the front desk.  My ID was also locked in the room.  Had to take my luggage back to my car and walk to the front desk to get another key.  It would have been nice if the maid could have unlocked my door, called the front desk and verified my ID ... Very plain breakfast.  No eggs, or meat.

Average Hotel for $50. Don't pay for more than that. The rooms and lobby area is not good. Bath rooms are not good. However the bed is comfortable. You can sleep well. Location is also very good. Close to Disney parks.

Summary Heading: Not all LQ Inns are the same
Summary: About a year ago we had a fantastic stay at the Flagstaff, AZ La Quinta Inn. This one pales in comparison. All the doors are exterior doors. The only two elevators are 20 feet apart in the courtyard. The non-smoking room we were assigned had cigarette burns in the sofa and there were spiders in the tub. The AC unit didn't work that great either. All in all, it wasn't a great experience. The room was big enough, and did have free parking, free wi-fi, a mini-fridge, microwave, and small coffee maker. We just wouldn't stay here again. There are too many other, nicer options in the area.

Stayed at this hotel while awaiting my daughter's arrival and was not disappointed.  The exterior of the hotel is the usual yellow adobe looking facade, but inside it is modern, inviting, and comfortable.  I stayed in a King room and it had a wall partition to separate the bedroom area from a couch and table.  It was very comfortable.  I unexpectedly had to stay an extra night due to a flight delay, but they accommodated the situation flawlessly.

Decent value hotel near John Wayne/SNA airport. The good - spacious rooms with microwave and refrigerator, convenient and safe location, nice pool and hot tub, great customer service, free and plentiful parking, flat screen TVs with cable, decent breakfast.   The not so good - dated decor, some parts of room not the cleanest including rust near tub and sink, poor lighting, painfully slow wifi, loud doors when they close, loud a/c unit.

Nice, big room with filthy carpeting (pet stains), great bathroom, and reasonably comfortable bed.  Had a noise problem with the neighbors checking in after 1AM and security wasn't much help, but they quieted down in an hour and a half.  We had our small dog, and as long as we wore our slippers, we were ok.  We'll be back.

I stayed here when I was visiting for a wedding and it was clean and simple. I thoroughly enjoy the free breakfast (nothing fancy but it gets the day started). It is in a great location and the shuttle service will take you to the airport and a few other places locally. So if you are looking for simple this is the place to stay for a few nights.

Summary Heading: First Date Night of the Year 2015
Summary: The staff was helpful and friendly, especially the attendant that checked us in. Very friendly and very helpful. The Hotel is in a Hotel District but driving a couple of either way you can find restaurants, stores and gas stations. Best of all I liked being on the third floor because you can almost see the whole city. This might be out Date Night location for Valentines Day too...who knows!

The good -- rooms were large, adequately furnished, and clean.  Plenty of potty area for dogs. The bad -- exterior premises were unkept (cigarette butts and used coffee cups all over the stairs together with overflowing trash cans) -- I asked the front desk to take care of this, which they did, but it was the same the next day. The ugly -- small (I mean tiny) bathroom with mold  on the walls under the sink and chipped enamel in the bathtub.  Also, near the airport with some plane noise.  Probably not great for a sensitive sleeper.  Not my favorite LQ.

Summary Heading: Very dirty, and you probably do not want to see pictures i took
Summary: Southwest Airlines, shame on them, (I'll let them know), put us up here when flight had issues.  Very dirty, and you probably would not want to see pictures I took. Filthy dirty moldy bathroom and hair in bed.  I didn't pay so guessing must be a cheap $49 per night hotel.  This is Orange County.  Many vacation folks. Could you imagine.  I wod have left but swa had us sent here at midnight and had early flight next day so I stayed here.  Words I hope I never repeat.

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay at La Quinta Inns
Summary: Excellent,  good accommodations as we had our cocker spaniel with us.  Early check-in and late check out as we had to attend son's graduation.    Wonderful breakfast. Wide variety of choices, nice to be able to cook own waffles, and bagels.    Hotel staff were very accommodating.  We will definitely be back for future visits back to Orange County from up north.     Great job.

We've stayed here several times in the last year or so and are always pleased with the place! Its clean, quiet, beds are comfortable. Microwave and fridge in the room helps cut down on costs. They've always been so helpful no matter what our issue. This visit isn't for fun like the other 2 but to spend time with my husbands father at the end of his life. Knowing we don't have to stress about where we are staying is great. We are definitely fans of LA Quinta for life!

I have stayed at the LaQuinta several times, I like that you get a mini fridge and microwave in your room, and they are good about late check out of you are a lq member.  Only complaint is parking after going out and coming back after club hours it's almost impossible to find parking, I've had to change getting car towed passing in neighboring hotel parking lots.

LaQuinta is always our preference when we travel.  We chose this location for our post-cruise stay mainly because of it's convenient location to the John Wayne-Orange County Airport.  And as always, LaQuinta did not disappoint us. The front desk clerks were very friendly and made us feel welcome -- I especially appreciated the young man taking time to help me with the computer when I was printing our plane boarding passes.  The room was spacious, the bed very comfortable, and no noise made for a good night's sleep.  There were a few stains on the carpet, but the room and bathroom were very clean.  A free shuttle to the airport is provided.  Would we stay at this location again? -- definitely yes!

Hotel is located in a safe location very convenient to the 55 freeway, convenient to Irvine and Santa Ana.  Hotel is priced well for the area.  Most things appeared to be in decent order; the courtyard pool and spa looked nice, although we did not use them.  Breakfast included waffles and boiled eggs, and you could eat in the courtyard, which was nice. All the rooms have exterior entrances, which does not bother me...but some people don't like it.  Parking was easy.  Our room was very spacious and very quiet, but smelled heavily of cigarette smoke, and we were far too tired to go through the hassle of changing.  Would stay again, but would ask to switch rooms if the smell was anything like the night we stayed.

This is a property that is in need of some upgrading.  The rooms are a bit worn and the bath has a lot of chips in the tile and tub. Breakfast is OK.  Very limited but the staff does make the waffles for you so they are perfect. The Front Desk Staff and Management are great.  Very friendly and accommodating.  Good location (right off the 55).  I would definitely stay there again when I'm in Orange County for business.

I stay at this location because of its convenient location under 3 miles of my primary place of work. It is very much in keeping with the neighboring hotels in the same circle except for Embassy Suites which is a higher end hotel and consequently pricier. Among the group of hotels in the vicinity it's a good value, staff friendlier, easier to access and larger safer parking lot. Rooms are clean and comfortable and staff accommodates all requests readily.

Disclosure: I'm able to stay at a corporate rate.   That being said, this location is awesome! I think it took longer from gate to car rental than from JWA to La Quinta! 4 minutes after leaving the airport!  The building a rooms are a bit dated, but it's clean welcoming and well lit. I felt safe here and there are many hotels around hotel terrace.   Excellent place to stay for the value for a family vacation, KNOTTS was about 20 minutes away.   Your basic breakfast is included, hard boiled eggs assortment of cold/hot items coffee/juice.   LQ continues to be my go to place to stay wherever I go for business or pleasure!

This was a great place to stay for the price and location. The front desk staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. the room and bathroom were verycleaned. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel shuttle from the airport was prompt and the driver was very friendly.

When we checked into our room we were pleased with everything...until we were awakened in the middle of the night by a persistent banging on our door.  Rather than answer the door, we phoned the front desk, who promptly came to investigate & remove the individual.  A scary night but compensation was made, thank you.  We believe this could have been avoided as the security to the premises is quite open & a few locked gates could keep out those who do not belong there.

old and out dated accommodations.  room smelled of mold. and was hot.  air conditioner smelled when running.  room fixtures were dusty, couch had burn marks on it.  I had planned to stay 3 night left after the 1st for another hotel.

We stayed here one night while in California for a wedding - mostly just to be closer to LAX for the flight out the next day. Hotel was clean, hot tub was a great stress reliever, staff was very friendly, room was nicer than one we paid double for that was blocked for the wedding! Free breakfast was great to grab and go to the airport. Would definitely stay here again!

Accommodations were very good and bed was comfortable. Enjoyed the family atmosphere and enforcement of illegal activity. Free parking a plus along with free internet... no problem getting connected. Easy access to freeway.

Not good water pressure. Noisy tenants that the staff does not know how to handle. Buy water or anything else you need ahead of time, nothing there... Very comfortable beds though and good price. Breakfast is OK but needs more choices.

This is one of the best La Quinta Inns we have stayed at.  The exterior was beautiful and very well layed out.  The room was showing its age but very clean and neat.  The morning breakfast was not a lot but it was good, hot and free.  Since all La Quinta Inns allow pets we had out 125lb Lab with us and he liked the place too.

The rooms are dingy and the furniture is worn out.  The breakfast is horrid.  Wi-Fi is very hit and miss.  The outside is deceiving.  There are hotels all around that are far superior and for a better price.  This is the worst La Quinta that I have ever experienced and I have stayed at many.

The grounds of the property were not clean including the breakfast area. It was also very limited on food selection . Not in walking distance to anything. Shuttle to and from airport was convenient .  Additionally all rooms have exterior access which I am not a fan of.

Mold and mildew on the bathroom tub faucet, on the wall, and on the tile are simply not acceptable or safe! Coffee in the breakfast room is not real coffee....instant coffee coming from a dispenser! I had to throw mine away. Motel 6 coffee is better. Aside from these two problems, the hotel is good, but avoiding mildew in a bathroom and having bad coffee are horrible ways to start a morning, and so my get away was icky, instead of pleasurable.

I expected this place to be ok because the previous la quinta rooms I've been to were not that great.  However, the room was clean, the breakfast was great and I felt relaxed here.  I really like the set up. I felt safer here, even when going out to get ice at night.  It really felt like I was on vacation even though I was just staying for one night.

I'm always particular about my hotel stays!! However, I always like and try to stay at La Quinta's Chain Hotel because I know the value I get for my money is always there. This is a good hotel, although close to Freeway, traffic noise was almost none,  will stay here again!!

hotel staff were kind and friendly.  location of hotel was close to hiways and services.  hotel was in much need of replacing old furnature and worn carpets.  Interior and bathrooms 20 years old.   very pool selection of breakfast foods.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with a Great Location
Summary: This hotel was perfect.  Check in was fast and easy.  We were given chocolate chip cookies and bottled water at check in because we are Elite members.  Our room was on the second floor close enough to both the elevator and the stairs.  The room was nice and big and had both a microwave and a fridge that we made good use of.  There was plenty of close parking and the pool looked amazing.  Unfortunately, we did not get a chance to use it nor did we get to have breakfast.  We had to be out in the morning before breakfast started.  This hotel was so convenient to freeways, gas stations, and places to eat.  I will be staying here again on our next trip.  Thank you La Quinta for a great night.  I wish we could have stayed longer.

If you have a lot of luggage etc. they have 2 carts for use (which they never can find) at this large hotel. We were not able to get to our room for over an hour because of needing help with ice chest and luggage. Never did find carts. Front desk found an employee to help carry our things thank goodness

Nice big room with a mini fridge and microwave which are very convenient for longer stay because you can buy grocery and keep them fresh. Pool is nice, and right in the middle of the courtyard. A little noisy if your room facing the pool. Complementary breakfast is OK.The location is fine, just a few miles from the supermarket, shopping centers and movie theater.

The La Quintal, Santa Ana has been updated and has nice, spacious rooms with amenities.  The breakfast was good and well served as well.  A very good place to stay if touring Orange County or staying at the John Wayne Airport.

Room smelled, t.v. was too small for a suite, it was a distance from the bed.  I love La Quinta, but was not impressed with that location. We are Elite members and were not offered water or snacks which we are supposed to be offered.

About the best La Quinta in Orange County  Clean / comfortable room  Good breakfast  But for some reason La Quinta's in general have dim lighting in their rooms and bathrooms  Also stay on the north section of the property for best Wi-Fi reception

We stayed at room 322 for2 nights on 8/21-8/22, first night was OK but 2nd night I realized there are bedbugs! Got 5 bites on my neck, there is no doubt they do have bedbugs problem, I'm not sure if management realize it or not.  This is not funny. I had to throw away all my clothes that I bring with me.   Avoid this hotel despite the price/discount, the staff are friendly though, but bedbugs are NOT acceptable.

Stayed at this hotel for one night for business.  Most of the people staying at this hotel look like they are on vacation.  Not too far from Disneyland.  The hotel room was roomy, quiet and clean.  Even though I was by myself, the room I had could accommodate up to four people. Unlike other suites, this one had a half wall to divide the suite almost into two rooms.    Included was a bar area, refrigerator, and microwave.  They also included a coffee maker, steam iron, ironing board and hair dryer in the suite.    The included breakfast was probably the one area that this hotel needs to improve upon.  It is a very basic breakfast with waffles, fruit and yogurt.  No bacon or ham, but they did have hard-boiled eggs for protein.    The breakfast eating area is a nicely enclosed

Stayed at this hotel for four nights. The room is pretty decent size and room location for business traveler is very convenient on the bottom floor. The bathroom was very clean but had some issues with leaving enough shampoo and soap everyday. Do not expect much variety in the breakfast area. The first day they ran out of milk in the dispenser and there was nobody readily available to replace the pack. The other negative item was arriving at about 11 pm had to wait for about 10 minutes  in the lobby before the attendant came. There was a sign indicating to wait a few minutes because  the attendant was tied up running something to a room, etc. The attendant was very professional  and apologetic.

Hotel was comfortable enough but very shabby.  The carpet was very worn with an open seam right in front of the door. The upholstered fold out sofa was threadbare. Needless to say there was a somewhat unpleasant odor to the room due to it's level of wear and tear.  The outside of the building was dirty, the sign wasn't lighted, and the fountain in front was chipped and empty.  The staff were nice and the king bed was very comfortable.

Summary Heading: It's our safe "go to" hotel when we're on a budget in SoCal
Summary: I'm sure that it's possible to have a bad experience at any hotel no matter how expensive or how many good reviews it has. What I can say about this hotel is that we've been multiple times and have had good experience's almost every time. I've stayed in brand new, really nice La Quinta's and old nasty ones. This one is older but they seem to keep everything pretty clean and the rooms are pretty modern looking. The service has always been very good and they were quick to help with what few issues we sometimes have had. Pricing always seems to be pretty fair depending on when you go. Personally I never had an issue with smoke smell as others are reporting. I would recommend changing rooms if this happens to you.  Tip: The breakfast area is pretty small and gets crazy especially on

Summary Heading: filthy urine smelling carpets.staff not respectful of privacy.
Summary: the hotel is poorly staffed.not maintained.no designated pet rooms.all of the carpets are filthy and smell of animal urine.real ripoff for the price.and the maids just barged in without knocking while I was on the toilet and then got nervous and left the door open.thats just the half of it.hotel is  not worth the money.

I stayed at La Quinta Inn for more than a week (partially vacations and partially work) and it is one of the best value for money in Orange County. The location is great (right off the freeway and easy for trips north or to the beach), the hotel very good (my room was big and had great wifi which I needed for work, and the pool/jacuzzi very enjoyable). The free breakfast was very enjoyable and had plenty of choices. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: If you do not smoke, forget it.
Summary: I reserved a non-smoking room and late arrival.  Arrived past 10 on a Sat. night and was told all that was left was a smoking but could move the next day.  On a crowded Sat. night, what option did I have.  I did not sleep, woke with a headache.  I was supposed to be there 4 nights, checked out that morning.  The reservation page says requests are not guaranteed.  They should not accept the reservation if they cannot provide it or say something ahead of time.  I will not stay at a LaQuinta again or use reservation counter again.

I have been staying at the Hampton Inn and Suites across the street for 5 years and this trip they were booked full. I thought I would give them a try especially considering that the price was the same. To be kind is was tacky. A mere step above a dive. Stained carpet and furniture, missing grout in the bathroom, thin walls and noisy. I have stayed in some excellent La Quintas' but unfortunately this isn't one of them. Try the Hampton across the street or the Embassy Suites next door or the Holiday Inn around the corner.

I have stayed at this hotel 5 -6 times for business times and the hotel and staff are great.  The hotel is next to the freeway on/off ramps and there are many gas stations and fast food stores available.

Spent a nice weekend in this La Quinta.  The staff was great. Very helpful and friendly, a great check in welcome, and the entire stay they made us feel like valued guests.  The hotel is nice, enjoyed the pool.  The breakfast was nice. The wifi was solid and steady, a real plus. Just enough outlets for electronics also.  Overall a pleasant experience.  Keep up the good work.

Old Hotel, Old furniture and carpets.  Would try other hotels next time, but bet I can't find anything in this price range.  So I would stay again but wipe down surfaces and not sit on anything but bed.  This hotel did help me when I checked into the Costa Mesa La Quinta first and its was way worse so they took me in on a Friday night at 7pm.

perfect for what we needed - quiet room and clean. Since this was the first time I was leery but it proved to be excellent for the price.  If had space for my small dog to visit and parking was right next to the room.

Summary Heading: Nice room, good breakfast, great stay!
Summary: I was very impressed with my stay at this hotel! We had a king bed suite, and it was quite large and spacious. There was a mini fridge and microwave in the room. The bathroom was smaller and not as nice as the rest of the room, which is the only reason this hotel got 4 stars instead of 5.   The rooms open to a courtyard which is quite nice, although there is a fair amount of low flying aircraft that pass over this area.  The breakfast was great. It was your standard bagel/oatmeal/waffles breakfast you spate from La Quinta, but they has a staff member dedicated to running the waffle irons for you. This reduced traffic, confusion, and burned waffles you often see when guests run the waffle iron themselves. It was a nice touch!  On top of everything else, the prices were

I stayed here one night for a business trip and will be returning next week.  Room was clean and well appointed.  Comfortable chair, desk and outlets for working.  VERY comfortable bed with an assortment of pillows.  Mini-fridge and wet-bar (which I didn't have a chance to use.)  My room was facing out from the front of the hotel, but noise was not a problem.  I had to make several copies for a presentation I was doing the next morning.  After using the printer in the lobby I asked the desk staff if I could make some copies (5 copies of a 3 page report.)  He gladly offered to make them for me in the back office.  I offered to pay but he did them for free - thereby saving me a trip to find a nearby copy place.  Breakfast outside by the pool was nice.  Very friendly staff helped

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service and newly renovated rooms!
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay here and it was my first time to stay at La Quinta and it was a great experience.  Stayed here for the 4th of July, only one night. We needed more blankets and towel and we got them in less than 30 minutes. We needed some forks and spoons because the Famous Dave's we went to didn't give us any with our to go order and La Quinta gave us spoons, forks, knives, and plates!   Also, the free breakfast here was over the top! they had fresh waffles! oat meal, cereals, bread, yogurt, fruits, milk, juice, bagels, toasters for the bread, jelly for your toast, and so much more.   Another plus was they don't have pet fee for the dogs and no pet deposit either.   Definitely my place to stay when I have my dog with me during travels.

Spent four nights here on business. The people in the room next door spoke loudly through the night, escalating to yelling in the dawn hours for two of the nights, which caused considerable challenges to my sleep. My work colleague, several doors down, had a similar experience with a different neighbor. I don't think the walls are particularly thin, so much as the fact that the affordable rates of the hotel might tend to attract some guests who do not necessarily adhere to more civil rules of society. On the other hand, the staff was friendly and helpful on several occasions and, as mentioned, the room was very clean and well maintained by the housekeeping staff.

Very comfortable room and beds.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely try and stay at La Quinta in future travels.  Great no fee pet policy is a plus!  Conveniently located and close to many attractions.

Summary Heading: Large rooms and a great breakfast. Not top of the line, but a decent value.
Summary: We were traveling with our two small kids and ended up in a room with a single king-size bed. However, it turned out great because it had a separate sitting area sort of sectioned off by the closet from where the king bed sleeping area is. The couch in that area had a pull out bed for our kids to sleep on. There was a nice kitchenette with a microwave, sink, and mini fridge that we found very convenient. The rooms were pretty clean, but the hotel could stand to make a few renovations. Our bathroom had some cracked floor tiles and several chips in the tub, plus the carpet had a few stains. Breakfast is great, however most of the seating is outside which may be a little cool in winter months. The location is great--easy freeway access and there is a gas station and Jack-in-the-Box

We stayed here in February '14. The room wasn't yet clean at check-in time so we stood on the balcony with our luggage while housekeeping sped-cleaned it. They hauled out bags and bags of glass bottles, beer cans, syringes, and other party paraphernalia. Once we got inside we noticed a very musty odor. Later that evening (of course after we were all unpacked), we noticed that the carpet around the sink in the living space was soaking wet. My husband opened the under-sink cupboard and turned on the faucet and got sprayed in the face. We called the front desk and they moved us rooms no problem.  Our new room had a clogged toilet and we waited a while for maintenance to finish fixing the first problem before they were able to come over and unclog it. When I climbed into bed late

Summary Heading: It's not bad and it's not good
Summary: We didn't have any problems.  The interior and exterior have been renovated but not recently. There weren't enough places for 2 people to sit down and eat.   There was only a couch with one arm and the cushion was vinyl,b but it was not supposed to be vinyl.  The room was clean. It stayed fairly quiet. The bed was comfortable. It's close to major attractions.  We drove up from San Diego to go to a baseball game and left the next morning to shower at home.   Not what I expect for the money, and it could have been a little better.

Summary Heading: Very low budget; needs serious maintenance
Summary: I travel a lot and am loyal to a few reward programs.  LQ is one of those I stay in often since I usually get good bank for the buck.  This place however was very disappointing - up keep very poor both inside and out; walls are thin so the conversation my upstairs neighbors were having at midnight woke me out of my sleep; the room looked clean but it did not "feel" clean so I ended up keeping my socks on and limited my use of furniture.  Could be a great place if the mgmt. chooses to spend some time and money.

The employees are super nice as all LA Quinta's I have stayed at. The only problem with this hotel is the smell in the room. This is the second time I stay at this location and the room smelled like cigarettes. I think this is a older la Quinta given the furniture. I payed for a suite and it was not like the other suites I have stayed at with La Quinta. Not worth the extra money I payed. There was also a dog barking next door to me. I think they should have a designated area for guest with dogs since I was trying to sleep and the dog was barking non stop. I told the front desk but they said

One of the nicest places we have stayed. We will stay again when we are visiting our children California again. You are close to just about everything in this location  and it is easy to get to from the highway

We stay almost exclusively at La Quinta Hotels. They are pet friendly. Clean. Located in good areas. And you can't match their Rewards programs . Will continue to stay in this Hotel during our travels.

Planned on staying a week but left after 3 nights. We a king suite. I liked the partial wall between the bed & couch area. I could sleep while my daughter sat in the  "living area" watching t.v. or talking on the phone. Don't expect to feel like a valued customer. The general manager couldn't seem to care less if u stay or not! It feels like a party hotel you could rent by the hour. The bed was comfortable & it's close Disneyland.

The LaQuinta was very nice.   The rooms and the bathroom were clean and nice.  The bed was very comfy and I loved how they gave you 5 pillows on a King size bed.  We got the room with the king and the pull out sofa.  I loved how there was a little divider wall that seperated the bedroom from the sofa area so that the person using the sofa sleeper had a little more privacy in the room.  I also loved how the windows had a sunscreen over the window in addition to the curtains.  This allowed more privacy and darkness for the room. The pool was decent and the hotel provided towels which was nice.  The breakfast bar was good.  Wish they provided meat, but overall the provided big waffles, fruit, cereal, bagels, toast and oatmeal.  All the staff were friendly and check in and check out

The hotel is located conveniently to the expressway 55 with easy access to interstates and the beaches. I was there on business but the evenings we traveled around and never had issues with traffic. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Service is good, staff accommodating and friendly. Fast check in and check out. Breakfast was good but there was no breakfast meats or potatoes (home fries). It was quiet at night even that my room was next too the pool on the ground floor (which I prefer). I would stay again... actually I will be staying again in several weeks.

This hotel is great location to Orange County area attractions. We came to town for OC half marathon, this was perfect hotel with great price tag. It had clean oversized rooms. Nice bed, king. Couch sitting area. Fridge. Close to John Wayne airport, shopping and restaurants. Staff was polite. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, one of the best La Quinta Inn's
Summary: Great customer service and the GM Nicole is wonderful.  I have stayed here several nights, and we feel at home.  The outside breakfast area is very nice and cool in the mornings.  the pool and Jacuzzi are very clean.  The staff is always there to met your needs right away.  Some things in the rooms are beginning to show some wear, but I am sure this hotel gets a lot of visitors.  I would stay here before staying at the John Wayne La Quinta.  It is a little more costly , but much nicer.  However all staff has always been great at all La Quinta Inn. Great on-line reservations that are easy.  Great that they allow you to bring your four legged family members with you when you travel....  Thank you.

My wife and I were visiting Orange County to celebrate her birthday for a week. I selected a 3-star hotel on Hotwire near Orange Couny airport, which turned out to be La Quinta. I e-mailed the hotel general manager, Nicole, a few days before our visit and requested a non-smoking room with a queen/king bed in a quiet area. I also mentioned that we were going to celebrate the birthday and that I planned to write a review for Tripadvisor. She responded quickly, made sure she understood my requests correctly, and asked my wife's name. We ended up with a fantastic upgraded room with a birthday card for my wife and lots of cookie/snack goodies. Keep in mind that this is a hotel without a restaurant, so these goodies had to be purchased. This was a very pleasant surprise for my wife.

Laquinta, Always clean, Comfortable, sufficient choices for breakfast. Locations are good, staff is friendly regardless of state and location. Love the beds . Wish there were more of them in other cities I travel to! Highly Recommend , Can't go wrong with this choice for value and consistency!

The rooms are clean, comfortable, and priced well. Location offers great access to the freeways, close to shoping and restaurants. Staff is helpful, and on top of their game. I have stayed at this hotel on three different occasions in the past year, twice for at last 5 days in a row. It's my go-to for Orange County lodging.

Very happy with quality of rooms and service. Always greeted by a friendly employee who usually remembers and greats me by name. Room is always in perfect condition and quite. Ample parking and close to all other areas of my needs.

a group of us stayed in our hotel for the Pet Expo and I would recommend for everyone! Family-pet friendly close to everything! Breakfast was sufficient - rooms are great - pool good close to local attractions, shopping great restaurants even the freeway! SEe you next year

I very much enjoy staying at LaQuinta.  And I have a small pet.  Staff is excellent. - However, in one room, the LaQuinta (Santa Ana) had dirty/cloudy water running from the sink and bath tub. It was terrible.  I changed rooms mid-stay and things were fine. - other than that, my stays have been great. - I was just at LaQuinta (Santa Ana) last week.... and I will be checking into LaQuinta (Santa Ana) again tomorrow (May 2nd).

Right next door to the Embassy suites, sits the LaQuinta SNA.   Unassuming and quaint...a hidden gem in my opinion.  The outdoor bfast area, the atrium pool views and the awesome So-Cal weather made our stay supurb!

All of the staff here are excellent. This is a good value and rooms have extra space. The beds are comfortable, and breakfast is just what was needed to start the day. I would recommend this hotel to families.

The room was excellent! The beds were extremely comfortable. The room was worth the money spent and was affordable. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly! I would deffently stay at LaQuienta Inn in Santa Ana, CA again!

La Quinta is always a great place to stay. Friendly and professional and a great value for the money. La Quinta Rewards are a great program that allow us to earn points and redeem them quickly. Always a positive experience!

i usually stay at this when i need 2 get away from my husband and i like this is hotel,this is one of the only hotels close 2 our place that has smoking rooms but i do feel like even with a smoking or pet room the carpet should be kept up maintained my only issue.....over all close food gas etc comfortable getaway....

Very nice hotel, beds are comfortable with upgraded linens, room was clean, nice pool and spa, good breakfast, room was quiet and comfortable. We try to stay at La Quintas when we can so we can bring our little dog with us, and we consistently find them to be of good quality. This hotel is no different.

We stayed here for 1 night prior to our Disneyland vacation. The pricing for this hotel was cheaper than most I could find directly in the Anaheim area. For being in Santa Ana, we found it to be a quick trip into Anaheim and the short distance was definitely worth it for the price. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was bigger than expected for 2 double beds, which was nice since we had the kids in tow. We were the only ones in the pool/spa area on Saturday night. The breakfast was pretty basic but the thing we most enjoyed about it were the fresh hard-boiled eggs that were still warm. The lady who was working the breakfast bar on Sunday morning was very kind and efficient at her job. We would consider this property again in the future.

is a great deal for the money,rooms have a microven and a fridge,fast internet.in the last 12 months I have stayed there at least 25 times and only once found hair on the bed,compare to M6 that every time stayed there the sheets were rarely change.

I had a great staying at La Quinta, best of all my sleeping time was great, bed and pillows were just fantastic.  I will highly recommend this hotel for business and pleasure to all of you out there.  PD

Summary Heading: A good choice for the price.
Summary: A good option to stay close to Anaheim (Disney parks) - it's a short drive - with low prices. The neighborhood was nice, clean rooms. Everything worked very well. Helpful people at the front desk. Breakfast was ok.

I was extremely impressed by this hotel.  The lobby was clean and the front desk staff helpful upon check-in.  My room was a King with a sofa sleeper.  It was huge.  The closet provided a bit of a division between the bed and sofa and there was a refrigerator, microwave and a wet bar.   The room was updated and the bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom had older fixtures and tile but it was clean and in good repair.    The breakfast room is a separate room in the courtyard with outside seating.  The weather was perfect so this was a lovely option.  Free WiFi and free parking.  I felt safe and loved the convenience of the location to UCI, shopping and restaurants.  I booked online early and received an amazing rate.  I stay in this area often and other hotels are almost double

The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in at a hotel. The facility was quiet in the evenings which ensured a great night sleep wiht the added comfort of the beds. Breakfast was a nice surprise, your standard continental but everything was fresh, even the hardboiled eggs! Parking was a bit of a challenge one night during the week, made me wonder what the weekends held. Close access to freeway and food.

My boyfriend and I loved this hotel. The rooms were huge , very clean, the beds were comfortable. The staff was very kind and got us checked in quickly. We loved everything about this hotel. We will definitely be back soon.

Check-in was good  Clean property  Clean room  But lighting in room and bathroom dark (or not at a comfortable lighting level)  Water pressure in sink and shower could have been better  Morning breakfast so so (for the price I expected scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage as at other La Quinta's)  Check out ok  One question is why the front of the hotel was roped off for two day just to slurry part of the front area asphalt (only takes a couple hours to dry)  Very inconvenient

I don't particularly like hotels where your room doors are to the outdoors, for safety and noise reasons but I enjoyed my stay here at the La Quinta.  The room was nice and large with a wet bar, refrigerator and microwave, which I feel should be standard in all rooms these days.  And the bed was extremely comfortable.  The property could stand to do some renovations for a more updated fresh look and the lighting in the room was dim, even in the bathroom.  I was thinking the were possibly using energy efficient light bulbs. (Make sure you check your makeup one you get outside in the natural light)  Breakfast was included which included hot oatmeal, not the do it yourself packets of sugar.  That was a plus.  But no meat, if you are looking for more.

Nice room for the price.   Facility appeared well maintained. Front Desk staff was knowledgeable about area.  We had a King room with sofa bed, only complaint is that the television has a partially blocked view from the bed.  However, it was nice that the bed and sofa bed were separated by the closet.

I can not say enough about this hotel...my experience was amazing. The rooms are very clean and very comfortable. We enjoyed the benefit of a room that was both cozy but loaded with extras like flat screen tv, cable and in room movies and free internet. Breakfast was fanatstic and healthy offerings and the staff was GREAT!!! The best thing about this  La Quinta is the management, the General Manager especially went out of her way to make this a great trip...only 10 minutes from Disneyland, 20 minutes from Knotts. Make this your destination hotel  Best- Jose Contreras San Jose, California

We stayed at the la Quinta on hotel terrace in Santa Ana.  We love coming to la quinta. I stay there where ever I go. I know it will be clean and comfortable. The service is the best. Great service with a smile:) Brian Miler

Will stay here again. 8 miles from Newport Beach.  Nice breakfast. Exercise room could be updated-no weights. La Quinta Inns always seem to have comfortable beds. Room had a small refrigerator, which is a plus.

The quality of service, cleanliness and appearance of the room were all great. I feel it was an excellent value. This was especially evident after staying in a similar priced hotel the evening before in a different location that was quite the opposite. Coming to La Quinta was extremely relieving and refreshing by contrast! I wish there was a La Quinta closer to where we were staying then.

Summary Heading: Great Location at a great price.
Summary: Rooms are clean and maintained, staff is polite, what more can you ask for.  Ok, this is asking for 200 Characters.  I am not sure what else to say.  So I will just keep typing or start cutting and pasting.  Rooms are clean and maintained, staff is polite, what more can you ask for.  Ok, this is asking for 200 Characters.  I am not sure what else to say.  So I will just keep typing or start cutting and pasting.  Rooms are clean and maintained, staff is polite, what more can you ask for.  Ok, this is asking for 200 Characters.  I am not sure what else to say.  So I will just keep typing or start cutting and pasting.  Rooms are clean and maintained, staff is polite, what more can you ask for.  Ok, this is asking for 200 Characters.  I am not sure what else to say.  So I will just

I stayed here twice  between october and november, 3 nights each time.before this I was a Mothel 6 costumer for cost reazons,But I was paying extra if i wanted a room with a refrigerator and microwave and internet.Here the rooms are good size,comes with a countertop,small Sink,small fridge,and micro.plenty of pillows,plenty of towels,Overall it was a good stay,Only if they can do something about the doors they loud when other guest near you close them.But definately going back there.

Summary Heading: Positive Review with some small inconveniences
Summary: While taking a shower the water temperature varied between very warm & cold. Exhaust fan in bathroom was a little noisy. Other that these small inconveniences, the rate was very reasonable for the room

This was my first La Quinta experience & it exceeded my expectations in so many ways, I found it easier just to keep adding days and stay longer and longer!  Initial plan was to be here about 10 days, to relax without stressing out that our new home had been delayed...... Location - For ease in getting around almost all areas of So Cal, the location could not be better. Service - Great service from management to housekeeping are all great, attentive,  accomodating, yet not intrusive. Sleep Quality - XLNT Sleep  - although located near freeway, airport, etc., the rooms inside seem virtually soundproof, especially if window is closed. And YES, to those who like fresh air, their windows actually slide open and shut VERY easily with multi-facted covering options to allow as much or

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!!
Summary: I had to be out of my house over a weekend for a termite tenting so I searched around and found a pretty decent price on a small suite with a refrigerator, sink, coffee maker and a microwave.  The front desk staff was very friendly and that was THE best part of this hotel.  After being sent to the wrong room, I had to walk back to the front desk with my luggage.  If there is a "next time" staying  here, I will not take my luggage to check in.  Instead I will wait until I am in my room.  When I finally was told the correct room and given the correct key to that room, the first thing I noticed was that the trash can had not been emptied from the previous guest(s).  This would not normally bother me but it was uneaten food items and it wasn't very pleasant.  I then noticed that

Summary Heading: My regular hotel for Orange County
Summary: This is the hotel that I regularly use when I am in Orange County.  The staff is friendly, the rooms are always clean.  The studio-suite layout with microwave and mini-refrigerator gives me the extra space that I need for my typical 6-7 night stay.  The close proximity to the local businesses and the airport make the location ideal.

This place is caught in a time warp - it looks like the 1970's and it's probably not been cleaned since then either. The staff were a little too quick to blame the disappearance of my Bose headphones in the hotel van as down to another guest". It's possible to get a good clean room in the area for 30% less than I paid. Never again.

We have stayed at this hotel many times before. We are always pleased with the quality of sleep we get, the friendly employees, the Excellent grounds and Appearance of the property, the spacious rooms, breakfast and indoor/outdoor eating area. It has a very nice pool and hot tub area. It is an easy on/off freeway location and close to SNA/Orange County Airport. The prices are very fair.

You get what you pay for.  This place is old, and stale.  The free breakfast wasn't that great, so we ended up going to get food else where.  The A/C units leak water all over the walk ways.  The doors to the rooms open to the outside.  The parking lot was full of potholes etc etc.  You can get better for the same money else where.

Summary Heading: No better than a budget, no name motel
Summary: This was one of the worst places I have stayed in years! I booked through one of the popular low price booking sites that assigns you a hotel. All of the other brands they listed were great...and I got this place. I will start with the staff's unwillingness to accommodate my request for twin double beds in my rooms. When I called on the phone after booking, they did not want to do it because I did not book direct with them. They suggested I ask when I arrive, which I did. After asking for the rooms, there was some some discussion between the clerk and the manager. The manager mentioned the name of the booking company and proceeded to speak in Spanish to the clerk. I was offended by that as I felt they were trying to hide something. Sorry, I don't speak Spanish...never will!

This was our first stay in a La Quinta brand hotel and it certainly won't be our last.  We chose La Quinta for their pet policy - they don't charge any pet fees.  Our stay was comfortable and extremely pleasant.  This hotel is nestled among several other nice looking hotel properties (on a street called "Hotel Terrace") and we felt very safe here.  The room was very spacious and had a micro-fridge and separate sink area, almost like a mini kitchen.  The bed was one of the best we've had in a hotel.  Room was clean but there were several worn spots on the carpet, not a big deal.  We are looking forward to coming back!

Summary Heading: Surprisingly Tolerable - but really at 2.5 not 3
Summary: I was frustrated by a blind booking engine that placed me here as I do not think that this property is a 3.0 star EVER.  That being said -- I consider a star system on the basis of Luxuries and not cleanliness -- but it seems in modern parlance - it is meant to reflect good vs. bad or clean vs. dirty.   All said - this property was surprisingly tolerable.  The bed was small but acceptable.  The open area of the room nice and a large refrigerator.   It was clearly a refinished room - I cannot speak for other rooms.  Prior reviews had my caution flags up for this property.  Persons has references poor staffing, safety concerns, limited parking, etc.     For my experience,  the Staff were extremely polite at check-in and sufficiently polite at check-out.  The 1st floor room was not

The customer service from the staff at the La Quinta Inn - Santa Ana is above and beyond anywhere else I have ever stayed. If you show up early at check in they do their best to accommodate you. Basically, If there IS a room available, they will surely put you in it. The hotel is clean and the rooms are nice and comfortable. Beds are in good shape and not all rickety. The layout of the room is nice and provides great privacy if you are sharing a room with friends or something. The pool and jacuzzi is always clean. The fact that the front desk calls you after you've checked in to make sure the room meets your expectations is so nice. Just an overall grrrreat experience. No complaints at all.

I'm delighted to be writing this review. I appreciated the intelligent design of the room and  the courteous service. The placement of the refrigerator, sink, and microwave oven is exactly what I would want for a stay away from home. The hotel is located walking distance from a good restraunt and I found the spa relaxing at the end of day. I look forward to my next stay.

Being a guest at this La Quinta Inn is a 3-D experience--it was Dirty, Depressing, and Disgusting.  This is NOT a 3-star hotel; the rooms it offers are much more suitable to a cheap motel.  Our room reeked of cigarette smoke.  The carpeting was so dirty that my husband and I waited to take off our shoes until we were at the side of the bed.  The "suite" they provide is merely a small foam sofa (with ripped upholstery and cigarette holes) and a chair--the single bed is on the other side of a small wall--not a separate room.  There are no amenities provided except a bar of soap. We paid $100.+ for this room--we should have slept in our car instead. Save yourself the trouble of staying here.  This La Quinta hotel is too dirty for families /children, and too depressing for any

Summary Heading: Sold as a 3-star...but 2-star would be a wild stretch!
Summary: One night was simply awful, but we had trusted this to be a 3-star for 6 nights and it was horrible!  The hotel -- the rooms, the grounds and walkways, the parking lot-- ALL was simply Filfthy! Filfthy! Filfthy!... and much of it was in disrepair!  The walkway around the pool hadn't been swept in 6 days!  If this weren't enough, the dogs were everywhere.  One man alone had FIVE DOGS that he walked morning, noon, and night.  And, the smoking was terrible, too... especially terrible for a non-smoking hotel! ! !  Not in the rooms, apparently, but on the walkways, sitting on the chairs, you'd always find smokers...so many, that it was impossble to open one's windows.  Stay away from this one!

The staff was very friendly and offered information on places to visit locally to eat, etc. The location was good as well..super close to the 55. The room, on the other hand, was only so- so. It looked pretty clean; but smelled bad of stale cigarette smoke. I did like that it had a working microwave and small fridge. I am on the fence as whether I would consider staying there again.

Trendy updated rooms.  Spacious and incredibly clean. Join their rewards program for speedy pre-check in and earn points quickiy.  Central location as a base of my business in OC.  Easy freeway access.  Lots of parking, free.  I prefer rooms on ground floor, often park directly in front of your room.

Summary Heading: Great room, but didn't like the grounds
Summary: The staff was very nice. My room was great. Big; comfortable bed, decent bathroom, good AC. The grounds smelled like smoke, the pool area smelled like stale smoke. There was a Q-Tip on the walkway by my room for 2 days that didn't get picked up by housekeeping. I did not even bother trying the breakfast since it was outdoors in the stale smoky area by the pool. I used the computers in the lobby but they were OLD and kept freezing up on me. The location was very good, but my daughter's softball team stayed at a much nicer place nearby for a similar price.

I was wanting to keep the price of our stay on the lower end but didn't want to stay in a dump either. This place was perfect as it was only a 15 min. drive to the beach and a 15 min. drive to Disneyland. The rooms were nice and decently clean. The pool area was great and the free breakfast every morning was good. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

The room doesn't feel clean.  Smelled like smoke and carpet looked nasty.  I'm not sure why ppl would give this motel even a decent rating.  The free breakfast made it a little bit better.  oh, i did use a really fast computer in lobby.  Don't stay here.  Sleep in your car.

Summary Heading: Great budget hotel! Includes breakfast and wifi, clean rooms
Summary: We found this hotel to be perfect for us-breakfast included fruits, ready made oatmeal, fresh waffles made to order, hard boiled eggs, cereals, ,bagels, toast, yogurts and all your breakfast juices and milk, coffee and tea. Pretty good to keep you filled till lunchtime for sure! Room was kept clean-unexpected fridge and microwave was a nice bonus. We kept bottles of water cold and was able to buy fixings to then make sandwiches for lunches.also has a small fitness room and guest washer and dryer.Pool and hot tub was good too. Overall cleanliness of hotel was okay- if you're looking for a luxury hotel then this probably isn't for you-but if you just want a decent hotel to lay your head down at night, included breakfast for just over $100 bucks a night then this is just

We talked to the hotel clerk before we got here to make sure we got a nonsmoking room. They said they can't guarantee a nonsmoking room for us, and I was very surprised. I really don't wanna spend another hotel trip inhaling second hand smoking. I couldn't sleep and hardly breathing well comfortably because another hotel didn't care to give nonsmoking room.   Lo and behold, when we got there, after we complained ahead of time before our arrival, we got a nonsmoking room on the third floor. The clerks were friendly. The room was clean and large. It was big enough for 4 people. We had a sink, coffee maker, Big Tv, a couch, and a pull out sofa bed. There was a king size bed and the usual iron/iron board, hair dryer, and alarm clock.   The pool was nice as was the hot tub. If you

Good location for Knott's Berry Farm.  Not hard to get to beach. Pool was inviting. Decent rooms. Maid staff was great! Breakfast personell was right on the money! The food was constanly full. Very heplful with kids! Counters were kept clean even with all th kids! We would definitly stay agian if in this town again.

I have stayed here several times.  Staff always welcoming and friendly. Always thought rooms were decent for the price until this weekend.  It is now apparent this is one of the lower priced hotels in the area.  I never noticed before this was a pet friendly hotel but I think very few on this weekend were without pets.  We opted to stay here hoping to get some rest and sleep in on Saturday morning.   I was awoken at 6am by a yapping dog that continued for 30 min. I was not able to go back to sleep.  After arrival on Friday night, I went to get ice from vending area.  I was surprised and intimidated to find so many guests and their guests sitting outside their rooms drinking and smoking.  I noticed several rooms with their doors ajar or open and guys coming and going.  Saturday

Summary Heading: Oh what a lovely time we had.
Summary: Take a tray to breakfast; carry coffee, donuts, orange juice, bananas, & yogurt and the daily paper.  Use the valet cart for offloading and loading, makes the trip easier; when something's not visible, always ask for it, they just might have it.  Extend your thanks to everyone at the hotel, goes far in creating  a joy of serving and being served.  Use the 15 minute front area to offload and on load your gear. Visit Santa Ana, friendliest town in Orange County.

I picked this hotel cause it was near the seminar I was attending. I had a nice/clean room on the third floor.If I needed to eat something, it was only short walk away. I only had one concern which was the lack of available clothes washer/dryers available. All in all, I was very happy with my stay and would book with LQ again. The staff was nice also. My hats off to them also.

I needed a place near the Amtrak station and the Santa Ana airport, so I booked La Quinta. I picked it because I needed one that picked up after 10:30pm from the airport. La Quinta runs until about 10:45pm, they told me. Other hotels said 10ish, and I didn't want to risk it so I booked La Quinta. However, when I was waiting for the shuttle there were plenty of other hotel shuttles sitting there waiting. I think I would have been okay with any of the major chains. The shuttle was nice and the driver was friendly.   La Quinta can be really hit or miss, and this one was somewhat in the middle.   The bad:  The room smelled like dog, the floor had gigantic wet spots (I didn't want to think about it). There was dog hair and stains all over the mattress (but under the sheets, I always

I booked my stay, June 20-23, 2013, through Priceline. At $65 a night during the summer season, I consider it a deal. La Quinta is in Santa Ana, CA, on Hotel Terrace, a  nice street lined with 3-4 stars hotels. The hotel is not new but it's not slummy. Included in the price is breakfast, not cooked to order but filling and enjoyable. It's a family type hotel so you'll see lots of kids in the pool. You also get HD TV and free Internet. Best thing is that you don't pay that rip off parking fee. The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant but provides a fridge and microwave. It was a safe, pleasant stay all the way around.

I am 3-nights in to a 5-night stay, and am paying for this hotel with my health. Read mixed reviews & decided take chance for 3-star rating & pricing. Motel is money pit. Lobby decent & looks nice when pulling up. Promised & requested smoke-free room per migraines. Immediately upon entering room, stagnant smell hit like wall. After unpacking & leaving door ajar, they sprayed air freshener and w/in hour smell returned. Day 2, asked them to come clean carpets while at work to get rid of smell. When returned, walked in & cigarette smell hit in face. Did poor attempt to clean carpet, which was still filthy & stained everywhere. Shower curtain had cigarette smell all over it; in curtains & disgusting furniture. Could not sleep that night from smell. 3rd morning, 1-hour after waking

As a disclaimer, I stayed at this hotel on a Priceline Express deal for one night. Perhaps that could explain some of our issues.  Pros -- Decent breakfast (but not great) -- Airport Shuttle -- Free WiFi (Slow, but free) -- Close to airport  Cons -- Unprofessional Front Desk Staff -- Shuttle was unavailable for 8am departure. Was told I had to wait until 9am as driver was busy. -- Room was old and smelled musty.  -- Bathroom was not clean. Hair on floor and in tub. -- I was double charged. Once by Priceline, then a second time by hotel. I found that they had charged me for another customer's room.  Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. It realize it was the risk I took, but it didn't pay off.

The room was very big and nice.  There was a refrigerator, coffee maker, sink and microwave in the kitchenette area.  There was also a couch in the living room and a very comfortable queen size bed.  The complimentary breakfast was excellent (bagels, waffles made to order, cereal, fruit, oj and coffee).  But breakfast is only served until 9:00 a.m. during the week (10:00 a.m. on weekends).  My only real complaint is that I could hear the water going through the pipes when a neighboring room used the water.  But I got used to that soon enough.  Overall, excellent value for the money and courteous staff.

Here is the quick summary: very dated property (look, furniture, paint, etc.), accepts dogs & smokers, you can hear cars from highly on higher levels (2&3), staff was very friendly and made accommodations because of wrong booking.  Detailed Info:  Pro - When we arrive late Sat., they only had smoking rooms available (even though we had booked with Orbitz with non-smoking rooms).  I talked to the night manager and he said Orbitz doesn't share that type of info with them, so we could take the rooms for that night or he could look for another property with nonsmoking rooms.  We were tired, so we decided to take the rooms for 1 night.  I contacted the morning staff about the room change and they moved us to nonsmoking rooms with an upgrade to a double bed in one of the rooms.   Con

Thanks for every thing it was great. The place very nice and everybody was great. We will stay there again I have to be in the area every other month and this is the place I will stay for work and  fun

Summary Heading: Needed Pet Friendly Hotel for Fumigation Displacement
Summary: We needed a hotel that could accommodate us and our cats for 4 nights while our home was being fumigated.  LaQuinta was super pet friendly and we even met neighbors pets.  The room was clean, comfortable, affordable, and nearby.  The staff was efficient, kind, and very helpful. Overall, I was completely satisfied with our stay.

We stay at this La Quinta whenever we visited our daughter at college.  The rooms are always nice, the staff friendly, the price is very reasonable and the breakfast is well above what you get at other hotels.    Only tip we would offer - don't stay in a first floor room near the breakfast area, especially if you want to sleep in; it can get a bit noisy.

Easy access to Interstate I405. Nice and clean room with plenty of space. Good daily service and breakfast. Quick response for requests. There are other hotels in the street and it is quite a safe and quite area in general. The hotel staff is nice and friendly. We will stay there again.

The room was not just a bed and bathroom. It had a little area with a couch\sofa and a desk so when you are with somebody, you are not all cramped into a tiny space. The hotel is located next to a few other hotels at the Hotel Terrace in more of an industrial part of town. It is right next to the 55 freeway, yet far enough that the traffic noise doesn't bother. There's Del Taco and Jack in the Box right across the street and "The District" in Tustin, where you can find bunch of restaurants and a movie theatre is just a 10 minute drive away. A continental breakfast is served in the little courtyard of the hotel.

The location was great as we made trips back and forth between LA and San Diego.  The rooms were clean and spacious,  the area was safe and the staff was helpful.   The only suggestion I have is to invest in a better breakfast bar.

Summary Heading: This hotel had excellent service, closeness to Santa Ana airport
Summary: This hotel is located on Hotel Terrace - quiet, free shuttle service to airport at the time you request.   The clerks were very friendly & accomodating to our needs.  The breakfast was very good - enjoyed making the waffles.     I"d strongly recommend it !   & would return there again.

Summary Heading: O.K. Resort at the  Right Price
Summary: Mid-April 2013. Room 206, Non-smoking(?), King bed with full-sized pull-out sofa bed.  6 day stay with family on vacation.    Pros: - Decent sized room with divider - Room had an appliance/club bar containing a microwave, mini fridge, and a small club-style     sink. - Quiet clean location - Allows pets  - Free in-room WIFI  - Plenty of parking - Friendly desk, maintenance and housekeeping staff - Good selection for continental breakfast - Outdoor covered eating area - Guest laundry facilities on property. - Relatively close to Disneyland & Knott's Berry Farm - Shopping and dining district nearby.  Cons: - Room smelled of stale cigarette smoke (asked for non-smoking room). - intermittent wireless connection (both in room and lobby) - Sink drain stopper didn't work - Could use a

Summary Heading: Should paid a few dollars more to say elsewhere
Summary: Grubby sums it up really.  Needs a general refresh. Location was fine for my needs but could just as easily have stayed in one of the other 4 competitors on  hotel terrace.   Bathroom sink was full of grime and the bathtub was on a weird slant. Felt like I was falling over in the shower.   Blind was very hard to operate  Very limited tv channels and the wifi bandwidth was almost unusable in the evenings

Summary Heading: Disapointed after staying in the Fresno La Quinta
Summary: Hotel in need of TLC. Burns in carpet.Smell in the room and the Bathroom not up to par, nosy fan you could not turn off.. Elevator was scary, very noisy . I booked three rooms so we would be close together and requested down stairs. When we arrived early they were sold out of down stairs rooms, and yet others who came later got downstairs rooms.. they also gave us rooms all over the place on the 3rd floor... The Breakfast was OK, not like in the past. no eggs bacon or Sausage. packaged everything, and the worst was the Coffee, the worst I have ever had at a hotel. the Housekeeping was hit and miss. Very Disappointed. We we were there for a annual dog show.. They gave us one area to walk the dogs and then let other folks put up X-pens in the only few spots of grass... Parking was

Summary Heading: Value for money if you just want a hotel room for the night
Summary: Value for money hotel located near to I-5. I used it to for a night to stay on my way to San diego. Rooms are big and clean. They offer free wifi and breakfast which wasnt bad either for the price you pay.

We received a good rate using HotWire, but the hotel could be SO MUCH better. It needs TLC. We stayed in 3 rooms over two separate long weekends in April, had to request a move from our rm 204 because the closet doors wouldn't work properly. Glass sliding doors w/worn out tracks. The breakfast is only good for a 'last resort': packaged donuts, tired waffles, imitation butter, etc. elevator is noisy and shaky. Rooms and baths were clean in all 3 instances, but couches (small sofa beds) are worn and provide uncomfortable seating.  A major gripe is the bathroom switch, it controls lights and exhaust fan together. You can't hear a thing from the other room - even with the door open - major annoyance if you are carrying on a conversation, listening to music, or needing to keep an ear

Summary Heading: Disappointed after staying at this property in the past.
Summary: We were happy to go back and stay at this hotel that has always served us well in the past. We had that same easy going but expedient check in process but that is where things changed. We walked into our NONSMOKING room to the stench of old stale cigarette smoke. This wasn't the smell of fresh smoke. It was obvious that someone had smoke in this room and it was in the carpet and the walls now. They should not advertise a stinky room was non smoking. If it used to be a smoking room then they changed it to non smoking then they needed to have replaced the carpets and painted. We were offered another room that was also "nonsmoking" but i asked to go see it first. It too smelled like cigarette smoke. We just kept the first room because it was on the ground floor and we had dogs with

They have the best rooms newly remodeled of all the other Lq's in the county.  I like this hotel for this reason and they have two desk top computers avail to use  in the lobby to make reservations or use for anything else, also they have a better breakfest  then most of the other Lq's in the county, easy access off the freeway and close to fastfood and gas stations.

Just completed a 4 night stay at this location.  First time staying at a LaQuinta Inn.  Loved it.  Room was typical size and very clean.  Wish the double beds were queens instead, but I'm spoiled in my king bed at home.  Beds were very comfortable and room was quiet despite overlooking the pool.  Room has all the basic amenities one expects (fridge, microwave).  Hotel was pet friendly and did not charge any extra for having our dog with us.  Staff was very friendly.  Front desk clerk upon check-in provided a flyer to a Chinese restaurant that I asked for.  Place was very good.  The girl cooking waffles for breakfast allowed my mother-in-law to get food for breakfast and bring items back to the room even though breakfast had closed 30 min prior.  That really put a good start in

Easy access right off the 55 fwy.  Greated by friendly and accommodating front desk staff.  Room was older and in need of some updates but very clean.  Bed was very comfortable and linens were nice quality.  Could hear people talking in the pool area fairly loudly into the night.  Not sure if we had elephants above us but we could hear every step the took.  Not a bad hotel and would stay here again if in the area.

We enjoyed our stay at La Quinta. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was nice that they had free breakfast. The room was old but clean and the bed was much more comfortable than expected.  We had a room facing the pool so we could hear some talking but it wasn't bad. Their internet connection was slow but taking into account the price and great service, it was worth it.

I was looking for a place to stay that had good value for the price.  The room was clean, the Lobby inviting, and the service was attentive.  I loved the complimentary breakfast by the pool. The hotel is next to the 55 fwy so it's easy to get around. It was quiet for us and we had an outside room. We did see and hear planes landing when outside but I personally enjoy the planes.

Great place to stay. accommodating and friendly staff. Competitive price. Clean room. Quiet. Only one minor observation. The breakfast bar could use bacon or sausage and scrambled eggs. But that's just my opinion. A truly enjoyable stay.

Rooms are clean, Bed was better than expected, room was large and the TV work well. In my room you could tell it had pets in it probably right before my stay. I would stay here again and would change rooms if I had an odor issue again, the staff are very nice people that seem to really care you are comfortable.

The location is excellent and the staff is genuinely friendly and helpful. I was treated as though I was a frequent visitor. Obviously, the manager treats his/her people with respect to gain that kind of dedication. i will definitely stay at that location again.

I, as you know travel far and wide but last week I found myself in a rut. The Senior Golf tourneyment was in town and place was at a premium. I stayed at the LaQuinta for 4 days 3 nights. Clean room although the maid seems a little motivated to clean the room early. Clean Towels, Clean sheets every day and a very good price 75 bucks a night weekday

It had all that we needed: Close to the airport, complimentary shuttle, hot tub, complimentary breakfast. All staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful.  The shuttle even brought rom returning a rental car back to the hotel.

Great location, next to freeways that will take you north to Disneyland area and south to the beach area. Hotel is remodeled from the last time I stayed at a La Quinta Inn. More updated décor & brighter colors. Beds and bedding very comfortable. Staff reasonably accommodated all our needs. Assistant Manager, Alfredo, seemed like he was on-site all day/night, very dedicated. He was a great source of help and flexible. Housekeeping very sweet too...

Summary Heading: Older but nice for the price.
Summary: Convenient to airport, rooms open out to parking lot rather than an indoor hallway, which was fine for the purpose of my stay: overnight and with a puppy.  I had to leave early the next morning to catch a flight so I didn't try breakfast.  The front desk person was warm and friendly upon checkin.  As I said in title, this is an older laquinta but it was clean and adequate.

We are truck drivers and had to drop our trailer at the shipper so needed a place close by that would allow a big truck to park and this one was accommodating to our needs.  When I asked if there were rental cars close by (next door) the clerk was more than willing to give me the phone numbers.  Our first night the TV broke so we had to move which was right next door and the young man offered to help:) that was so nice in our opinion!  We toured Hollywood and had a blast.  Went to check out and noticed there was a mess up in the balance we owed, because they gave us a credit on our bill for the TV thing.  We didn't ask or say any thing to them about wanting a credit they did it on their own and that is GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE in our eyes.

Summary Heading: I haven't slept in a week!!!!!
Summary: I purchased a package from Expedia which was reasonably priced. Our room smelled of mold which I attributed to the age of the hotel and our room.... it was right outside the breakfast area. As I write this it is 1:14 am and I'm in my room. I can hear someone's luggage clicking on the floor outside my room, the person on the back side of the wall is snoring LOUDLY and the people to my left have their tv up so loud I can't sleep again for the 5th night in a row.  Every morning at 8am when I got a few hours of sleep the laughing and carrying on in the breakfast area woke us. The coffee pot was cheap so I went to Walmart and purchased an inexpensive one just so I could have a decent amount of coffee. Back to the noise now the neighbor on the other side is opening and closing their

This hotel is located on "Hotel Row" in Santa Ana, a short distance from John Wayne airport and very convenient for travel around Orange County.  We were very pleased with the large, clean room and the helpful, courteous staff.  We left our jackets in the room when we checked out and had no trouble recovering them on our way back from San Diego a couple of days later.
