My only objection to this place is that breakfast could use a little more protein -- there was plenty of carbolicious food like donuts, danish, bagels, waffles etc.  We stayed there for four days, and the food was the same, including some watery oatmeal, every day. I would have appreciated some scrambled eggs once in awhile!

We always stay at La Quinta when we travel because we always have our dog with us, they never give us a hassle about him, no outrageous fees for bringing our furry family member with us, room is big enough, we enjoy the separated rooms.  Good size rooms for the price...

Summary Heading: Good place to stay not to far from Disneyland
Summary: We were looking for a place to stay near Disneyland that was not too expensive and saw this on TripAdvisor. We saw that this was only a 15 minute drive south of Disneyland and wanted to give this place a try. We are happy we did.  There staff was helpful and friendly, willing to do anything to help the guest. Breakfast was better then other LaQuinta, in that in addition to the regular breakfast items they also had doughnuts, as well as oatmeal with a choice of toppings.  Overall I will stay there again.

If you are carrying out a secret mission, this is not the place to be. I can hear everything - your conversations, your tv, your water running and your coughing all night.  This is the only place in town I can stay with my sr citizen dogs without paying a ridiculous fee per night. Otherwise I wouldn't be here.

The best thing about staying here was the helpful staff.  Close to John Wayne Airport. only minutes from the beaches.  The room was clean and having a fridge and microwave was convenient.  We did have some noisy neighbors one night but they were only there one night. I always travel with earplugs.

Summary Heading: Pretty good not that much but yes
Summary: When we first got to our room,there was a terrible smell! I almost threw up. The room service wasn't so good because we found two empty beer bottles under our sofa. Also,I found it unwelcoming to go up the elevator,then find yourself looking down at the patio without windows. I find that annoying. Maybe not you. I got the bathroom and the door we come in with mixed up. Not that good.

Summary Heading: Great place especially when traveling with a dog.
Summary: We stayed here for two nights. The staff was very pleasant and the rooms were clean. I needed to receive and send a few faxes while on travel-- the service was complimentary. The staff was very responsive. We brought our dog with us. It was a pleasant area to walk the dog and they also had clean up bags on the premise if you needed them.

Nice,comfortable, great staff! I would stay again at this property. The girl at breakfast did an excellent job and the staff was super friendly. Easy to get around with a good location. Nice location for families easy to get to Disney from here.

Summary Heading: clean, good breakfast and value for money
Summary: Overall we are very happy with this hotel. Very near South Coast Plaza and also Newport Beach Fashion Island. Good choice for breakfast. Will be better if they change menu daily for those who stayed 1 week or more.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, fair price, allows cats
Summary: helpful and friendly staff.  allowed my cat to stay with no questions.  nice room that was clean and good sized.  the 'breakfast' was the usual 'continental' ... do wish one could get a real meal.  the facility is near the airport ... so you can occasionally hear planes on final approach or after takeoff.  i love planes so enjoyed being able to look at them from the courtyard.  the courtyard is nice - real plants and a nice, though small, pool.

Summary Heading: Decent but you can do better
Summary: Of all the La Qunita's I have stayed at this is on the lower half of average.  It is clean and the staff is friendly but it is getting dated.  I know they try to refresh it but this place just seems to have an old feel to it.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had plenty of water pressure and hot water so no specific issue.  To me it just felt run down.

Friendly staff at front desk, willing to guide you or help you at check in and check out. Room was very nice, clean, and finally La Quinta hit a homerun with their new HD TVs. I have had better breakfast choises in other La Quinta (LAX), although this was not bad. Highly recommend this hotel.

Nice hotel for the price. Near many shopping malls/stores. Room was clean and a good size. Nice area and friendly staff. Waffles, boiled eggs, cereal, oatmeal, fresh coffee, fruit, juices,bread and bagels; not a bad choice of breakfasts items but if you stay there too many days you might get tired of the same stuff, but overall good. Would definitely stay here again!

Stayed here based on location and rate.  Looked like a new property.  This is actually an older property that has been repurposed and refreshed; I wouldnt go so far as to call it a refurbishment.   My room was a semi-suite; large but with an unappetizing odor that reeked of mold. The furnishings were some cheesy ultra modern pieces; an uncomfortable sofa, a ridiculously unergonomic and barely usable desk with a contraption that might be mistaken for a chair.  Poor lighting, lumpy mattress, and a bathroom that smelled and was barely usable.  The open motel layout does not seem secure; lots of foottraffic and noise on the open walkways.   The folks are friendly, but seem clueless about running a hotel as a business.

We would enjoy staying here again with the exact staff.  They were wonderful.  We were pleasantly surprised with the attention to detail for our needs.  The location was ideal for our travel plans which included Disneyland, Legoland, Fashion Island, South Coast Plaza, San Diego, and our family in Newport Beach.

I was here for classes I was taking in Tustin.  The grounds are nice.  The furniture in the room was worn/torn a beaten up.  Other than that I was happy with the comfort of the bed, it had a nice sink area with microwave and refrigerator.

Stayed for three nights.  Grounds well landscaped. Room was large, included comfortable relaxing area with 2 seater couch and 2 additional chairs and also kitchen area. All doors open to the outside so easy to get luggage to room, quiet, no traffic noises. Nothing to complain about! Breakfast was good, fresh crumpets made by the serving lady, nice pool area and tables/chairs to chill out as well as indoor reception areas to relax. Near to large, very good shopping complex (by car) Would definitely stay there again.

I read the reviews, decided to stay.  I had a late night check in, the staff was very very nice.  The grounds are very nice, pretty, well kept.  All rooms open to the outside, so wait to haul your luggage until after you check in.  My room was big, for the most part it was clean.  The carpet at the door was a little dirty, you could see the path.  Other than that and some frayed carpet at the closet, it was ok.  It had that retro feel with the furnishings, but I slept great.  The bathroom door didn't open up all the way due to the rounded shower curtain rod.  It was clean, lots of towels, just can't get over the bright shower curtains.  Seem out of place with the rest of the decor.  Check out was a breeze.  Again, the staff was very friendly.  Breakfast was nice.  They have an

Outstanding!!  From check-in to check-out, everything was excellent.  After checking in, receptionist offered the best customer service I’ve ever received.  He went out of his way to assist us.  Room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Great breakfast and served by the eating area worker.  She made and served waffles and practically waited on each table.  Made for a smooth morning and a faster checkout.  I will stay here again!

This hotel is centrally located between Anaheim and the Newport Beach and within an hour drive to many major attractions.  Convient acces directly off Costa Mesa Freeway 55.  The average location rating is to account for the lack of nearby support facilties. The hotel's complimentary breakfast is fair and there are no other meal options (restaurants) in the immediate area except for the Embassy Suites next door as suggested by the front desk. Room and hotel grounds are clean and well maintained.

We always stay at a La Quinta when visiting Disneyland. Chose this location since it was a really good price. The rooms were extremely clean, very big, and very quiet. The beds were so comfortable. The breakfast was good. Loved the fresh cooked waffles, although it would have been nice if they had sugar free syrup.   A warning....someone is calling the hotel rooms at this location at like 1am. They are claiming that they are the front desk and that they needed our info since the hotels computer system crashed. The caller new exactly what our room number was. After listening for a few minutes I hung up and called the front desk only to find out that there was only 1 person there and he had not made this call. If you get a call like this do not give out your info. Hang up and call

I've now stayed in this hotel twice (almost 3 times, more on this in a bit).  The first time I thought it was pretty good. The second time the room was worse and as an outside room, I saw the bird poop and some of the maintenance issues. The third time I arrived to find out they only had smoking rooms available. I dread this. I went to the room, hoping that it would be livable.  It wasn't. The room reeked of smoke in a very bad way. You might say - ok, but it is a smoking room, right? Right. But there were stains on the carpet, cigarette burns and other stains on the couch. It was a dump.  i had purchased this room through a no-refund consolidator. I went ahead and called them to ask if there was another hotel nearby I could get into. I was willing to eat the cost of this

Summary Heading: Our convention made better by La Quinta Inn
Summary: My Senior Supervisor and I had to attend a one day conference in Anaheim this past Monday and were worn out afterwards.  It was so nice to come to a cool, clean and quite room.  The beds were comfortable and having a refrigerator and microwave in the room really helped us keep costs down.  The staff were very pleasant and very helpful.  We needed extra decaf coffee in our room and when I ordered it, it was delivered within 5 minutes!  We will definitely stay with them again!

Even though I ran into noise problems the first night, the staff was gracious and moved me to another room. This made a great ending to my stay. The staff throughout were very gracious and helpful and the location was terrific to the area of my family.

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay when visit SoCal
Summary: This is a great hotel when traveling with kids and dog. The rooms are very spacious and clean.This is our 3rd visit here and  we love staying here whenever we  visit our  daughter in UCI. They serve hot breakfast daily.

Summary Heading: Great  stay at La Quinta Santa Ana Hotel Terrace
Summary: I recently stayed at the La Quinta Inn and Suites Santa Ana with my sister for a conference we were attending. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable and the staff really went the extra mile to make sure we had everything we needed. The location is very convenient right off the freeway with nearby places to eat.  We definitely will stay again and truly apprecited the kindness and care taken by Nicole, the general manager as well as her front desk staff to make sure our needs were met.

I booked this hotel through Hotwire for 3 nights in August 2012. They gave me a room on the 3rd floor, but it had strong cigarette smell. When we requested a room change, the front desk quickly gave us another room on the 2nd floor, which was much better. The breakfast buffet was better than average and free wi-fi and free parking was extra benefit. This hotel is close to Angels Ball Park and a Korean grocery store, H-Mart.

Summary Heading: Glad we only stayed one night...
Summary: We were here one night for their Park n' Fly package. Their shuttle service is fine but there is no covered/protected parking area so your car is open to the elements and potential thieves.  The room was showing its wear.  Cracked tiles in the bathroom, big stain on the carpeting, the lamp didn't work, and you can't view the tv from the bedroom area. The staff was friendly and service was OK.  But next time we fly out of Orange County we will try a different Park n' Fly hotel.

I really loved the room! It was oversized and had a divider that decided the bedroom and the tv room for an affordable price. Had a refrigerator, sink, microwave, flat screen TV and everything you need! looked new and remodeled. It made me feel comfy and at home.

I can't comment on the cockroaches as we stayed here for a night or two when we had a leak in our apartment that flooded the first and second floors.    The room they gave us was HUGE, absolutely mind-blowing large, like 600-700sqft I'd bet.  The room was nice and very clean.  A huge king bed that was comfy and a mini-bar/fridge/microwave was available in the room.  The TV was 40 inches and an LCD, much more modern and for hte price of $90/night it was more than acceptable.  We had breakfast the next morning at the hotel and it was quite good as others have commented on.    Otherwise if the price came down a little I'd definitely be all over this location again.  Our son loved it, though we couldn't entice him into the pool, the TV had him affixed.  I'd totally return here.

We stayed at the hotel the night before our departure from John Wayne Airport.  Great service.  Gave us directions both verbal and printed to local eateries.  They also provide shuttle service to and from the airport.  Hotel was clean and the breakfast was adequate.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.  Great value for the money.

Summary Heading: Giant cockroaches ruin an otherwise decent hotel
Summary: I thought I liked this place...until two giant cockroaches interrupted my morning cup of tea.  One ran into an empty plastic clothes shopping bag--and the other under the couch I was sitting on.  Other than that, there are lots of plusses to La Quinta.  Internet is included; the free breakfast is decent; the bed was comfortable to sleep in; there's a decent work desk; the kitchenette is adequate; there's two coin-op laundry machines available; shower pressure is good; park and fly service is good value if you fly out of John Wayne.  I just hope the management gets the exterminators in quick.  Until then--yuck!

Great service, room was a suite with king size bed and sofa turns into a bed , microwave, fridge, 40in LCD breakfast lady was great 1 lady for about 50 people at a time and didn't have to wait for nothing, and kids loved the pool, better than my stay at the Orleans in las Vegas

Summary Heading: OK, but you can do better in the same area
Summary: I usually stay at the Holiday Inn Express at Newport Beach when I am in Orange County.  I thought that I would try something different.  I found the hotel somewhat run down and like others here I had a smoking room when I did not want one.  The staff are great, but does not make up for the facility.  I also found that the breakfast bar was laking and if you are on the first floor it can be noisy if you are near the breakfast area.  If you are looking for a budget place this is good, but there are other properties next door that are better looking and probably more comfortable.

I like the La Quinta Hotels so much for their pet friendly attitude.  I don't know what I would do without them. I suggest you avoid the John Wayne location but this hotel is lovely.  My room was clean, had coffee maker, fridge, microwave, ect... The bed was very good quality and I slept in an extra hour instead of having breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great place to sleep and relax
Summary: Have been staying at this hotel several times in the past months for work.  Excellent location great pool and spa.  Close to the beach and fair grounds.  Only complaint is the food needs some work.  Waffles and donuts seems a little blan for such a nice hotel and was served all weekend.

Summary Heading: Great staff but facility is frayed around the edges
Summary: Stayed 2 weekend nights mid August on a Hotwire reservation. Arrived early and was offered a smoking room which I took (I don't smoke) but was shocked that a hotel today would still have smoking rooms. Fortunately the cigarette smell in the room did not last long. I did not find the outside areas as attractive as some reviewers. My smoking room was way at the back of the hotel so I had to walk frequently from front to back and saw many uncared for areas. Room was clean and once the cigarette smell was gone, it was quite comfortable with a small couch, a cushioned chair, desk chair and flat screen TV. Breakfast was adequate but not as nice as a Holiday Inn Express. Fitness center was small with one each of several different fitness machines. Staff were very pleasant and

The mission-style architecture is bright and cheerful, especially on sunny days!  We stayed in an oversized, recently-renovated room at VERY reasonable cost. There is a cozy pool area with a jacuzzi.  There were a few issues with the pool (e.g. no towels) but the front desk handled them cheerfully.  Breakfast was more than adequate considering the cost.  The location is very convenient; easy on and off to/from the expressway.  Overall I was very happy I chose this hotel.

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience staying at La Quinta Orange County - Santa Ana
Summary: This reasonably priced hotel exceeded all expectations.  The setting was beautiful , lovely courtyard and swimming pool, excellent responsive staff, quiet neighborhood, generous breakfast, and an all around great experience at this location.  But we also stayed 3 nights prior at La Quinta Mission Valley in San Diego and though the desk staff were very friendly and helpful, it was hard to believe this had the same name as the Santa Ana location.  It is old and run down and falling apart, crowded and noisy.  On top of that, it cost us $60 more a night to stay there than to stay in Santa Ana La Quinta.

Good location. Excellent service and quiet place, not like Anaheim area. Good breakfast choces. Customer service was great and they provided anything that we need, even toothpaste or shaving cream that we forgot at home.

Free breakfast is great for family. Staff always pleasant. Rooms clean. Pool area and hot tub good. Never any Problems. Check in and out i always fast and hassle free. Hotel is quiet and family friendly.

This is a pretty good hotel for it price point. Nice hot continental breakfast.   Outdoor pool seemed a little cold and the hot tub required a good cleaning however they were in good repair.  The room was in good repair however the carpet needs a good cleaning or replacement.

The ratings at this property are misleading.  Anyone that has stayed at a nice hotel will know what I'm talking about.  We were drawn to this property by its ratings.  The property was undergoing maintenance on one elevator and the fountain in front of the property.  The first room we were given had a stale and molded smell to it.  The second room was clean and adequate with a small bathroom.  The pool reminded me of those you see at low grade apartments.  The breakfast had consistantly runny eggs, the bacon  was paper thin and tasteless and bananas green. The pluses to this property was the staff was responsive and helpful and the laundry machines on each floor. There were several other hotels next door.  We stayed at a courtyard in Irvine a few miles away that was newer and

The desk clerk was very nice. She told us about the pool and gave us towels for it. The room was large with a microwave and refridge. Only drawback" bathroon was kind of dirty. Ask for a balcony. It was nice.

I rarely give this low of a rating, and I stay at La Quinta's across the country.  The reviews drew me in, but then I arrived.  Pros: Embassy Suites is walking distance and has a nice restaurant.  Breakfast is good, has an attendant, even hot scrambled eggs!  Easy access.  Nice wet bar area.  The rest: I am top tier with their chain, but received none of the check-in amenities.  Walls are paper-thin, listened for hours to a baring dog on one side, and someone's television on the other.  Bathroom lighting is very poor.  Mildew on shower head.  This is a motel with outside access to your room, not a hotel.  Walkways are wet from condensation dripping from upper floor's air-conditioning.  Vending is only on floor two and three, elevator is painfully slow.  I would not stay here

Summary Heading: Perfect value with perfect hotel staff and a great breakfast
Summary: The title says it all -- or almost all.  We had a wonderful, though too short, stay.  The hotel staff was absolutely perfect, the grounds very attractive, the room much above what we expected, and the breakfast was just what we wanted to start the day.  Way to go, LQ Orange County!!!

I love to stay at LaQuinta,expecially the newer ones.   The beds are so comfortable.  I say this because I have back problems and the bed is perfect.  Wish you had hotels in Hawaii so I coud stay there, also.  You can always count on good service.

We had booked a trip on priceline, this hotel was rated 2.5 stars so we thought okay this cant be so bad, we travel often and were excited about our disneyland vacation, well it all went south when we checked in, the FIRST room they gave us had filthy carpets and furniture, mold on the bathroom ceiling and a cockroach in the bathtub. We complained so they switched us to a different room the next day. The next room looked like it had the carpets replaced and appeared to be cleaner, however as we were leaving and coming back we noticed alot of people appearing to use the hotel as a party place, shady looking characters, even heard them talking about drugs. So we settled in for the evening and once again saw cockroaches, 3 total within a night, called the front desk and her

We chose this hotel over several others in the area for a basketball tournament in Anaheim.  This location served us well with close proximity to the Distrikt Mall for evening fun.  We couldn't have been more pleased...  The entire hotel staff were so caring & polite.  Brenda, Casey and the Assistant General Manager were all fabulous.  The rooms were very modern, SUPER Clean and comfortable...  Great job !!

We stayed there last summer (~3 nights, July-August 2011). We got a great room. The front desk were very very nice and helpfull. Even Helped us to find the next hotel on way to the Zion Canyon. Excellent breakfast, nice location. close free car parking. We highly recommend the hotel and its proffetional staff. The Ozeri family (Tel Aviv)

My wife and I had an early flight to DC, so we wanted to be close to John Wayne airport.  We also wanted a safe place to park our vehicle while we were away for 8 days.  So, we purchased the park-sleep-fly package.  It came with a King suite, free shuttle to airport and 10 days of parking for $99 plus tax.  I don't believe they should call the room a suite, but it does come with a chair and dated couch.  The bathroom is tiny, and there is one small window in the room.  The walls are very thin, as we heard a family checking in around midnight.  If you don't run the air at night you will hear just about anything.  Needless to say, we slept about four hours for our early am flight.   The good:  Jll at the front desk, the exemplary shuttle service at 5:45am. The bad:  not real quiet

Nice welcome and friendly front desk clerk, who took a liking to our dog and was very sweet with her. Large, clean, comfortable room. Breakfast attendant was personable and very accomodating, offering to make waffles for everyone. Everything was perfect!

Filthy carpet.  Internet went out the night we were here.  Desk staff was sympathetic but not helpful.  Manager was LESS than sympathetic the next morning.   Outdoor corridors. Breakfast was included but was sub-par.  Won't go back.

I checked in on Saturday, and they put me in a smoking room. I walked in and the carpet and furniture were so dirty you couldn't walk on it. There were cigarette burns on the carpet and the room smelled bad. I called down to the front desk and asked for a new room and they didnt have any. Hotwire rated the room 3 stars...talk about a joke!

Summary Heading: A great hotel at an excellent price
Summary: Wonderful hotel for families...great breakfast, free parking, free internet, free airport shuttle and an amazing price. I will definitely recommend this hotel.
Room was very clean and roomy. Great place to stay would recommend it for anyone going on vacation or business.
Excellent staff, both in greeting and available for help at all times.  Definitely recommend to all!!!!

Summary Heading: SERVICE AND VALUE AT La Quinta hotel in Santa Ana
Summary: The price  I paid for my stay was a great bargain. The staff members are very personable, courteous and helpful.  Availability of great variety of breakfast foods. This hotel would be a great place for a budget  personal or family vacation.

Summary Heading: Outstanding Stay----beats the Sheraton hands down!
Summary: We spent one night here prior to our pre-booked Disney package at a Sheraton property.  Our only regret is that we should have stayed at La Quinta instead!  The front desk was extremely friendly and prompt and the room was superb.  The value is incredible and included a microwave and fridge along with their standard breakfast.  Outstanding pool and spa facility and the grounds were immaculate.  The front desk offers Disney tickets at a considerably reduced rate from the front gate, which was a plus for our son and his family who met us there.  On our next visit to Disney we will definitely make this our home base.  It is too far for a shuttle, but for the oustanding accomodations and great value, it is worth driving the 9 miles and parking in the Disney lot.  Another winner La

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for UC Irvine graduation
Summary: We stay at this hotel every time we have traveled to visit our daughter who attends UC Irvine.  It is about a 10 minute drive on the freeway from the hotel to the school.  The beds are so comfortable and there is never any noise, even though it is usually full.   The breakfast has hot items, like eggs and sausage.   The king bed rooms have a sofa sleeper that can sleep an additional person.  We love this hotel.  Many people stay here and travel to Disneyland, which is not too far away. It is also near the SNA airport and offers free shuttle service.   Now that our daughter has graduated, we are sad that we won't have a reason to stay at this hotel.
Stayed using their Stay and Fly program.  Made it great to catch a very early plane.  Room was large and clean with all the ammenities.  Would definitely stay again.

We stayed here during a short trip with our kids. We left for the day, and returned to find our keys didn't work, went to To the front desk, and learned When our room was booked they only booked us for one night instead of the two we requested, they charged us over $30 more for the second night, and suggested we take it up with the manager the next day. Spoke with the mgr the next morning and was told that we didn't have proof that we scheduled 2 nights with them and there was nothing they could do. This after, not checking out after the first day and leaving all of our stuff in the room? Wouldn't that be proof we were to be there the second night? We will never stay at a Laquinta again, and my husband is cab driver that will never recommend them again.

Summary Heading: You can do better for the same price, close by
Summary: I reviewed this hotel a few months ago while staying for business. I previously gave the hotel 4 circles, this time it only gets 2.  Note that I've stayed in all 3 of the similarly priced hotels right next to each other on Hotel Terrace, due to repeat business trips to this area. The best one is the Best Western Plus across the street. The next best one is the Quality Suites next door. The LaQuinta is the worst of the three (and this is true even without the issues I experienced this time). I suggest you pick one of the other two.  The good: - nice large rooms - refrigerator and microwave - very good bedding and good pillows - free internet - free breakfast - close to SNA - reasonable rates  The not so good: - Building is reasonably well maintained but showing some age -

The staff that checked us in were friendly and we got what we had requested for our room. We were quite pleased with the room when they say recently renovated they mean it.  Very nicely decorated and clean.  Towels were big and fluffy.  The breakfast in the morning was a selection of eggs, bacon, waffles prepared by the staff, juices & coffee.  They also had bagels and an assortment of bread to toast.  The breakfast room located  in a great place away from the office; you could eat indoors or outdoors lovely setting.  With all the hotels on hotel terrace drive La Quinta had the best value for your money! Loved it and would return.

We stayed here for a quick weekend trip to visit family. We LOVE the La Quinta we stay at in St. George so we thought we would give this location a try.  Biulding is obviously older but overall we were very satisfied with our stay and have already booked a second stay.  Here is a breakdown of the pros and cons.  Pros:  Great location off the freeway            Pet Friendly            Good Price             Bed was awesome and super comfy!!            Very clean            TV was great even had white noise channels            STAFF is very friendly.... Thanks Alfredo the assistant manager and Jordan the best front desk person ever!!! And the young lady that works in the breakfast area was all over it!!            Good waffels for breakfast            Rooms are somewhat updated

Our family stayed here for a Disneyland trip. I was very surprised at how close we were to Disney for the price we stayed for. The hotel was very clean and had a very nice breakfast buffet in the morning. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful in providing info on different places to eat in the area. The girl at the front desk even printed out directions for us.
A very nice room and convenient.  Excellent  breakfast buffet. Courteous staff, Very clean rooms. Centrally located, close to airport,  stores, and dining.

If you are looking for a place to stay for business, this is the place.  Very centrally located, nicely finished rooms, and a good hot cooked breakfast, and best of all, the price is right.  The staff is very friendly.

Summary Heading: great place near john wayne airport
Summary: My wife and I stayed 12 - 15 May '12 for a family visit in Santa Ana. The king ste is very large and well equiped. Mini fridge/micro and bar is included. Nice flat screen TV. King bed very  comfortable. The included breakfast was very good but standard fare. The lady making waffles was very nice. All front desk employees were very nice and helpfull. The only negative I have for this review is the couch and chair in the room could use a update, not to comfortable.   I would definitly stay here again.
calm.comforting.freindly staff, excellent service all around many places to eat and things to do.or just stay in and enjoy there amazing t.v. or the soothing bath

This hotel had the best staff for check in and use of the shuttle going to my meeting.  It saved me gas and money for the parking at my meeting.  The breakfast variety was great, the gal helping in the breakfast area was subperb, she took the waffles out of the waffle iron and would find who had started them.  Great job!!! The only complaint, minor one, was the ice machine is only on the 2nd and 3rd floors. The second night of my stay the 2nd floor ice machine did not work, so I got a little exercise (is how I looked at it) by going up stairs to the next floor.

I stayed here for five days when attending a conference and I was pleasantly surprised by the value.  Along with other reviewers, I agree that the linens weren't plush and the soundproofing a little lacking - but the room was nicely furnished, parking easy and plentiful, and the breakfast was perfect for my needs.  I figure the breakfast added $10 worth of value to each day (I had juice, coffee, a waffle, eggs, and bacon or sausage every day - where can you get that for less than $10?) and the rate was already a bargain.  You can't compare it to a five-star resort, but if you compare it to other hotels at the same price, it wins hands-down.
Spent a restful night here for about $100. Giant room, well appointed. Staff is friendly and you get a real breakfast to boot. Great value for the area.

I stayed here in February 2012 for a pre-cruise stay and had a king suite.  Price was pretty good too.  It had a separate living area separated from the bedroom by a little wall.  Free in-room internet, flat screen tv, comfortable bed and good shower/bathroom.  It also came with breakfast including the basics of cereal, pastries, coffee & juice etc but it also had someone cooking waffles for you and it also had hot premade scrambled eggs, sausage & bacon.  Not the best tasting hot food but the waffles were actually very good.   I liked it so much I'm staying there again in 2 weeks for another pre-cruise stay.  It is about a 30 minute drive to the cruise terminals.    Convenient location right off the freeway and by the John Wayne airport.  A mall & lots of restaurants a short

Nothing fancy, but we weren't expecting that. Older facility, with outside entrances to rooms. Very clean, room with King bed and refrigerator and microwave was just what we needed. Bathroom was a little too small, and we could hear the other rooms, when they started the shower or bath water. Very nice hot breakfast, with bacon/sausage, eggs, waffles made by the breakfast attendant, cereal, toast etc. Check in and out was very easy, and everyone at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Could hear the planes coming into John Wayne Airport in Santa Ana, but it really didn't bother us too much.

Good hotel for the price. We would stay here again. Here are the details I would have liked to have known in advance.... We stayed with family of 4. Booked a king suite with sofa sleeper..... Had to switch rooms....please note sofa sleeper is a twin size pull out. Not large enough for two kids. Updated room with flat panel Tv. Nice decor. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, sausage patties, waffles, cereal, granola, yogurt, fresh apples and bananas, juice, coffee, tea, milk. You can eat outside or in your room. Room had small refrigerator, wet bar and small microwave. Super Target and Wholefoods a few minutes away at "the district" on the other side of 55. This is the direction you want to head for shopping and restaurants. Google "the district at Tustin" for a directory of

We stay at this location routinely for its location. The customer service during our most recent vist was exceptional. Our stay was scheduled for 2 days and lasted for 8 days. The staff was great in handling our extensions and jumped right in when some problems with noise where brought to their attention. A problem with WIFI went directly to the GM who handled the matter with a real level of concern (this had a direct effect on our business results). The rooms offer a good level of comfort and space. The staff will keep us coming back.

Summary Heading: My night at La Quinta Santa Ana
Summary: The booking process was great and and check in I found a very friendly staff to assist me. The room was very nice just as pictured on-line. The breakfast in the morning was OK. I was disappointed in the pool area as the sun was blocked by the building after 4:00PM. The access to the 55 Freeway was great.  I really enjoyed my stay.

Summary Heading: Pretty good, just not quite perfect
Summary: I've been working in the area and have now stayed at all of the more "budget" hotels on Hotel Terrace in Santa Ana.  The La Quinta is priced similarly to the nearby Comfort Inn, Quality Suites, and Best Western Plus. Compared to those other three, I'd place this hotel as tied for #2 with the Quality Suites. The Comfort Inn is #4, and I'd place the Best Western Plus at #1.  The La Quinta is a nice and reasonably well-maintained hotel. The mustard color is a bit ugly but not too bad. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The central courtyard has a nice pool and spa but is pretty close to the rooms, so not much privacy. The outside areas are reasonably  clean, but not as spotless as the BW Plus across the street. The walkways are just a big stained and things are just a

Summary Heading: Look for La Quinta in Santa Ana
Summary: I just wrote to the manager at this LaQuinta and told her we love staying at this motel. We love the larger rooms, the doors that allow one to bring in some fresh air, the brightness of the rooms and how they sparkle, the breakfast with a special lady Senora ? Can't recall her name.  But she prides herself in making sure everyone is finding what he or she needs, and she has two waffle machines going at one time.  We have not found a LaQuinta that we like even half as much as this one.  The staff get ten stars.  Thank you.

We chose this hotel to stay at while we were apartment hunting in Long Beach. We chose it because of its amenities(pets stay free, nice outdoor pool, fantastic outdoor breakfast buffet) and price point compared to others in the area.  For my full review of this hotel, please visit the following URL:   http://www.top-ten-travel-list.com/La-Quinta-Santa-Ana.html

Summary Heading: Don't unless you can not avoid it
Summary: The desk staff is competent. The housekeepers are not. They don't take things that are obviously trash, the do take things that aren't. Some items that can be recycled here actually pay. They will leave trash on the floor next to the wastebasket and take recycling that's buried under dirty clothes in a chair. We had to complain to the desk before they started leaving cups, coffee packets and ice bags in the room, which should have been done anyway.

This is our 2nd La Quinta stay in the past year - both great. We stayed just one night this time with our teen daughter on a trip to check out colleges in the area. It's not brand new, but lots of character and well-maintained. Relaxed and friendly desk clerk... clean comfy room... good breakfast (much better than the last Marriott hotel we stayed in for twice the price!) in attractive outdoor area near the pool... convenient location... all for a sweet deal. We will stay at La Quinta again :)

La Quinta is extremely pet-friendly. No excessive fees and they seem to actually welcome a pet owner! Free breakfast which is not too bad - the waffles are tasty, but stick with the hard-boiled eggs. Freeway-close location.

Summary Heading: A great dog friendly location in Orange County
Summary: This location is about a 1000% better than the nearby La Quinta Inn location in Costa Mesa. It is a couple of dollars more expensive ($10 or so), but...that is money VERY WELL SPENT.  The hotel is nestled among quite a few other hotels...thus the address "Hotel Terrace". As usual for La Quinta, the location is dog friendly.  The lobby is large and attractive, and the staff we came in to contact with were friendly.  As far as I know, the hotel offers "suites" only. Nowadays the term "suite" can mean a lot of things, but our "room" was large featuring a separate sleeping area from the "sitting" area. In addition it featured a mini fridge and a micro wave in a bar-like setting with a sink.  The room appeared to have been refurbished fairly recently and featured a flat screen TV. We

Very convenient location just off the 55 Freeway - but protected by the Embassy Suites next door so freeway traffic is minimal.   Friendly front desk personnel and easy parking and access to all floors via elevators.   New flat screen TVs and spacious rooms.   I was very pleased with my short 2-night weekend stay at this location.

My wife and I always stay here when we're in town and I've written a review before. I need to add someone to this review though, Nora the wonderful waffle lady. She's always warm and friendly, and we like chatting with her while we wait for our morning waffles. She's been there forever, and always makes our stay pleasant.

This hotel is great for the value. It used to be a different chain, and is all suites. It is perfect for hanging out with friends with a great pool area, patio and jacuzzi. The rooms are really spacious with separate living room and bedroom area. The bedroom is open to the living room, but the rooms are really spacious. We stay there whenever we go out in Orange County, and their rewards program rocks!

I was very pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  For the great price, I expected much less.  It is located just minutes from John Wayne Airport (SNA) and the business parks of Irvine.  For the family vacationer it is also minutes from Newport Beach and a 10 minute highway jaunt to Disneyland.  It is nestled among a grouping of hotels so it is a good neighborhood.  Just down the road you will find all kinds of chain restaurants and stores.  The hotel was very clean with updated suite style rooms.  The mattress and pillows were as good as any 4 star hotel I have stayed in.  The rooms have mid-size frig, microwave and a kitchen sink.  Lots of room to eat or play games with the kids in the room.  Large TV and desk area. The pool was a nice size with a hot tub that was very clean.

Liked the room decoration. Clean big room. Room has also a fridge, microwave and sink. Breakfast can be hectic when it is busy but liked the fact that you can sit outside. The breakfast it self was basic but more than I needed so all OK. Staff friendly. Free wireless but for some reason the reception was kind of bad during the day and pretty OK at night. Strange. Close to the highway 55, subway and Kmart (walking distance). Also 2 min walk to Spoons bar & grill.

We stayed at this inn for 1 night but wish we had booked both nights at this one. The rooms are huge and we had no problem with any noise as other guests noted. We were on the 2nd floor. Complimntary breakfast was better than most...included bacon and scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, toasts, bagel, cereal, fresh fruit, coffe, tea and juices.  Oh and the waffles too!  The room was very clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable. Very each access to freeway.

Summary Heading: Great value, good service, always a good stay.
Summary: Whenever my wife and I are in Santa Ana, we always stay here. Pretty quiet location, and the staff are always friendly.

Summary Heading: Not Your Usual La Quinta....never again
Summary: We stayed three nights in November 2010. The room was very basic. No fridge,no microwave. The "breakfast" is unremarkable and is available from 7-9. Staff are out at 9am closing it down, so when they say 9, they mean 9!!. We returned to our room the second night of our stay and our cards didn't work to open the door. Went to the front desk and was told they had been cancelled by mistake. Went back to our room and it had not been house cleaned, so back to the front desk to get towels etc. The pool was unusable due to debris in the water. The ice machine was out of order. Staff were generally indifferent to rude. This La Quinta is not worthy of the brand...somebody needs to clean up their act. Never again

Called on a Tuesday night directly to the Santa Ana location and was given a "guaranteed reservation" for a late check in on Wednesday night.  When I went to check in the clerk advised me that our room had been given to an Expedia customer and there were no more rooms available.  I asked how this could happen and all she could say was it was Expedia's fault and that my credit card had not been charged.  She then indicated that the manager on duty Sara had set up a room for us at a motel about 10 mins away.  When I arrived at the new motel it was in a horrible part of town and the tenants out front were gang members.  I didn't even pull all the way in the driveway before I turned around to leave.  How dare them send you to a place like that.  I think the manager should spend the

Summary Heading: Better than our other LaQuinta experience...
Summary: Located in "the city"...you do need a car to get around. Traffic is terrible and expect to drive over 30 min. to the beach.  It's located about 6 miles from UC Irvine.   I was very weary about arriving here b/c our prior experience earlier that week on our road trip w/ La Quinta (Berkeley) was so poor.  Corporate is useless in answering your requests (if they do at all).  I called a couple of times and finally got some of my requests (so I thought).  Upon check-in, find that they're totally over sold and sending people to Motel 6 etc. I was thinking to myself, yep, all La Quintas are terrible.  But Lisa, the gal working (poor girl, the only one working) was so super sweet & friendly....bless her heart, she told me they ignored her notes and gave away our room.  I was patient and
i stayed here because i needed a place to stay with my dogs. It was very nice for the price. The employees were friendly, and the room was lovely. Very nice sitting and kitchen area.

I would say you get slightly more than you pay for at this hotel. It's really inexpensive, and with free parking, free breakfast, free wi-fi, friendly staff (awesome waffle lady) you really couldn't ask for more. The rooms are very average motel-ish, no flat screen tv or anything fancy, and it's not the most contemporary of decors but remember, you didn't pay that much so don't expect a 5 star room.

The property offers plenty of features and it looks nice and fresh with the yellow paint scheme but it fails to hide the old structure underneath. Our room had nice furniture, free high speed internet and a good working A/C. The bathroom had a chipped painted tub, but otherwise was OK. Breakfast is free but was pretty mediocre. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Each time we came back to the room there was this musty smell that went away as soon as we turned on the A/C. No nearby restaurants, just other hotels/motels. Freeway 55 access just down the street, very convenient. Stay on the outside if you want to avoid pool noise. Vibrations from people walking past your room can be clearly felt inside. Can't really recommend the property but I guess it's OK if you

Will we drove for nine hours check in and was told that we couldn't use the pool becuse they rented it out to a party for the day, Next we get to are room and open the door and a stink of smoke hit us in the face smoking room I gess, Next the sink at the kitchen and the bathroom was backed up with a nasty black oil, WHATS UP! O-ya did I forget to mention that my wife went to change the paper in the bathroom and a CRACK PIPE fell out of the center of the roll... Ya a CRACK PIPE! NICE NASTY PLACE!

Summary Heading: Average Hotel and a good price
Summary: Stayed here at the last minute one night.  Got a great price on Priceline.  It's a fairly nice hotel, just a little old.  Slight smell of stale smoke when I first got into the room.  The room was otherwise clean and in good shape.  The bed was comfortable and the A/C worked great.

We had stayed at this hotel for the couple nights we went to visit Disneyland since it was away from the hustle and bustle of the park and overall it wasn't a bad stay. They had a very easy and courteous check-in process plus a nice continental breakfast with made to order waffles. There was plenty of parking around the whole hotel and a pool and jacquzzi on the premises. Also they do provide a pretty nice size fridge and a microwave if you ever need to use one in your room.  I did learn by the time I got to the hotel was that they do provide shuttle service from Orange County airport and also they can drive you over to the new mall area called The District. It is a huge outdoor mall area with many different kind of shops and movie theater. The drive to the mall is only about 5

Huge room, number 131, for 60 bucks a night.  A good bargain for the money, but I don't know if I would stay there again unless I needed the extra space in the room. It had bright cheery yellow orange colors. It was kind of plain overall.  Like a suite with a frig, micro and sink for the bar area and large 13x13 living room area with sofa bed. Then separate area for king sized bed. Bed was very comfortable. Fan made noise in bathroom and bathtub dripped and made occasional noise.  but kind of noisy, maybe it was just the location, might have different on an upper floor. By noisy I mean that you could easily hear people walk by with suitcases, one person was whistling at 6am. I got a random phone call one night at 11pm that woke me up, but those were random events. The room was

We paid $60 per night, so considering the time we travelled, we were quite happy. The rooms are spacious, clean and well equipped. It is close to major theme parks, shopping, etc. The breakfast was good as well (fresh fruit, bagels, cereal, waffles, decent orange juice, etc.) I do not know what the rating of this hotel is, but i would rate it a 4 star. It isn't luxurious, but it is way above any of the other national chain hotels/motels I have stayed at. However, that might say a little too much about me.

Summary Heading: They had shampooed the carpet before our arrival & were concerned it wasn't dry
Summary: I was thrilled to hear they shampooed, I was not  going to lay on the floor. It was fine, the room was clean, stylish, spacious & quiet. THERE WAS NO EXTRA CHARGE FOR OUR DOG!! The staff was polite & helpful, Lisa @ the front desk had helped me on the phone prior to our arrival. She was great, remembered my name & made sure we had our requests ASAP. It seemed to be a busy weekend, yet the breakfast courtyard area flowed & was pleasant. All the regular breakfast options, PLUS you can make your own waffles!! Location was perfect, access to 55, 405, 5, 22 & 57 fwys. I recommend the dog beach in Huntington beach for anyone with kids or dogs, It was great & not to far. 405 exit Warner to Goldenwest, to PCH, Go right & your there.

We chose this hotel because of location, breakfast, free parking, microwave & fridge, and free wireless internet. When we arrived and went to our room we discovered it was already occupied. That's a little unnerving thinking that the staff isn't on top of something like that! We were given another room, of course, and were past the worst of our experience there. What a pleasant surprise to have a very clean room with no bad smells or stale air. It appeared to be recently renovated. The decor and furnishings were spartan. The beds were very comfortable. I usually have a tough time sleeping anywhere because of physical ailments but I slept very comfortably.  The breakfast had a number of choices. I have stayed at other hotels in the area including Doubletree and Holiday Inn. In my

Summary Heading: Good option in Orange Co. for the price
Summary: Looking for a deal and accessibility to where I needed to be in Orange County, I looked outside Irvine to Santa Ana.  This property had the right price and had been recently renovated.  I had a room on the 2nd floor facing the inside courtyard.  Never heard much traffic or airport noise, though the birds started early... but that's not bad, per se. Pros:  Big room, good waffles for breakfast, free wireless internet, good location for getting around Orange Co. Cons:  No hooks in bathroom.  Exterior hasn't had as much work as the interior and hallways can look a little shabby.

Summary Heading: Best buy for travelers with pets
Summary: I go to the SoCal beaches about every 3 weeks during the summer and almost always stay here because it is convenient, inexpensive, clean, and pet friendly.  This hotel used to be Woolys Petite Suites although the rooms were "suites" only because there was a waist-high divider in the room.  Woolys was also a good buy but not pet friendly.  It changed to La Quinta a few years ago.  Major changes included a complete remodeling.  The furniture is new but somewhat spartan.  The beds are comfortable however.  Rooms have a fridge and microwave.  Woolys' made to order free breakfast has given way to a continental with waffles.  I do not like most La Qunitas as they are usually old and run down but this is an exception.  Because of its great prices, families and teen-age sports teams

I've stayed at this property on more than one occasion and each time it has gotten better.   The rooms are very spacious, with a big work desk, a couch and the bed is actually somewhat separated by a closet/wall in the middle of the room.   The only downside to the rooms are that they do open to outdoor areas, such as the courtyard or the areas outside the hotel. Also, the TV is on the desk, so it is a bit far away from the bed.   I found the staff to be very helpful, especially the attendant who helps with breakfast. While there may not be a "hot" breakfast, there are still plenty of options.   In addition, the wireless internet works great and the bed is comfy. I'd definitely stay here again, especially for the great rates you can get.

Summary Heading: Some good, so not so good
Summary: We found this location to be a fairly good hotel, and a good rate obtained by booking direct for three nights in advance and using our AAA membership discount.  The hotel staff were fairly accomodating, except they allowed screaming children to carry on at the pool past the posted time of closure at 10:00 pm.  It is also posted that there be a responsible adult present... (I could rant about the permissiveness of parents these days, but perhaps that is for a different forum.) When the front desk was called at 10:25 pm, I asked when the pool closed, and was informed at 10:30 pm.  I made the comment that the kids were screaming and hoped it would stop soon.  It stopped about 20 minutes later at about 10:45 pm.  The complimentary breakfast (between 7 and 9 am) did not have sausage

okay, so  i had researched the reviews for this hotel A LOT! my mother is a very picky hotel stayer and it was great! Easy to get to, had places to eat around. The rooms were clean, staff was nice, pool and hot tub were great! Continental breakfast surprised me because i was under the impression it would just be like bagels and coffee but they had waffles and baked goods and cereal so it was more than i was expecting. There was always parking and internet was free and fast! TV was great, and overall it was a great experience. i would definitely recommend it to a family on vacation.

My husband and I stayed here and the rooms smelled musty.  At first I thought it was a stale smoke smell.  I then realized it was a lingering pet smell.  We had to ask for a differenct room because there was a giany leak in the bathroom that had the counter and floor completly wet.  Our other room smelled worse and had a huge stain on the floor.  We checked out at 2am because the smell was making me sick.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a centralized area
Summary: We stayed here for a Fri/Sat night stay to see the Angels play the Yankees and have some time at the beach. We chose this place because it was just about midway between both with easy access to the freeway. Also we have stayed at La Quinta's before and had good experiences, this one was no different.  Our room was clean and very spacious. There was a living area and bedroom area that was separated by a closet in the middle. There is a large wet bar area that has a refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was a little on the smallish side, but I think it was mostly due to the placement of the door. The sink area was inside the bathroom, which could be inconvient if there were a family of four sharing a room and all trying to get ready. Although the wet bar is in the room and does

Well, I have had a lot of problems at La Quinta Inns and this experience wasn't much different.  The pool is nice but in the middle of the property, so the noise in the rooms from the pool is pretty loud.  The rooms was musty and smelled like smoke, so I left the fan on all day, instead of auto, but the maids would turn it off, so it took awhile every night to get some fresher air to the place.  Staff weren't very helpful.  I like to use hotwire, but I keep getting La Quinta Inns, so I am questioning how much more I will use them for the 2.5 star hotels.

We stayed 14 days at the Santa Ana LaQuinta on Hotel Terrace.  It is conveniently located -- close access to the 55 and 5 highways in Orange County.  The rooms were clean, large, and serviced early each day.  The pool area is very nice.  We loved the outside access to our room and stayed on the "inside" which made it extremely easy to get to the pool and the breakfast area.  Breakfast was great!  The young lady that works the breakfast area was always helpful and kept the area well stocked.  A hearty breakfast of waffles, yogurt, fruit, rolls, muffins, hard boiled eggs, etc. saved us money and time each day.    It is not "fancy" -- but it is clean and comfortable with great air conditioning, showers, and good service.  We will return there again!

Just returned from a 5 night stay. My King suite had a living room area and bedroom area. Lots of room. Everything worked. Loved having a small refrigerator and microwave. Room was clean. Free breakfast includes a choice of 3 cereals, yogurt, bagel, toast, fruit, huge Belgian waffle, pastries, and drinks. Staff in lobby and breakfast area were friendly and helpful. Conveniently located a block from the freeway. 10 minute drive to Laguna Beach. Enjoyed the hot whirlpool and regular pool. I slept better than I do at most hotels. Could hear a little noise and water in pipes from other rooms. Would stay here again.

This hotel is located on a street called Hotel Terrace. It's pretty easy to figure out what's going to be surrounding the hotel. Yep, more hotels.  This small street is then capped by two restaurants at either end. It's easily located near the freeway. And also a quick drive to Disneyland.   The modern looking rooms were well appointed  My room had a king size bed that was firm yet comfortable. Also, a microwave, fridge, plenty of storage space for people who like to bring their own food. No mini-bar, everything is on a bring your own basis.  Pets are allowed but there wasn’t an indication, either by smell or hair, that pets had occupied my room. The room was immaculate.    The staff was friendly and helpful. With the exception of one sullen young woman who couldn’t manage to

The hotel was very clean.  The location was perfect, we were minutes from Laguna beach, newport beach, and huntington beach, we were also less than 10 minutes from Disneyland and much more.   Plus the neighborhood was nice and we were not scared to go out after dark.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with anything that we needed.  They serve a hot breakfast each morning with sausage, scrambled eggs, fruits, pastries, cereals, fresh made waffles, juice, milk, and much more.  The selection was great and the food was actually good.  I was very impressed with everything about my stay.  The pool was really heated and clean, as well as the hot tub.  I cant wait to plan my next trip to CA, I will definately be staying here again.

Well it was my first time in Santa Ana and I must say it felt like home.  I was greated with kindness and through out my stay that kindness follow'd.  I was there on a business and enjoyed the complimentary breakfeast as well as the breakfeast staff.  Very SWEET.(thank you ALL).  I stayed for about a week and had an awsome time.  NO COMPLAINTS HERE.  I will definetly come back again.  Thank you to all STAFF who made my stay an enjoyable one.  Kisses to YOU ALL.

Summary Heading: my last night at that hotel !
Summary: For 15+  years I stayed at the Woolley's Petite Suites hotel , We loved the breakfast in the morning ( BIG thanks to the mexican lady's that served the breakfast every morning !!! ) The clean suites felt like my second home when I entered them , pool and hottube were great to relax in , and for sure we did have a great time during managers happy hour , thanks to the people that served our drinks , and spent some nice time while we had our drinks . This is all gone now , sinds new management I need to find new hotel , but it will never be like the Woolley's day's again .... Staff changed , breakfast is poor , no drinks ..... and no clean rooms anymore . Ben from Belgium .

We stayed here for two nights because they accept pets. If I had another choice, I would have stayed somewhere else.  When we checked in we asked for a non-smoking room. The room they gave us was decorated nicely but it smelled strongly of smoke. We asked to be moved, but the next room smelled just a strongly of mold.  There were always several painters standing in the courtyard smoking and watching the guests. There were cigarette butts on the ground outside our room. It's not terrible, but not a la quinta we will stay at again.

My family of two boys aged 2 and 6 as well as myself and my wife stayed at La Quinta in Sept.06 and loved the place. The front of house staff greeted us warmly and check in took no time at all. We had a nice and large room on the third floor with a Queen and a pullout sofa. There was a small fridge and a breakfast table in the room as well.  The hotel was so close to the freeway and 15 min to Disney,1 hour+ to Universal, 2 hours from Seaworld and Sandiego Zoo.  The best thing about the hotel is the breakfast in the morning. The ladies who make your eggs etc. are so sweet and the food offered is quite enjoyable for the free price. Our boys loved chosing what they wanted everyday. Remember to tip them! We asked the front desk for ideas and directions everyday and they were so

While obviously a refurbished hotel, the La Quinta has an impressive lobby and is among the cleanest hotels I've ever seen in any class.  The help are very gracious and helpful.  The free breakfast is the best I've seen at a budget hotel, with ample cereals, fruit, and, surprisingly, excellent do-it-yourself waffles.  A good, clean pool.  The rooms, as I said, are very clean.  Our biggest problem was the air conditioning in the room, which was simply not good.  At first we thought the bulky armchair placed directly in front of the window unit was blocking it, but even with the chair moved (though the room was small enough there was nowhere to easily put it) the air conditioning was feeble at best, "cooling" only a narrow corridor down the middle of the room, and not hitting the
